loans.name: Akouélé

texts.fr: Mariée et âgé de 48 ans, Akouélé est une femme très entreprenante et active dans la gestion de ses besoins. Avec trois enfants à charge, Akouélé habite à Adamavo pour vendre de la pate bandée pour la restauration de ses clients. Ce commerce lui apporte son bénéfice et Akouélé s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter un sac de maïs et des poissons, Akouélé demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande et réaliser assez de profit pour répondre favorablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akouélé is a 48-year-old married woman, very enterprising and active in managing her needs.

With three children, she lives in Adamavo where she sells prepared mush for her customers. This trade generates her income and she resupplies once a month at the market.

Akouele is requesting this loan to buy a bag of maize and fish, so she can generate enough profit to respond positively to her family's needs.

loans.use: buy one bag of maize and eight kilos of fish

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is 67 years old and a pensioner from the Senaki district. She lives alone and works as a cleaner at a local hospital. 

Nanuli wants to start trading in clothes and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables Nanuli to get a loan of 1,000 USD. With the received credit she will purchase clothes in order to resell them at a higher price and generate income. With increased income Nanuli will improve her living conditions. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading in clothes.

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr: A 41 ans, Edoh est une femme mariée et vit avec trois enfants à Adamavo. Bien consciente de son état elle vend des produits d’alimentations générales et des tubercules  dans son quartier afin de générer un bénéfice pouvant couvrir les charges quotidiennes. Edoh achète son stock auprès de ses fournisseurs quatre fois par mois et en tire assez de profits. Edoh désire ce crédit pour commander des paniers de tomates, des oignons et des ignames afin de trouver son bénéfice pour subvenir favorablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
41 years old, Edoh is a married woman living with her three children in Adamavo. Well aware of her situation, she sells general food products and yams locally in order to make enough profit to cover her daily expenses.
Edoh buys her stock from her suppliers four times a month and makes sufficient profit from the activity. She is requesting this loan to buy baskets of tomatoes, onions and yams to make the profit she requires to successfully meet the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy two baskets of tomatoes, two baskets of onions and two loads of yams.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé vit à Adamavo et est âgée de 35 ans. Mariée, Ayélé est mère de cinq enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Restauratrice, Ayélé vend de la nourriture dans son quartier pour satisfaire ses clients et avoir son revenu pour leur subsistance. Ayélé s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs riz, de maïs et de la patte de bœuf, Ayélé demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire pour promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ayélé lives in Adamavo and is 35 years old. She is the mother of five children and works hard in order to ensure their education. Ayélé has a restaurant business and sells food in her neighbourhood that pleases her customers and generates enough income for the family to live on. 
Ayélé buys her supplies once a month at the market. She is requesting this loan to be able to order sacks of rice, corn and beef patty - this will allow her to generate the necessary profit to put her children's education first.

loans.use: to buy one sack of rice, one sack of corn and a carton of beef patty.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 46 ans, Abla est une femme mère de cinq enfants. Abla habite à Adamavo et vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour leur épanouissement. Pour arriver à ses fins, Abla s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois dans un marché local. Pour commander un bidon d’huile rouge, un sac de riz et un sac de sucre, Abla demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Married and 46 years old, Abla is the mother of five children. She lives in Adamavo and sells general food products locally, to generate the profit she needs for the family's requirements. To do this, Abla buys her stock four times a month in a local market. 
Abla is requesting this loan in order to complete the purchase of a can of red oil, a bag of rice and a bag of sugar. This will generate income so she can help her husband with the children's education costs.

loans.use: to buy one can of red oil, one bag of rice and one bag of sugar.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, Ama est une femme qui a deux enfants à sa charge. Habitant à Adamavo, Ama est très dynamique et active pour assurer les charges quotidiennes. Ama vend de la pate de manioc à ses clients et réalise un revenu favorable. Ama s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois. Ama sollicite ce microcrédit pour acheter des sacs de manioc et avoir assez de profits pour promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
38-year-old Ama is a woman with two children under her care. Living in Adamavo, she is very dynamic and active in dealing with daily expenditures.

Ama sells cassava paste to her customers and generates a favorable income. She resupplies at the market twice a month.

Ama is requesting this micro-credit loan to buy bags of cassava so she can generate enough profits to promote her children's education.

loans.use: buy four bags of cassava

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is a 20-year-old single lady from Nablus city. Her father works as a taxi driver where he gets a low income. Dalia is a student in the university where she studies Information Technology. She wants to complete her study and find a job in the future to improve her family's living conditions.

Dalia took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Dalia will be able to do her homework and write reports easily. Dalia appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Tacina

texts.en:
Tacina works hard to support her family. Tacina is married and has a buy and sell of fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

Tacina has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Tacina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 52 years old, married and has two children. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 30 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Perlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Chiyanjano Group

texts.en: Regina is 36 years and married with seven children and only three of her children go to school. She sells tomatoes, rice and Irish potatoes as her main means of survival. She started this business in order to uplift her living standards and to pay schools fees for her children. She will use the loan to buy more products for her business in order to increase her returns. Regina will also use the loan to pay medical and school fees for her children. Regina hopes to be self-reliant. The loans have helped Regina to become independent.

loans.use: to buy rice, tomatoes and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is married with five children, all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. 
 
Hamida sells milk at the market on a retail basis, and she works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the perishability of milk. She generates additional income from rental rooms. 

She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy cans of milk, blue band margarine, tea leaves, coffee and loaves of bread. Her goal is to serve her customers better and make more sales, and to buy a better fridge.

loans.use: to buy cans of milk, blue band margarine, tea leaves, coffee and loaves of bread, in order to serve her customers better and make more sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees for the new semester.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old single man from Nablus city. He works as an employee in a restaurant where he gets a low income. Mohammad is also a student in the university where he studies Business Administration. He wants to complete his studies and find a better job in the future to improve his family's living conditions.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fees for the new semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses he has.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the new semester.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is grateful that she was granted a 35,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her ornamental business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. Aside from her ornamental business, she also sells bananas as shown in her photo. 

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy various kinds of fruits such as bananas, pineapple and "guyabano" (soursop), which are among the favorites of the Filipinos. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her and a good return on her investment for it will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs. 

Angelina aims to grow her fruit selling business and hopes to buy a sidecar to transport her fruits. She dreams of improving their quality of life and prays for good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for various kinds of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Ramanzani

texts.en:
Ramazan lives in Namungona, a city outskirt. He is married with two children who are in school.

He sells green bananas locally referred to as matooke to earn an income. He has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy more matooke to meet his customers' needs. This will help him buy cheaply in bulk and to minimize the transport costs. He is hardworking and honest and appreciates the support. He pledges to work hard, meet his repayments on time and take his children to good schools.

loans.use: To buy matooke to sell

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 33 years old, married and has two children. One of her children is in school.

Janice is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Janice has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Janice would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a toilet in her bathroom inside her house to make it more secure and hygienic.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa es una gran mujer  de 36 años de edad, es soltera con cuatro hermosos hijos de las edades entre 3 y 18 años, esta hermosa  familia vive en una comunidad  de Suchitepéquez.
Nicolasa trabaja de sol a sol para darle a su familia lo mejor, ella trabaja como barrendera en la municipalidad de su comunidad desde hace tres años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la venta de locones y tortillas.
Ahora Nicolasa ha pensado en construir un dormitorio, pues año con año sus necesidades van aumentando porque sus hijos van creciendo, aunque una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar sus materiales por tal razón solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, blocks, arena, hierro.
El gran sueño de Nicolasa es poder construir más cuartos para sus hijos y que ellos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is 36 years old, single and has four beautiful children, of ages between three years and eighteen years. This beautiful family lives in a community in Suchitepéquez.

Nicolasa works every day in order to give her family the best that she can. She has been working as a road sweeper for the local community for three years. In order to increase her income, she also works selling tortillas and other items.

Nicolasa wants to build another bedroom in her house. Every year she needs new things as her children are growing. One of Nicolasa’s difficulties is that she does not have enough capital to buy building materials. She is therefore applying for a loan that she will use to buy cement, bricks, sand, and building rods.

Nicolasa’s big dream is to be able to build more bedrooms for her children, and for them to enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, and metal rods.

loans.name: Las Chaskas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS CHASKAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lizet ella es soltera y tiene 27 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "LAS CHASKAS" which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

One of the members is Lizet, 27, who is single and has two children.  She has a food business and makes different dishes like roast chicken, soups, and grilled meats.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and has been in business for eight years.  Things are going very well for her and her goal is to open a restaurant.  The loan she is requesting is to buy food products such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

The other members have businesses in animal sales, clothing sales, a grocery store and food sales.

Lizet is grateful to everyone taking part in her dream and she is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy food products such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her farming through application of modern farming technology to earn more income and improve family living standards.

loans.name: Nitzimin Group

texts.es:
Nitzimin es un vocablo mazahua cuyo significado es “Capilla” y también es el nombre del grupo formado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras originarias de una comunidad perteneciente al Estado de México que aún conserva la lengua, cultura y costumbres de sus antepasados. Los habitantes tienen un profundo respeto por la tierra pues es de donde obtienen el alimento necesario para vivir. 
  Dentro del grupo Silvina y María Ignacia se dedican a realizar bordados, Margarita y Eugenia manejan una tienda de abarrotes y una tienda escolar, respectivamente. 
   Doña Margarita es de un carácter sumamente alegre, en su comunidad todos le llaman Mago. Está casada con Don Fortino desde hace dieciocho años y han procreado a cuatro hijos, todos ellos estudiantes; dos de nivel preparatoria y dos de secundaria. 
   Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar Doña Mago inició a vender productos de abarrotes en su comunidad. Sobre una carretilla colocaba distintos productos y después salía a las calles a ofrecer dicha mercancía de casa en casa, esta actividad duró tres años. Posteriormente y con el apoyo de VisionFund México pudo construir un local de manera que su negocio ha crecido considerablemente, esto le ha dado confianza para seguir adelante y solicitar un nuevo apoyo. 
   Doña Mago siempre trata de mantener la variedad y buen estado de sus productos por lo que no le preocupa la competencia. Con el apoyo del préstamo abastecería su tienda de productos más demandados como leche o azúcar. Además, Mago está entusiasmada y se propuso como meta seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que se desarrollen profesionalmente, además desea adquirir un medio para transportar los abarrotes con mayor facilidad.
    

*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín municipal, Doña Margarita es quien sostiene la servilleta, artesanía que también elabora y vende para tener un ingreso extra.
texts.en:
Nitzimin is a word in the Mazahuan language which means "Chapel".  It is also the name of the group formed by four working women from a community in the state of Mexico which still maintains the languague, culture and traditions of its ancestors.  The local people have a profound respect for the earth which provides the food they need to survive.

In the group, Silvina and Maria Ignacia run embroidery businesses, and Margarita and Eugenia have a grocery store and a school supplies store, respectively.

Margarita is known for being very cheerful and everyone calls her Mago.  She has been married to Fortino for 18 years and they have four children who attend school; two in high school and two in junior high.

To help cover household expenses, Mago started selling groceries in her community.  She used to put an array of products on a cart and go out into the streets to sell her merchandise door to door.  She did this for three years, but with the help of VisionFund Mexico she was able to build a store so her business has grown considerably.  This has given her the confidence to continue and seek a new loan. 

Mago always tries to stock a variety of good products but she worries about competition.  With the help of the loan she can stock her store with the most popular items such as milk and sugar.  Mago's goal is to continue supporting her children in their studies so they can become professionals.  She also wants to acquire a vehicle to transport the groceries more easily.


* The picture was taken in the municipal garden.  Margarita is the one holding a napkin she made.  She also makes and sells crafts for extra income.

loans.use: To buy groceries such as milk and sugar.

location.town: SAN NICOAS GUADALUPE, SAN FELIPE DEL PROGRESO

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is widowed with six children and they all go to school. She does not take care of any additional family members. She sells charcoal from home at   both retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges include thieves and the rainy season, which hinders movements. Rose lives in her own house and has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food. Rose has requested a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She aspires to grow her business so that she can become a wholesaler and she wants to educate her children through university.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es:
Alcira es una mujer de 47 años de edad, ella es muy emprendedora, trabajadora y curiosa, le insistió mucho a su esposo para que le enseñara todas las labores del campo ya que quería apoyarlo con los gastos de la casa, su esposo muy noble le decía que se quedara en casa que él trabajaba y la mantenía junto con su hija de 19 años de edad, pero ella insistía en que quería trabajar, luego de que su esposo cedería, aprendió todo de él y hoy en día es una orgullosa y productiva empresaria que brinda 3 empleos en su cultivo.

Cada día que pasa muestra las cualidades que tiene, incluso si se lo propone supera a su esposo, ella en verdad le pone empeño y amor a su trabajo.

Su sueño es  que junto con su esposo comprar una vivienda, convertir este terreno en una finca y tener los dos un cultivo enorme de muchas hectáreas.

Alcira quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de abonos, riegos, gallinaza, pesticidas, insecticidas, insumos para el sostenimiento de cultivos, parte del préstamo lo quiere destinar al pago de las prima de sus empleados.
texts.en:
Alcira is a 47 year old woman who is very entrepreneurial, hard-working and curious.  She strongly insisted that her husband teach her about all the jobs involved in farm work because she wanted to help with household expenses.  Her husband, a kind man, said that she should stay at home and that he would look after her and their 19 year old daughter.  

However, she insisted that she wanted to work and eventually her husband agreed. She learned everything from him and today she is a proud and productive business woman who employs three people on her farm. 

With every passing day she demonstrates the qualities that she has by putting determination and love into her work, even surpassing her husband.  

Her dream is, together with her husband, to buy a home, convert the land into a farm and for them both to have a large farm with many acres.

Alcira wants to apply for a loan in order to buy fertilizer, irrigation, hen droppings, pesticides, insecticides and supplies in order to sustain crops.  She wants to use part of the loan to pay her employees a bonus.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, irrigation, hen droppings, pesticides, fungicides and pay her employees.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is thankful for his previous 10,000 PHP loan, which he used to pay for tire replacement and maintenance of his tricycle. His earnings helped cover his family's personal household expenses. 

He has applied for another 15,000 PHP loan, which he will use to pay for ongoing maintenance of his tricycle. It is important that his vehicle is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service. He thanks God for the safe trips and good turnout of his service. Financial help will help fund his family's everyday needs. 

Eduardo aims to own more tricycles to serve more clients and improve his livelihood. He wants to give his wife and kids a good life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for regular maintenance and tires for his tricycle.

loans.name: Géminis Group

texts.es:
Hay una comunidad del Estado de México que tiene festividades muy arraigadas y son motivo de júbilo entre sus habitantes. Una de las más celebres se realiza el mes de enero y dura aproximadamente una semana, en la cual hay corridas de caballos, rifas, bailes, quema de cuetes y, sobre todo, una gran variedad de comercios. 
   En dicho lugar se conformó el grupo Géminis: Erica y Saturnina invertirán en ropa; Jessica, en su herrería; Ofelia, en cerdos y pollos; Carmen, en su taquería; Lidia, en cerdos y Don José, en colchas.
   Desde hace dieciocho años Doña Felisa y su esposo Luis decidieron que para solventar los gastos de su hogar y pagar con mayor facilidad los gastos de educación de sus hijos, comenzarían a criar y vender borregos. "En especial porque mi esposo tiene un gusto por este tipo de animales, gracias a Dios nos ha funcionado muy bien” comento Doña Felisa quien siempre está sonriendo.
   El proceso de crianza lo realiza de la siguiente manera; primero compra los animales desde muy pequeños, después los alimenta y engorda durante casi nueve meses, finalmente ya que han alcanzado el tamaño y peso adecuado los puede vender a un mejor precio. Gracias a la experiencia adquirida y excelente trato siempre ha tenido clientes.
   La principal motivación de Doña Felisa es apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios, “me gustaría que mi hija pudiera realizar sus sueños como profesionista” dice emocionada, pretende de igual forma mejorar su vivienda. 
   En esta ocasión pretende invertir el préstamo en la compra de dos becerros y alimento necesario para su crianza. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el punto de reunión del grupo, Doña Felisa es quien viste el suéter verde*
texts.en:
There is a community in the state of Mexico which celebrates very traditional holidays for the enjoyment of the local people.  One of the most popular ones is in the month of January and lasts about a week.  There are horse races, raffles, dances, fireworks and, mainly, a wide variety of commercial activity.

This is where the Geminis Group was formed: Erica and Saturnina work in the clothing business; Jessica in hardware; Ofelia in pigs and chickens; Carmen in a taco stand; Lidia in pigs and Jose in bedspreads.

Some 18 years ago, Felisa and her husband, Luis, decided to cover household expenses and pay for their children's education costs by raising and selling sheep.  "Especially because my husband likes this type of animal, and thank God it has gone very well for us." says Felise who is always smiling.

The process for raising sheep is the following.  First, the animals are purchases very young, then they are fed over a nine-month period.  Finally, once they reach the proper size and weight, they are sold at the best price.  Thanks to experience and excellent service, they always have had customers.

Felisa's main motivation is to support her children in their education, "I would like my daughter to meet her goal of becoming a professional." she says very touched.  She also wants to remodel her house.

On this occasion she needs a loan to buy two bull calves and the necessary feed to raise them.

*The picture was taken at the group meeting point.  Felisa is the one in a green jacket*

loans.use: To buy two bull calves and feed.

loans.name: Cotilda

texts.en:
Cotilda lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and two go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses includes school fees, rent and food.

Cotilda sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis, and she has been in this business for the last seven years. She works six days a week. Her major challenges include transportation and defaulters.  

She has requested a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. 

She would like to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Familia La Capilla De San Jorge Group

texts.es:
Don Roberto vive en una comunidad del Estado de México, es de carácter alegre y actitud trabajadora, es padre de cinco hijos que continúan con sus estudios académicos. 
   Proveniente de una generación de panaderos, Don Roberto conserva el oficio y delicioso sabor de su producto. Cuando decidió formar su familia necesitó emprender el negocio por su cuenta. Al inicio no tenía nada, pero su papá lo apoyó prestándole un horno, algunas charolas y un pequeño puesto, así comenzó con la venta de pan de feria.  En menos de un año Roberto logró regresar todo el material que le prestaron ya que su negocio marchaba a la perfección. El crecimiento fue gradual pero a prisa, en un sólo año logró establecer dos puestos y actualmente ya cuenta con cuatro; en cada uno de ellos trabajan dos empleados.
   Roberto está muy contento por dar trabajo a otras personas. Sin embargo, debe ausentarse de casa durante varios días debido a que las ferias se realizan pueblos aledaños y se prolongan durante varios días. Por otro lado, existe mucha competencia pero Don Roberto se muestra confiado “Ya hay muchos panaderos y es más difícil obtener buenas ganancias pero también ya son muchos años de experiencia y el buen sabor es el que nos identifica de los demás”. 
   Con el préstamo que ha solicitado comprará harina, huevos, levadura, azúcar etc. para continuar con el trabajo y hacer su sueño realidad: expandir el negocio con el propósito de apoyar económicamente a sus hijos en sus carreras profesionales. Su hijo mayor estudia la preparatoria y quiere ser dentista; otro, doctor; una de sus hijas, asistente de vuelo; la otra niña, aún no lo decide y el más pequeño dice que quiere continuar con el negocio de su papá. 
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Yeny quien invertirá en un cibercafé mientras que Mayte y Ofelia invertirán en el negocio de pan de feria. Todos están muy agradecidos por la oportunidad de recibir un préstamo.

*La foto fue tomada en el jardín del municipio aparecen los cuatro integrantes*
texts.en:
Roberto lives in a community in Mexico which is known for its cheerful, hard-working attitude.  He is the father of five children who continue their education.

Coming from a generation of bakers, Roberto maintains the trade and delicious flavor of his products.  When he decided to form a family he had to start his own business.  At first he had nothing but his father helped out by lending him an oven, a few pans and a small stall.  That is how he started selling bread at markets.  In less than a year, Robert was able to pay back his father since his business was running perfectly.  Growth was gradual but speedy and in only a year he was able to establish two stalls.  Now he has four with two employees at each one.

Roberto is very happy to provide work for other people.  However, he must be away from home at certain times because of the markets that have to be set up in neighboring villages and last several days.  There is also a lot of competition, but Roberto shows confidence, "There are many bakers and it is hard to make a good profit but I also have many years of experience and a distinct flavor which sets us apart from the others".

He plans to use the loan he is requesting to buy flour, eggs, yeast, sugar, etc. to continue his work and reach his goal of expanding his business in order to support his children in their professional careers.  His eldest son is in high school and wants to be a dentist; another one, a doctor; one of his daughters, a flight attendant; and the other daughter still does not know.  The youngest wants to continue the business that his father has set up.

The other members of the group are Yeny who will invest in a cybercafe, and Mayte and Ofelia who will invest in their bread businesses.  All the members are very grateful for the opportunity of receiving this loan.

*The picture was taken in the municipal garden and all four members are present*

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, yeast, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres De Paculam Nahuala Sector Bethel Group

texts.es:
Irma es una muchacha de 20 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a su hijo de dos años en una comunidad de Nahualá.
Irma (es la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su hijo se dedica  a la compra y venta  de ropa típica, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace 3 años.
Irma con el objetivo de mejorar su negocio, ha tomado la decisión  de solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de cortes, blusas, fajas típicas, para poder brindarle a la clientela un mejor servicio ofreciéndoles una variedad de colores, estilos y precios.
El gran sueño de Irma es poder construir una casa y buscar un local donde pueda exhibir mejor sus productos del negocio.
texts.en:
Irma is 20 years old, single and lives with her two-year-old son in a Nahuala community.

She is the first one from the left in the picture.  She earns a living to support her son by buying and selling typical clothing.  She has been in business for three years.

In order to improve her business, Irma has decided to request a loan to buy typical skirt fabrics, blouses and waistbands to give her customers the best service she can regarding variety in color, style and prices.

Her greatest dream is to build a house and look for a shop where she can display her products better.

loans.use: To buy and sell typical skirt fabric, blouses, and waistbands.

loans.name: Améyovi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 46 ans, Améyovi est une femme mère de six enfants. Améyovi habite à Adamavo et vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour leur épanouissement. Pour arriver à ses fins, Améyovi s’approvisionne huit fois par mois dans un marché local. Pour commander un panier de tomates et des épices, Améyovi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Améyovi is 46 years old, married and has six children.  She lives in Adamavo and sells general foodstuffs in her neighbourhood to support her family.  She buys new supplies eight times a month from the local market.

Améyovi has requested this loan to buy a basket of tomatoes and spices.  Her earnings will help her husband provide for the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy 1 basket of tomatoes and 4 sacks of spices.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla vit à Adamavo et est âgée de 30 ans. Mariée, Abla est mère de deux enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Abla vend de la bouillie faite à base de la farine de manioc accompagnée de pains pour avoir son revenu pour leur subsistance. Abla s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bols de farine de manioc et des pains pour préparer la bouillie, Abla demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Abla lives in Adamavo.  She is 30 years old, married and mother to two children.  She works hard to provide for their education.  Abla sells cassava porridge accompanied by bread to earn a living.  She buys her supplies once a month from the market.

Abla has requested this loan to buy bowls of cassava flour and loaves of bread.  Her earnings will help provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy 20 bowls of cassava flour and 18 loaves of bread.

loans.name: Dayana Group

texts.es:
Hay dos cualidades que distinguen a una comunidad del Estado de México; la belleza de sus paisajes en donde convergen hermosas flores regionales y curiosos animales autóctonos, y la hospitalidad de sus habitantes que siempre están dispuestos a brindar la mejor atención a los visitantes foráneos. 
   Yolanda es una digna representante de su localidad se distingue por ser inteligente, perseverante, comprometida y trabajadora. Tiene dos hijos adolescentes que cursan actualmente la preparatoria. 
  Para mantener a la familia ella y su esposo Pablo decidieron establecer un negocio con artículos de tlapalería, mismo que colocan todos los días de tianguis. “Mi esposo me convenció de este negocio y yo decidí apoyarlo, con nuestros ahorros compramos herramienta que poco después vendimos” comenta Yolanda.
   Hasta ahora no han tenido dificultades en su trabajo, las ventas realizadas alcanzan perfectamente en la manutención de la casa y la educación de sus hijos; el resto lo invierten en la compra de más herramientas al igual que los préstamos. El negocio también le deja grandes satisfacciones personales aprende muchas lecciones de vida como el nunca darse por vencida. 
   Para Yolanda el dinero solo es un medio para alcanzar ciertas metas, pero lo que más valora son las enseñanzas y el ejemplo que espera puedan aprender de ella sus hijos. En este momento tiene un objetivo claro que es poder rentar algún local en el centro de la comunidad. De esta manera podrá obtener mejores ganancias lo que llevará a brindarles una mejor educación a sus hijos y con ello una mejor calidad de vida. 
   Los demás integrantes del grupo también están muy contentos y agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA porque podrán invertir en sus negocios como Braulio, Ma Guadalupe y Rosa quienes invertirán en ganado ovino; Dayana, en becerros y Doña Isabel invertirá en ropa. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en la fuente, corazón del parque del municipio, Doña Isabel viste un suéter rosa con playera blanca y Dayana, hija de Isabel, viste un abrigo blanco. El nombre del grupo lo eligió Isabel en honor a su hija*
texts.en:
There are two characteristics that distinguish a community in the Estado de Mexico; the beauty of its landscapes, where beautiful regional flowers converge with curious indigenous animals, and the hospitality of its citizens, who are always eager to bring their attention to foreign visitors. 
Yolanda is a worthy representative of her community. She is known for being intelligent, persevering, committed, and hard-working. She has two teenage sons who currently attend high school.
To support the family, she and her husband Pablo decided to open a business selling hardware store items, which they set up on the street market. “My husband convinced me about this business, and I decided to support him. With our savings we bought tools that we sold a short time later,” Yolanda says.
Until now they have had no difficulties with their work. Their sales are enough for the maintenance of their home and the education of their children. They invest the rest in the purchase of more tools, as well as the loans. The business gives her great personal satisfaction, she has learned many life lessons, such as never giving up. 
For Yolanda, money is only a means to reach certain goals. What she values the most are the lessons and the examples she hopes her children can learn from her. In this moment, she has one clear objective, which is to be able to rent a store in the center of the community. In this way, she will be able to obtain a better income, which will allow them to bring a better education to their children and with it a better quality of life. 
The other members of the group are also very happy and grateful to VisionFund and Kiva, because they will be able to invest in their business. Braulio, Ma. Guadalupe and Rosa will invest in sheep; Dayana, in calves; and Isabel, in clothing. 

*The photograph was taken by the fountain, in the heart of the park of the municipality. Isabel is wearing a pink sweater with a white shirt and Dayana, Isabel’s daughter, is wearing a white coat. The name of the group was chosen by Isabel in honor of her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase tools for a hardware store.

loans.name: Benkadi N°1 Group

texts.fr:
YAYA est le monsieur  qui a ses mains sur le mouton  sur la photo.
 YAYA  est un cultivateur malien, âgé  de 55 ans, marié  et père de 8 enfants âgés de 6 ans à 20 ans dont  3  scolarisées. Sa  conjointe  est une ménagère.
YAYA fait l’élevage de moutons  depuis plus de  11 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les  marchés environnants  et revend   dans les mêmes  marchés. Le profit qu’il  réalise lui permet  de  subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
Il emprunte de l’argent avec  le RMCR  pour acheter des moutons à élever , destiner à la vente au moment propice. 
Dans l’avenir, Yaya  souhaite avoir un prêt plus élevé pour  beaucoup dans l’élevage des moutons.
texts.en:
Yaya is seen in the photo, holding the sheep.  He is a Malian farmer, 55 years old, married and father to eight children.  His children are aged between six and twenty years, three of them attend school.  His wife takes care of their household.

Yaya has been raising sheep for eleven years.  He buys and sells his livestock in the local markets.  His earnings provide for the needs of his family.

To support his business, Yaya works with the field partner, RMCR.  In the future, he would like to take a bigger loan to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise and sell on.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres De Chuisanto Tomas Sector Escuela Group

texts.es:
Cristina una mujer amable  y perseverante  de 27 años de edad, ella es soltera vive junto a sus dos hijos de las edades entre 1 y 19 años. Esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Cristina (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) con el afán de generar sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica desde hace cuatro años, gracias a esta labor a sacado adelante a su familia.
Cristina gracias a su amabilidad con la que atiende su negocio ha logrado mucha clientela, pero ahora ella sea dado cuenta que día con día el mundo se encuentra más de moda, y que ella deberá mejorar sus productos,  pero una delas dificultades que ella tiene es que no tiene el capital necesario, por tal motivo solicita un Préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra güipiles, cortes y fajas para satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela.
Cristina tiene las esperanzas de poder construir su casa de blocks, y comprar terrenos para poder cultivar.
texts.en:
Cristina is a kind and persevering woman who is 27 years old. She is single and lives with her two sons aged between 1 and 19. This nice family lives in a community of Sololá. Cristina (first on the left in the photograph), with the eagerness to generate an income, has worked in the purchase and sale of typical clothing for four years. Thanks to this work, she has managed to help her family get ahead.
Cristina, thanks to the kindness with which she looks after her business, has gained a lot of customers. But now she has realized that day by day, the world is more interested in fashion, and she has to improve her products, but one of the difficulties is that she does not have the necessary capital. For this reason, she asks for a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of güipiles (regional dress), and other traditional garments, to satisfy the needs of her clientele. Cristina hopes to be able to build a house made of brick, and to buy a plot of land for cultivation.

loans.use: to buy and sell Güipiles (regional dress), and other traditional garments.

loans.name: Union Y Fuerza Group

texts.es: La Sra. Elizabeth tiene 44 años de edad, convive con el Sr. Ruben con quien tiene 4 hijos pero solo uno depende de ellos. Elizabeth tiene el cargo de presidenta en la alcancía comunal “UNION Y FUERZA” conformada por 6 mujeres muy responsables deseosas de salir adelante mediante el apoyo entre ellas y por parte de los inversionistas de KIVA. Elizabeth se dedica a tejer chompas, chalinas, etc. Adicional a ello vende desayuno, por eso que el préstamo lo invertirá en su negocio para comprar lana, hilo y demás materiales que necesita para tejer sus prendas de vestir, así de esta manera apoya en cubrir los gastos del hogar y brindar mejor calidad de vida para su familia que tanto quiere. Uno de los sueños que tiene Elizabeth es que su negocio siga creciendo y que su hijo sea un profesional exitoso. En la foto grupal la Sra. Elizabeth se encuentra de pie junto a las demás socias sentadas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 and lives with her partner Ruben, with whom she has four children, although only one is dependent on them. She is the president of the communal bank Union y Fuerza. This group consists of 6 very responsible women who want to get on through mutual support and with the help of Kiva lenders. Elizabeth works making items such as sweaters and chalinas (Peruvian scarves). She also sells breakfasts.

Elizabeth is therefore asking for a loan to invest in her business and buy wool, thread and other materials that she needs to sew clothing. In this way, she can cover her household costs and provide her family with the improved quality of life that they all want. One of her dreams is to grow her business and for her son to become a successful professional. In the group photo, Elizabeth is standing next to the other members, who are all seated.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothing.

loans.name: Kulbubu

texts.ru: Кулбубу, 60 лет, замужем, есть сын. У Кулбубу среднее образование. Занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее есть 3 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 30 овец, также на 2,0 ГА собственной земельной доли, Кулбубу выращивает фасоль. На ежедневной основе она продает молоко. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Кулбубу составляет около 24,000 сом (KGS). Кулбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, удобрений и топлива для полеводства. Доходы от ведения бизнеса Кулбубу планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Kulbubu, 60, is married and has a son. She has a high school diploma and earns her living from agriculture. She has three dairy cows, two horses, thirty sheep, and grows haricot on her 2.0 ha plot of land. She sells milk on a daily basis. Her total monthly income is about 24,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). Kulbubu is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy livestock, fertilizers and fuel for land cultivation. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock, fertilizers and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of oil.

loans.name: Roland

texts.fr:
Roland est un homme de 33 ans. Il est marié et a un petit garçon de 2 ans qu’il élève avec sa femme sur les hauts plateaux malgaches. Il exerce une activité de vente de charbon devant son domicile depuis 8 ans. Pour compléter le revenu du foyer, sa femme tient également une petit gargote où elle propose quelques plats de base malgaches (riz, soupe, beignets…)
Le partenariat avec Vahatra a commencé il y a maintenant 3 ans et lui a permis d’augmenter progressivement le volume de son activité. Ainsi, avec ce nouveau prêt et pour renouveler son stock, il compte acheter 180 sacs de charbon. 
Les bénéfices de son activité lui ont permis jusqu’à présent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille mais également d’en améliorer un peu le quotidien en achetant une bicyclette. Il rêve de pouvoir un jour construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Roland is a 33-year old man. He is married and has a two-year old boy who he is raising with his wife on the high plains of Madagascar. He has had a small business selling charcoal in front of his house for the past eight years. In order to top up the household income, his wife has a small café where she offers some Madagascan dishes (rice, soup, fritters,..)

His partnership with Vahatra began three years ago and has enabled him progressively to expand his business. With this new loan he is going to renew his stock and is planning on buying 180 sacks of charcoal.

The profits he makes from his business have until now allowed him to provide for his family's needs but also to improve is day-to-day life by buying a bicycle. He dreams of being able to build his own house one day.

loans.use: to buy a stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Emeterio

texts.es:
Emeterio es un hombre de 59 años de edad, casado, sin hijos, y su negocio es ls pesca.
Él es emprendedor, paciente, fuerte, optimista, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Patapatani’ que ofrece al visitante una caminata por un sendero prehispánico para apreciar paisajes asombrosos de la Cordillera Real y el Lago sagrado Titikaka, se encuentra  a 4400 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centigrados.
Emeterio es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la agricultura, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante una bomba eléctrica. Su negocio es la pesca, las variedades más comunes del lugar son; carachi, mauri, ispi, trucha y otros. Su jornada comienza muy temprano por la mañana cuando entra al lago a plantar las redes para al cabo de un par de horas recogerlas, actividad que realiza durante todos los días de la semana en temporada de pesca, finalizada la temporada se dedica a su actividad de agricultura, “actualmente nos ocupamos de comerciar pescado, pasada la temporada de pesca nos ocupamos de la tierra y del ganado…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su pesca se vende por completo, la desventaja es la pesca por temporadas. Su sueño es ampliar sus actividades mejorando sus equipos y maquinaria, él desea realizar la compra de redes de pesca y refacción de bote para mayor seguridad. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 31 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Emeterio solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pescar y refacciónar su bote para trabajar con mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Emeterio is a 59 year old man. He is married, has no children and his business is fishing. He is entrepreneurial, patient, optimist, responsible and hardworking. He works in the community of ‘Patapatani’, which offers visitors a pre-hispanic trail to see stunning landscapes of the Cordillera Real and the sacred Lake Titikaka. It is 4400 meters above sea level, has a cold, dry climate, and a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade. 

Emeterio has dark skin, brown eyes, short black hair, short stature and a medium build. His mother tongue is Aymará, which he speaks in his family, and he speaks Spanish for the general culture and for his business. He shares his life with his wife, who works in farming. They live in their own home which is built from adobe and has a metal sheeting roof. It has electricity and well water with an electric pump. His business is fishing. The most common varieties in the area are: carachi, mauri, ispi, trout and more. His day begins very early in the morning when he goes on the lake to put in the nets to bring them in after a couple of hours. He does this activity every day of the week during the fishing season. When the season is over, he works in agriculture. "Right now we sell fish. When the fishing season is over, we work the land and keep livestock", he says. The advantage of the business is that he sells his whole catch. The disadvantage is that fishing is seasonal. His dream is to expand his activities, improving his equipment and machinery. He wants to buy fishing nets and repair his boat for better safety. This is his 4th cycle with the institution in the 31 years that he has been doing this activity independently. 

It is for these reasons that Emeterio is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and to repair his boat to work more safely.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and repair his boat to work more safely.

loans.name: Unión Del Llano Group

texts.es:
Considerada como un tesoro ya que abastece de agua la comunidad, la bomba de agua es una construcción antigua edificada por los habitantes. En esta misma región mexiquense se siente un clima frío en contraposición de la calidez de su gente quienes siempre ofrecen un trato amable a los visitantes. 
   Juliana es una mujer valiente y con una calidad humana incomparable esto la ha llevado a ganarse la confianza y admiración de familiares, amigos y vecinos. Está casada desde hace cuarenta y cuatro años con Enrique y juntos han logrado sacar adelante a ocho hijos que ahora son independientes. 
   Tiene una tienda de abarrotes que ha servido para mantener los gastos del hogar y dar educación a sus hijos. Pero como todo negocio inició desde cero. “Con quinientos pesos comencé mi negocio, compré dulces y poco a poco fui aumentando la mercancía”, de esta manera lo que en un principio sólo era un espacio reducido con poco producto ahora es un local bien abastecido y lo mejor de todo, muy cómodo. El préstamo actual lo empleará para comprar leche, productos enlatados, refrescos y jugos. Otro logro de Juliana es que pudo adquirir una camioneta para transportar la mercancía; en su semblante aparece una sonrisa y dice que “si uno se lo propone y no se deja vencer puede lograr todos sus sueños”.
   Ahora junto con las ganancias que ha obtenido espera poder comprar animales para su cría y venta.  Así, con todas las actividades que ella realiza desea que sus hijos aprendan el ejemplo para que puedan transmitírselos a sus nietos.
   El grupo se conforma por Margarita y Leticia quienes invertirán en borregos; Lourdes en una tienda escolar y María Guadalupe en cría de cerdos.

*La fotografía se capturó al pie del quisoco de uno de los municipios del Estado de México. Cerca se encuentran el palacio de gobierno, la plazoleta y una iglesia católica.
texts.en:
Considered to be a treasure as it supplies the town with water, the water pump is an an old structure built by the town's inhabitants. This region of Mexico has a cold climate, in contrast to the warmth of its people, who always offer visitors a friendly welcome.

Juliana is a brave woman who is unmatched in her caring attitude. This has led her to win the trust and admiration of family, friends and neighbours. She has been married to Enrique for forty-four years, and together, they have managed to raise their eight children, who are now independent.

She has a grocery store through which she has been able to pay household expenses and educate their children. Like every business, it began from zero. Juliana explains, "I set up my business with five hundred pesos. I bought sweets, and little by little, I increased my stock". In this way, what was initially just a small space with a few products is now a well-stocked store which is, best of all, very comfortable.

Juliana will use this loan to buy milk, canned products, soft drinks and juices. Another of Juliana's achievements was to buy a van to transport merchandise. She has a smiling countenance and says that "if you set your mind to it and don't give up you can achieve all your dreams".

Now, with the earnings she has made, she hopes to be able to buy animals to raise and sell. She wants her children to learn from the example she sets through all of her activities, so they can then teach her grandchildren.

The group is completed by Margarita and Leticia, who invest in sheep, Lourdes, who has a school shop, and María Guadalupe who raises pigs.

* This photograph was taken at the foot of the kiosk of one of the towns in Mexico State. The government palace, town square and a catholic church are located nearby.

loans.use: to buy milk, canned products, soft drinks and juices.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Tiempo De Esperanza Group

texts.es: Banco Mujer Tiempo de Esperanza está conformado por cuatro socias de la comunidad de la Curia. Todas viven en unas parcelas que fueron donadas por el Instituto de Desarrollo Agrario en el Asentamiento La Lidia, ubicado en Roxana. Éstas integrantes están organizadas y les va muy bien. Tienen más de diez años de vivir en esa comunidad. También cuentan con la experiencia en el sector agropecuario, debido a que siembran y crian animales. Son clientas que tienen trayectoria en la Fundación y se han caracterizado por su excelente moral de pago. Darleny es una socia con 28 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos, los cuales cursan la primaria. Ella inició su actividad de comprar y engordar ganado para su venta, debido a que tiene la necesidad de aportar a su hogar, porque su compañero percibe un salario bajo. Ella actualmente está cursando la secundaria porque sus metas es superarse, crecer en la actividad y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Todas éstas socias van a invertir en la compra de ganado de engorde, para luego venderlos y obtener mejores ingesos, asi mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y sus familias.
texts.en:
The Mujer Tiempo de Esperanza Bank is made up of four female members from the community of La Curia. They all live on plots of land which were donated by the Agrarian Development Institute in the La Lidia settlement, located in Roxana. These members are well-organised and things are going well for them. They have lived in the community for over ten years. They also have experience in the farming industry, as they grow plants and raise animals. They have a history with the Foundation, and they have shown themselves to have excellent morals regarding repayments. 

Darleny is 28 years old, married, and has two children who are in primary school. She began working buying and fattening cattle to sell on as she needed to provide for her family, since her partner is on a low wage. She is currently studying in secondary education because she aims to better herself, grow in business and offer her children a better quality of life.

All the members of the group are going to invest in buying fattening cattle, to sell on and make a better income, in this way improving their and their families' quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Fawzat

texts.en:
Fawzat is a 21-year-old single man. Three years ago, he was forced to leave secondary school and open a mobile phone shop to help cover the needs and expenses of his family. He gained experience from a friend, and succeeded in attracting customers with his hard work and ambitions. 
Today, Fawzat is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business and increase his merchandise with a new collection of mobile phones to satisfy his customers' needs. 
Fawzat hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with a new collection of mobile phones to satisfy his customers' special requests

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 55 años, habita en un municipio del departamento del Atlántico,  donde hace 10 años tiene su pequeño taller de confecciones, el cual inició cuando necesitó generar ingresos para soportar los gastos de su hogar, pues en condiciones de mujer viuda, debió apoyar la educación de su hijo, quien hoy cuenta con 25 años de edad.  En su negocio ofrece el servicio de costura a todo costo, de reparación y elaboración de prendas a la medida de su clientela; poco  a poco su negocio ha crecido y sus metas también, pues cuenta con una gran aceptación en su mercado; ella vende de contado y para lograr ser competitiva compra en almacenes especializados de confecciones, con el fin de obtener los mejores precios y descuentos por  de acuerdo con el tamaño de sus compras. En la actualidad está aplicando  a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas, hilos, botones, entre otros insumos, con el fin de incrementar la producción y manejar inventarios que impacten la decisión de compra de su clientela. Su mayor desafío han sido lograr fuentes de financiación, y su principal meta es mejorar sustancialmente la imagen de su negocio con el fin de incrementar sus utilidades y mejorar su calidad de vida-.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old, and lives in a town in Atlántico department. She has had a small dressmaking workshop there for ten years, which she set up when she needed to generate income to pay for household expenses. As a widow, she needed to support the education of her son, who is now 25 years old.

In her business, she offers a sewing service for any price, as well as a repair and dressmaking service tailored to her customers. Her business has grown little by little, alongside her goals, and she has received great acceptance in her market. She sells in exchange for cash, and in order to be competitive, she buys in special dressmaking stores, to obtain the best prices and discounts in accordance with the size of her purchases.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which is her first funding from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other items, with the aim of increasing production and managing inventories which affect her customers' purchasing decision. Her biggest challenge has been to access funding, and her main goal is to significantly improve her business' image in order to increase her profits and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other items.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Monica es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija mujer de 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de almuerzo.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, activa, constante, alegre, feliz, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un sitio privilegiado por el encanto natural del valle, goza de características únicas, que cautivan por su clima y atractivos turísticos. Ubicado a13 kilómetros de la ciudad, a una altura que varía entre los 2600 y 4500 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Monica es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza junto a su madre que trabaja vendiendo comida en otro lugar y con su hijo que ya sabe caminar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba eléctrica. Su negocio es la venta de almuerzo; esta comida se sirve a medio día y generalmente está compuesta por varias comidas servidas en orden. Primero se sirve la entrada (que es un plato pequeño con lechuga, tomate y huevo o puede ser palta con cebolla y tomate), luego se sirve la sopa (puede ser de maní, de fideo, de chuño, etc.), después viene el ‘segundo’ (es el plato principal y puede ser; pollo o carne acompañado de arroz o fideo), y al final viene el postre (que puede ser un vaso de gelatina, o una fruta). “inicié mi negocio por la necesidad de trabajar, mi madre y mi hermana me ayudaron…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la venta de almuerzo tiene gran demanda por los trabajadores en horario de oficina, la desventaja es que existe mucha competencia. Su sueño es administrar un restaurante, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de un carrito broastero para la venta de pollo a la broaster por las noches para contar con una segunda actividad que le permita solventar los gastos de su pequeño hijo. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Monica solicita un préstamo para la compra de un carrito para la venta de pollo a la broaster para contar con una segunda negocio para pagar los gastos de  su bebé.
texts.en:
Mónica is a young woman. She is 19 years old, single, and has a two-year-old daughter. She works selling lunches. Monica is a good mother, and an enterprising, energetic, persistent, cheerful, responsible and hardworking woman. She works in Sacaba, a privileged place located in an enchanting natural valley with very unique characteristics. Its climate and touristic places make it very attractive. Sacaba is located 13 km [8 miles] from the city [Cochabamba], and between 2,600 and 4,500 meters [8,500 – 14,700 ft.] above sea level.

Mónica has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair tied as a pony tail. She is short and has a strong constitution. Her mother tongue is Quechua and she speaks it with her family. She speaks Spanish for professional and cultural reasons. She lives with her mother, who works selling food somewhere else, and with her daughter, who can walk now. They own a brick and cement house with a metal roof, where they live. It is served with electricity, and they use a pump to get water from a well.

Mónica sells lunches at noon. They normally consist of different dishes, served in a specific order. First comes the starter (which is a small dish with lettuce, tomato and an egg, or avocado, onion and tomato). Then the soup, which can be made of peanuts, noodles, dried potato, etc. Then comes the main dish, which can be chicken or beef with rice or noodles. Finally, the dessert, which can be a gelatin dessert or a fruit. “I started my business because I needed to work, and my mother and sister helped me,” she says. This is a good business, because office workers are always looking for something to eat at lunchtime. However, there is a lot of competition. Her dream is to become the manager of a restaurant. She wants to expand her business by buying a chicken roasting machine to sell roasted chicken at night and have a second activity that helps her to better maintain her small daughter. This is the first loan she receives from the institution in the three years that she has been in business.

This is why Mónica is requesting a loan to buy a roasting machine to sell roasted chicken and have a second activity that helps her to better provide for her baby.

loans.use: to buy a roasting machine to sell roasted chicken at night.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise, including women's accessories, clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Esmir

texts.es: Esmir de 58 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de helados y variedades en una pequeña miscelánea, que inició hace 10 años con el apoyo económico de sus hijos, cuando ellos la impulsaron al ver su potencial comercial. Hoy Emir  vende de contado y a créditos durante todos los días, artículos varios, trabajando desde las 8 hasta las 6 de la tarde, incluyendo los descansos para su alimentación. Su meta más adelante es organizar un local comercial en su propia vivienda y ofrecer mayor diversidad de productos y también este es justamente su mayor desafío, por eso ha acudido a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, donde está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, mediante el cual comprará bisutería, ropa, artículos para el hogar todo ello con el fin de lograr que su negocio crezca, con este crédito Emir tendrá una mayor capacidad de compra en mayor volumen y tendrán sus clientes la posibilidad de ofrecer mejores precios, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Esmir is 58 years old. She works selling ice cream and diverse products at a general store she started 10 years ago with support from her children, who motivated her when they saw her commercial potential. Nowadays, Emir sells everyday diverse items cash and on credit, working from 8 in the morning to 6 in the afternoon, including breaks for her meals. Her goal in the future is to organize a commercial place in her own house, and to offer a greater variety of products. This is her greatest challenge. Therefore, she has come to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, where she is applying to a credikiva, her first loan in this organization, with which she will buy custom jewelry, clothes, household items, in order to have her business grow. With this loan, Emir will have more ability to buy more quantity of products and her customers will have the chance to offer better prices; and in this way this credikiva will be a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy custom jewelry, clothes, household items.

loans.name: Gulviza

texts.ru: Гулвиза, 32 года, замужем, 2 детей, образование среднее. С 2010 года занимается животноводством и полеводством на 2,80 ГА собственной земли, она выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Экологически чистая продукция Гулвизы пользуется большим спросом среди местных жителей и оптовых покупателей. Также в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 30 овец и коз. Гулвиза знает технологию ведения сельскохозяйственной деятельности и умеет вкладывать средства по назначению. Гулвиза обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на приобретение скота для увеличения поголовья скота. Она намерена прибыль откладывать на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulviza, 32, is married and has two children. She has a high school diploma. Since 2010 she has been cultivating her 2.80 ha plot of land where she grows haricot beans for farm consumption and sale. Gulviza’s organic produce is in high demand among local customers and wholesale buyers. She also has two cows and thirty sheep and goats. Gulviza knows agricultural techniques and is a smart investor. She is requesting a loan of 110,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy additional livestock and so increase her herd. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and increase her herd

loans.name: Narom

texts.en:
Narom (here in photo) is 51 years old and she lives in Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has been married since 1980. She has one son and four daughters. Four of her children are married and the last one is attending university.

Narom has worked in childcare at a church for 16 years, while her husband is has been a policeman for 8 years. Now she would like to apply for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her son so he can travel to school.

She needs a motorcycle for her son to get to school, because her son is continuing to study at university.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to take her son to school.

loans.name: Zamirbek

texts.ru: Замирбек, 57 лет, женат, 4 детей. Замирбек работает в РЭС, также в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи более 37 лет назад начал свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Замирбека на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется дойная коровы и бычок, 10 овец, 5 коз. На 1,82 Га земли выращивает клевер для потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замирбек обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка. Доходы от кредита Замирбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Zamirbek, 57, is married and has four children. Zamirbek works for District Electric Networks. In the last thirty-seven years he has been earning additional income from livestock breeding and land cultivation. Through his hard work, Zamirbek now owns a dairy cow and a bull calf, ten sheep and five goats.  He grows clover for consumption and sale on a 1.82 ha plot of land. Zamirbek is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy another bull calf. He plans to invest the profit in expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира, 50 лет, вдова, есть сын, он живет с Элмирой. У нее среднее образование, на протяжении 25 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. В настоящее время в хозяйстве Элмиры есть 3 коровы. Также 4,40 ГА земельной доли, на которой она выращивает клевер, полученный урожай она реализует оптовым и розничным покупателям. Также Элмира в больших объемах реализует молоко, экологически чистое и вкусное, оно пользуется большим спросом. В целях дальнейшего развития своей деятельности, Элмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы, для увеличения объемов продаж экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Elmira, 50, is a widow and has a son who lives with her. She has a high school diploma and in the past twenty-five years has been earning her living from livestock breeding and land cultivation. She has three cows. In addition, she owns a 4.40 ha plot of land where she grows clover. She sells the clover to both wholesale and retail buyers. Elmira also sells large volumes of delicious organic milk, which is in high demand. Elmira is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy a dairy cow and so increase the volume of organic milk sales. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business and buying a car.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow in order to increase the volume of organic milk sales

loans.name: Raila

texts.ru: Райла, 44 года, замужем, 4 детей. У Райлы высшее образование, работает учителем в сельской школе, в общем 21 год. С 2003 года в качестве дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 4 лошади, 7 коров, 25 овец, а также в аренде 5,67 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает пшеницу и клевер. Райла известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 12,000 сом (KGS) от продажи. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Райла обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), который направит на увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Райла планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена приобрести дополнительно участок земли.
texts.en: Raila, 44, is married and has four children. She has a university degree and works as a teacher at a village school. She has been working as a teacher for twenty-one years. Since 2003 she has been earning additional income from agriculture. She has four horses, seven cows and twenty-five sheep. She also rents a 5.67-ha plot of irrigated land where she grows wheat and clover. Raila is known as a woman of principle, honest and reliable. Today her business brings a profit of 12,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) a month. Raila is requesting a loan of 150,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to be able to increase her herd. She plans to invest the profit in buying an additional plot of land and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and increase her herd

loans.name: Nasipa

texts.ru: Насипа, 48 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, с 1994 года она стала заниматься сельским хозяйством. Сегодня Насипа на 1,75 Га собственного и 2,0 Га арендованного земельного надела занимается полеводством, выращивая органическую фасоль. Экологически чистая и вкуснейшая продукция пользуется большим спросом и приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сомов(KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Насипа обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, топлива для обработки почвы. В будущем Насипа планирует направлять доходы от кредита на развитие полеводческой деятельности.
texts.en: Nasipa, 48, is married and has three children. She has vocational secondary education. Since 1994 she has been earning her living from agriculture. She grows organic haricot beans on 1.75 ha of her own and 2.0 ha of rented land. Her delicious organic produce is in high demand and brings a profit of 10,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) per month. Nasipa is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tusihm bank in order to expand her business. The loan will help her to buy fertilizers and fuel for land cultivation. Nasipa plans to reinvest future profits in land cultivation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fuel for land cultivation and growing organic haricot beans

loans.name: Nasilele

texts.en:
Nasilele is 35 years old. She is married with two children who are both in school. She comes from a family of 6 children. Nasilele has completed secondary school and college, and has since started her own business. Her business deals in groceries and Zoona mobile money tranfers. 

She enjoys running her Zoona business because she can see the difference she makes to her customers by providing accessible financial services in the community. Her shop is in Mongu, in the western province of Zambia. Nasilele is also driven by the fact that this business has allowed her to provide for her children. 

Nasilele is requesting a loan in order to expand her business and open more outlets in different towns. Her dreams include growing her business and earning enough money to eventually put herself through school while supporting her family, and this loan would help her achieve those goals.

loans.use: To provide the funds needed for her to serve customers who need to send and receive money so that she can grow her business

loans.name: Soykong

texts.en:
Soykong  (photo here) is 36 years old, lives at Keansvay district,Kandal province,Cambodia. 
He had been married since 2015 and has one son.

Presently he has been in the army as a guards man for 18 years, while his wife has been a cleaner for 3 years. He would like to apply for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for his wife to take to work. He said that “ He has an old motorcycle but wants to buy one more for his wife to take her to work”.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his wife to take to work.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es una mujer de 65 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo varón de 44 años y una hija mujer de 42 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos y  alimentos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es emprendedora, decidida, constante, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘las carmelitas’ zona residencial y con gran movimiento comercial que se ha beneficiado de un crecimiento económico estable y es en la actualidad el segundo centro comercial y financiero de la ciudad. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 6-18 grados centígrados.
Lourdes es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que administra. Su vida la comparte con su hija, yerno que trabajan y con sus nietas que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de artículos y  alimentos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, fideo arroz, harina, aceite, refrescos, enlatados, etc., actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana en horarios del día, “inicie mi negocio con muy pocos productos desde la ventana de mi casa…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia por la zona, la desventaja es el volumen y peso de la mercadería que se le hace muy difícil manejar.  Su sueño es administrar un mini supermercado, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mercadería por mayor como; abarrotes, refrescos, etc., para abastecer su tienda y ayudar con los gastos familiares. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 16 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lourdes solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes por mayor para abastecer su tienda y con los beneficios ayudar a pagar los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
