Lourdes is 65 years old, single, and has a son aged 44 and a daughter aged 42. She has a business selling basic items and foodstuffs in her neighbourhood store.

Lourdes is enterprising, determined, consistent, patient, responsible and very hardworking. Her store is located in the ‘las carmelitas’ residential area which has a lot of businesses and which has benefited from stable economic growth. It is currently the second largest shopping and financial area in the city. The climate is cold and dry, and the daytime temperature varies between 6 and 18 degrees centigrade.

Lourdes has olive skin, brown eyes and short black hair, and is short and of medium physical build. Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she talks with her family. She also speaks Spanish, which she uses in her business. She shares her life with her daughter and son-in-law, who work, and her grandchildren, who are at school. They live in their own home built of bricks and cement, with a corrugated roof. It has drinking water, electricity and drains. 

Lourdes has a business selling basic items and foodstuffs such as bread, sugar, pasta, rice, flour, oil, soft drinks, canned goods, and other products. She works every day during the day. She says, "I began my business with very few products, from the window of my home." The advantage of her business is that there is no competition in the area. The disadvantage is the volume and weight of the merchandise, which is difficult for her to manage.

Lourdes' dream is to manage a mini supermarket. She wants to expand her business through buying wholesale merchandise such as groceries, soft drinks, etc. to stock her store and help out with household expenses. This is her second series of loans with the institution in the 16 years she has had her business.

This is why Lourdes is requesting a loan to buy wholesale groceries to stock her store, and pay her household expenses with the profits.

loans.use: to buy wholesale groceries to stock her store, and pay her household expenses with the profits.

loans.name: Sam At

texts.en:
Sam At (shown in photo) is 33 years old, lives at Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province ,Cambodia. She had been married since 2006. She has one daughter. They are still young.

Nowadays, Sam At has been a self employed weaver for 11 years. While her husband is construction worker for 1 year. She is applying for a loan to buy silk to support her weaving for sale. She wants increase her income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy silks to support her traditional weaving for improved sales.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 28 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей, они ходят в детский сад. Динара в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 5 лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Динара имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы, 21 овец, ежедневно продает молоко. На земельном участке мерою 3,0 Га выращивает клевер. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 19,000 сом (KGS). Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Динара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Dinara, 28, is married and has two children who attend kindergarten. In the last five years she has been earning her living from livestock breeding and land cultivation. Through her hard work, she now owns two cows and twenty sheep, and sells milk on a daily basis. She grows clover on a 3.0 ha plot of land. Today her business brings a profit of 19,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) per month. Having found this business profitable, Dinara is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy heifers and so increase her herd. She plans to reinvest the profit.

loans.use: to buy one heifer to increase her herd

loans.name: Irma

texts.ru: Ирма, 40 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей школьного возраста. У нее - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она уже 8 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Ирмы, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 лошади, 2 коровы, 10 овец. На 2,0 Га земли выращивает люцерну для реализации. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Ирма обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади. Доходы от кредита Ирма планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и постройку времянки.
texts.en: Irma, 40, is married and has three school-age children. She has a high school diploma. Agriculture has been her family’s primary source of income in the last eight years. Through her hardwork, she now owns two horses, two cows and ten sheep. She grows alfalfa for sale on a 2.0 ha plot of land. She makes about 18,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) a month. Irma is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to be able to buy a horse. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business and building a small house.

loans.use: to buy one horse to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира, 50 лет, замужем. Уже 10 лет успешно занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день у нее есть 1 лошадь и 30 овец. На 0,75 Га земли выращивает арбузы. Замира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS), на полученные средства, она приобретет семена, удобрения и клеенку для парника. Полученная прибыль от кредита позволит Замире и в дальнейшем развивать ее деятельность, а также приобрести земельный надел.
texts.en: Zamira is a 50-year-old married woman. In the last ten years she been earning her living from agriculture. Today she owns a horse and thirty sheep. She grows watermelons on a 0.75 ha plot of land. Zamira is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy seeds, fertilizers and oilcloth for her greenhouse. The profit from the loan will help Zamira to buy an additional plot of land and grow more watermelons.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and oilcloth for greenhouse for growing organic watermelons

loans.name: Reston

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Reston. He is married and has five children.  Three of his oldest children have completed their high school education while the other two are still in school. Reston is the sole financial supporter of his family. He lives in a rural area called Mansansa, where there is limited access to financial services. He started his Zoona business in order to serve his community and provide access to needed financial services. 

A challenge Reston faces is that he does not have enough working capital to meet demand, and he ends up having to turn away customers.He also has not paid for the booth that he uses to serve his customers. Reston is requesting a loan in order to purchase a Zoona branded trading booth and have funds in his business, so that he can serve his customers more efficiently. This will help Reston to grow his business and provide a better service to his customers. He is hopeful that once he injects capital into his business, he will earn more profits and this will help him support his children through school.

loans.use: To purchase a small trading booth and provide the funds needed for him to serve customers who need to access financial services in rural Masansa

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a successful mobile money transfer agent located in the Copperbelt province in Kitwe Zambia. Through years of hard work and dedication she has steadily grown her business from one outlet to 15. Currently, Sandra has 22 employees working at her 15 locations throughout the copperbelt province, Zambia. Upon receiving her first Kiva loan Sandra was able to invest in her working capital to grow the business by serving more customers needing to send and receive money. In time, she opened three additional outlets with her increased profits. 

Sandra talks about how, by reinvesting back into the business, she was able to earn more commissions and with her increased revenue, open new locations. Some locations may not be profitable for up to six months but in time all of Sandras’s outlets have become profitable. Having access to finance has fueled Sandra’s expansion and allowed her to provide 22 jobs in Zambia where employment is very difficult to find. Sandra is happy now because she is able to provide well for her family and pay for her tuition fees.

She is currently pursuing a bachelors degree in banking and finance. The mobile money business has improved her and her family's income and well-being greatly. Sandra is married and has a two and a half year old son. Now, Sandra is requesting her fourth Kiva loan to purchase to expand her business further. She will use the loan as electronic and cash float across her shops so that she can provide a quicker service and serve more people who need to access financial services. Sandra remains grateful to all the Kiva lenders who have provided her the financial opportunity to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by providing the electronic and cash funds needed to serve more customers who need to access financial services in Zambia

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза, 29 лет, не замужем, мать 2 детей. У Наргизы среднее образование, она в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Наргизы на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы и 25 овец. На 6,0 Га земли выращивает клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 9,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, родители Наргизы помогают ей во всем. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку скота, чтобы иметь возможность развить ее доходы. Наргиза планирует увеличить доходы от бизнеса и направить прибыль на ремонт дома и хочет помочь накопить брату на свадьбу.
texts.en: Nargiza, 29, is single and has two children. She has a high school diploma and makes her living from livestock breeding and land cultivation. Through her hard work, Nargiza now owns three cows and twenty-five sheep. She grows clover for sale on a 6.0 ha plot of land. Her monthly income is about 9,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) but this amount of money is not enough for a dignified life. Nargiza’s parents help her with everything. She is requesting a loan of 45,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to buy additional livestock and so increase her income. She plans to increase her profits and invest them in house renovation and her brother’s wedding.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her income

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella says, "I decided to install a Takamoto biogas digester to avoid the inconveniences of using firewood. I am quite aged and would like to use biogas as a fuel because it is cheap, clean and convenient." She says she is most proud of being a generous mother and her Christian faith. 

Please help Isabella to get a biodigester.

loans.use: To buy a biodigester for clean cooking for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university fees for the new semester.

loans.name: Bryce

texts.en:
Bryce is 30 years old. He is married and has two children, his first born daughter Eugenia is in second grade and his son is in pre-school. He is the sole financial supporter of his family. Bryce lives in Kasama,the capital of the Northern Province of Zambia, situated on the central-southern African plateau. 

Bryce started his Zoona business in order to serve his community and provide access to needed financial services. A challenge Bryce faces is that he does not have enough working capital to meet demand, and he ends up having to turn away customers. Bryce is requesting a loan in order to grow his business and better serve his customers.He would also like to use his loan to get his shop painted and put up signage so that more people can be attracted to his business. Bryce hopes to one day build a house for his family see his children through school, growing his Zoona business would give him the opportunity to achieve these dreams.

loans.use: To grow his business by adding on the money that he uses to serve customers and painting his shop so that it can be more visible

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle for further profits

loans.name: Faraja...

texts.en:
Faraja, who is in his early 40s, is married with two children who are still at school.  He has been buying and selling cattle and goats for 13 years now.  He works from 9am to 11pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Faraja's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy cattle and goats and has been able to pay back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, take care of his family, loan repayment and covered household expenses.  He is happy with the loan.  

He will use this loan to buy cattle and goats to sell.  He dreams of doing business overseas.

Faraja will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy cattle and goats to sell.

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
Noeun, 42, lives in a community in Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of four children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 4.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. 

By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university fees for the new semester.

loans.name: Wasswa

texts.en:
Waswa thanks UGAFONE for extending services nearer the rural people who had no access to financial services. He lives in Bulooba, a rural area. 

He has a business running taxis, but has been constrained due to frequent mehanical breakdowns, making him lose a lot of money on the days it has to be in the garage. 

Wasswa now needs ugx1,200,000 to buy a new engine for his car so that it can get back on the road and operate efficiently. 

Wasswa appreciates the work done by the Kiva lender through UGAFODE.

He plans to pay very well in case he is given help.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more soft drinks stock to sell for increased income

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Don Carlos de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, él se dedica  a la siembra de maíz y frijol, el tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, vende sus productos de febrero a marzo y con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno para que pueda empezar a realizar la siembra y asi poder tener mejores ingresos y un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carlos, 53 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He is dedicated to planting maize and beans. He has more than ten years experience dedicating himself to agriculture. He sells his products from February to March and with what he earns from sales, he manages to pay some of his home expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, pest controls, etc. and to improve his land so he can begin to plant and thus be able to have better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest controls, etc. to improve his land.

loans.name: Edita Del Carmen

texts.es: Edita de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, sus hijas ya son independientes, ella posee un vivero donde siembra y vende plantas ornamentales y frutales, tiene 12 años de experiencia en la venta de plantas, vende en los alrededores de la zona y en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene clientes establecidos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de plantas frutales por mayor para poder  tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Edita is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. Her children are now independent. She has a plant nursery where she grows and sells ornamental and fruit plants. She has 12 years' experience selling plants around the area and in neighbouring towns. She already has regular customers. With the money she makes from her sales she is able to pay some household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy wholesale fruit plants to boost her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruit plants.

loans.name: Las Naves Group

texts.es:
El Estado de México encierra una gran cantidad de bellezas geográficas como llanuras, cerros, planicies, etc. La vista es envidiable cuando, desde la cima en alguna comunidad, se aprecian casa y presas de la región. En una comunidad de esta entidad, la calidez de los habitantes se ha ganado buena fama. En las fiestas patronales propios y extraños se dan cita para disfrutar la enorme variedad de juegos pirotécnicos y bailes típicos de la región. 
   Elsa es originaria de esta región, ella es una mujer de gran calidad humana que deja notar todos los días y que la ha llevado a ser reconocida como una persona llena de virtudes, capaz de resolver cada problema que se le presente. Está casada con Felipe con quien tiene cinco hijos.
   Para Elsa sus padres fueron una bendición ya que la guiaron por el camino del trabajo y la gratitud. El campo es ahora el lugar donde dedica su tiempo para salir adelante y le tiene un gran cariño: siembra  jitomate, cilantro, rábano y acelga. La cosecha y posterior venta de sus productos le han originado importantes ganancias.
   Cada día, Elsa amanece con nuevas metas y por ahora ella utiliza su crédito para adquirir abono orgánico, de esta forma nutre la tierra y como resultado obtiene mejores productos. "Antes tenía que hacer mi propio abono, me tardaba más y la cosecha era más lenta, pero ahora con la compra del abono todo es mucho más sencillo”.

Daniel, el nuevo integrante del grupo invertirá su crédito en la cría de becerros. Todos los integrantes se muestran agradecidos por la oportunidad del crédito para fortalecer sus actividades.

*La fotografia fue tomada en los arcos del kiosco del municipio, Berenice es quien se encuentra de pie*
texts.en:
The State of Mexico encloses a great amount of geographic beauties such as plains, hills, flatland, etc. The view is enviable when, from any town's hilltop,  one can see the houses and dams of the region. One of the communities of this area is known for the warmth of its people. At their local religious festivities, its inhabitants and tourists meet up to celebrate a variety of fireworks and typical dances of the region. Elsa is a native of this region. She is a woman of great human quality, which shows every day, known to be a person full of virtues, ready to solve any problem she encounters. She is married to Felipe with whom she has five children. Elsa's parents were a blessing for her, because they guided her through the path of work and gratefulness. The fields are the place where she works to move forward and that she loves. She grows tomatoes, cilantro, radishes and chard. The harvest and the after sale of her products have given her important earnings. Every day she wakes up with new goals, and for now she uses her loan to purchase organic manure. In this way, she feeds the soil and gets better products. "Before, I needed to make my own manure. I needed more time and the harvest was slower, but now with the purchase of manure, it is much easier.". Daniel, the new member of the group, will invest his loan raising calves. All members of the group are grateful for the loan opportunity to strengthen their activities. 
 *The photograph was taken at the municipality arched kiosk . Berenice is standing.*

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

location.town: Ejido de San Pedro El Alto, San Felipe del Progres

loans.name: Rayselyn

texts.en:
Rayselyn works as a Human Resource Officer. She helps in maintaining good relationship of employees with their designated supervisors. She also provides advice and assistance to supervisors and staff. This may include information on training needs and opportunities, job descriptions, performance reviews and personnel policies of the Council.

Rayselyn is the breadwinner of her family and she helps her parents by providing for their daily needs. She simultaneously maintains their household and does her job, for she desires to give her siblings a better life in the future.

But one of her dilemmas, like any other employee, is the proper budgeting of salaries with their daily needs. Aside from this, she has to pay their weekly and monthly expenses plus her siblings's tuition fee, which she sometimes forgets because she needs to prioritize more important matters.

For this reason, Rayselyn is asking for your assistance to support her financial inadequacy. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in returning it back, since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. She looks forward for any help that would come from you and she promises to return it in due time. She will be using the loan to pay her siblings's school fees.

Rayselyn has a very unique dream and that is to become a singing flight attendant. She aspires to have a job that she could enjoy and at the same time share that joy through entertaining people to whom she would be offering her services. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post- working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay the educational needs of her siblings.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 45 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, personal care products and other groceries.

Annabelle has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Annabelle aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es:
Nicolás es un hombre de 42 años de edad que se encuentra profundamente agradecido por el crédito anterior, pues gracias a ese apoyo logro comprar sus materiales para seguir produciendo la  mejor mil de abeja de su comunidad, Nicolás ahora nuevamente se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un prestamo para poder comprar tablas por docena, azúcar, cera, y otros materiales, para empezar a preparar la producción  para la próxima temporada.
El gran anhelo de Nicolás es poder contar con 100 cajas de abejas a finales de este año.
texts.en: Nicolás is a 42 year old man who is profoundly thankful for his previous loan since, thanks to that support, he managed to buy his materials to keep producing the best bee honey in his community. Nicolás now again sees the need to request a loan to be able to buy a dozen tables, sugar, wax and other materials to begin to prepare the production for the next season. Nicolás' big goal is to be able to have 100 boxes of bees at the end of this year.

loans.use: to buy a dozen tables, sugar, wax and other items for the production of bee honey.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia de 45 años de edad, se dedica a la actividad comercial desde hace 10 años, cuando una amiga le sugirió  viajar a Bucaramanga, linda ciudad en el departamento de Santander, donde son expertos en la fabricación  de bolsos y calzado en cuero y  allí comprar estos articulos para venderlos en la ciudad de Barranquilla, pues existia una gran demanda. Así fue como inició su emprendimiento y hoy su sueño de prosperidad no se detiene y planea más adelante abrir un almacén donde ofrecer estos artículos, aunque su mayor desafío sea lograr fidelizar su clientela con buenos precios y con la oferta de calidad que exhibe. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará calzado y bolsos de diversos diseños, con lo cual incrementará sus ventas y por consiguiente sus utilidades, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Emilia, 45, has been dedicated to commercial work for ten years when a friend suggested to her to travel to Bucaramanga, a beautiful city in Santander where there are experts in the fabrication of bags and leather shoes and there she bought items to sell in Barranquilla since there is a large demand. It was thus she started her business and today her dream of prosperity does not stop. She plans in the future to open a store where she can offer these items. But her greatest obstacle is achieving customer loyalty with good prices and quality. Currently, she is applying for a CrediKiva, the first loan she has made with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy shoes and bags of different designs and with which she will increase her sales and therefore her profits making her CrediKiva a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy shoes and bags of different designs.

loans.name: Abel Antonio

texts.es: Don Abel vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijas, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, también trabaja como empleado en una finca, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, el esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cultivos como abonos, controles de plagas, pesticidas, etc. y también mejorar su terreno y asi poder recoger mejores cosechas y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Abel lives in his own home with his wife and three children. He makes a living growing corn and beans. He also works as an employee on a farm. His earnings from his work allow him to move forwards with his family. He is requesting a loan to buy the inputs he needs for his crops such as compost, pest control, pesticide, etc. and to improve his land. In this way, he will be able to achieve a better harvest and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost, pest control, pesticide, etc. and improve his land.

loans.name: Catalina Del Carmen

texts.es: Catalina de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeña esta actividad para que pudiera salir adelante, cultiva durante el invierno y en diciembre vende en los diferentes mercados el producto, ella quiere comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía, pero no teniendo suficiente capital solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para comprar lo dicho y así tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Catalina is 49 years old and lives in her home with her 3 children.  She dedicates herself to the cultivation of corn and beans.  Her parents taught her this from a young age so that she could move forward.  She cultivates during the winter and in December she sells the products in different markets.  

She wants to buy the necessary supplies such as fertilizers, compost, pest control, and to improve the land, which is shown in the photograph.  As she didn't have sufficient capital she requested a loan from INTEGRAL to buy the aforementioned and in this way have a better economic income.

loans.use: to buy the necessary supplies such as fertilizers, compost, pest control, and to improve the land.

loans.name: El Tiburón Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tiburón se encuentra dentro de una comunidad mazahua en el Estado de México, cuya cultura y tradiciones están muy arraigadas  en los habitantes. Para no perder todas estas tradiciones que los antiguos indígenas les legaron, ellos visten sus trajes regionales y hablan su lengua autóctona, y su anhelo es que sus descendientes mantengan viva la cultura. 
   Doña Solveva y Don Javier son pareja desde hace 24 años, padres de dos hijas, una de ellas actualmente cursa sus estudios universitarios en Contabilidad. Una de las grandes metas de la pareja es poder ver realizadas profesionalmente a sus hijas, el hecho de que sus ellas puedan titularse les dará mejores oportunidades de trabajo. También quisieran hacer mejoras en su vivienda ya que por el momento gran parte de sus ganancias las destinan a la educación de sus niñas. 
   Javier inició su vida como comerciante vendiendo frituras y botanas "Fue por necesidad, por falta de un empleo fijo”. Después, la pareja vivió en la Ciudad de México y se les presentó la oportunidad de comprar zapatos de segunda mano a un buen precio, decidieron invertir el capital que tenían y regresaron a su comunidad con la mercancía, así comenzó su venta en los tianguis; “La primera vez teníamos mucha vergüenza, pero realmente nos fue muy bien y eso nos motivó a seguir en el negocio” coemnta Javier. Actualmente doña Sol, como la llaman de cariño, se encarga del negocio de zapatos y Don Javier de seguir vendiendo frituras y botanas; ambos trabajan seis días de la semana y descansan únicamente los sábados.
   Ambos están muy contentos y agradecidos con VisionFund ya que con el apoyo de los préstamos han conseguido tener mayor estabilidad e incluso lograron comprar dos camionetas para transportar los productos fácilmente. Esta vez, con el préstamo Doña Sol comprará más calzado;  Doña Teresa, en  borreguitos y Don Javier en frituras y Botanas.

   *La fotografía fue tomada en un pequeño parque municipal. Sol viste un suéter verde*
texts.en:
The Tiburon Group is within a mazahua community in the state of Mexico, whose culture and traditions are very engrained in the people. So they do not lose these traditions handed down to them from their ancestors, they wear their traditional clothing and speak their autóctona language, and they hope their descendants will keep the culture alive. 
Solveva and Javier have been together for twenty-four years, they have two daughters, one of whom attends college and studies accounting. One of the couple's major goals is to see their daughters graduate from college, because with college degrees they will have better career opportunities. They would also like to make improvements to their home, since at the moment a large portion of their earnings goes towards their daughters' education. 
Javier began working in sales selling fried foods and snacks. "It was out of necessity, for lack of a steady job." Later, the couple lived in Mexico City, and they had the opportunity to buy second-hand shoes at a good price. They decided to invest the savings they had and returned to their community with the merchandise, and that's how he began selling at the open-air markets. "The first time we felt ashamed, but it actually went very well, and that encouraged us to continue with the business," Javier remarks. Now doña Sol, as she is affectionately known, handles the shoe business, while Javier continues selling fried foods and snacks; they both work six days a week and only take Saturdays off. 
They are both very happy with and grateful for VisionFund, since with the support of the loans they have a greater level of security and have even been able to purchase two trucks to easily transport their products. This time, Sol will buy more shoes; Teresa will buy lambs and Don Javier will buy fried foods and snacks.
 *The photo was taken in a small park. Sol is wearing a green sweater.*

loans.use: to buy shoes

location.town: La Virgen, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair drinking water pipes, and build a water storage container to store clean water in his home.

loans.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es: Rosa de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino, tiene 5 años de experiencia en el ese rubro el cual inicio con capital propio vende sus productos durante todo el años, y con lo que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de concentrado para el engorde del ganado y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She makes a living raising cattle. She has five years' experience in this activity, which she began with her own capital. She sells her products throughout the year, and with what she earns, she is able to pay for some household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy feed to fatten her cattle and in this way, keep working for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten her cattle.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga de 54 caños de edad, se dedica a la modistería; de estado civil separado y madre de 3 hijos hoy adultos, Olga  hace 18 años decidió trabajar en la confección de ropa y más tarde en el año 2000, emprendió su propio generador de ingresos para sostener su hogar. Ella aprendió de su madre esta actividad y hoy fabrica ropa a la medida a todo costo y también sus clientes traen las materias primas e insumos y le piden elaborar los diseños que prefieren. Entre sus productos de mayor rotación están los uniformes, aunque también elabora ropa clásica y a la moda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas para producir uniformes; con esta inversión Olga responderá a sus solicitudes de pedidos, incrmentará sus ventas y obtendrá mas ingresos haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Olga is 54 years old, and makes a living as a dressmaker. She is separated and has three grown-up children. 18 years ago, Olga decided to go into dressmaking, and later, in 2000, she set up her own workshop to support her family. She learned this skill from her mother and today, she makes tailored clothing for a range of costs, and her customers bring her the raw material and inputs and ask her to make their favourite designs. One of her products with the highest turnover is uniforms, although she also makes classic and fashionable clothing.

Olga is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which is her first funding from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy fabric to make uniforms. With this investment, Olga will be able to meet her order requests, increase her sales and boost her income, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make uniforms.

loans.name: Proyecto H Group

texts.es:
Si se tuviera que describir a esta comunidad mexiquense habría dos palabras perfectas; alegría y solidaridad. Además la vista es increíble pues los campos en donde se siembra maíz son regados con las aguas de los riachuelos que abren sus ramas y terminan en pequeños canales. Los habitantes demuestran siempre su calidez y educación con una sonrisa o un saludo amigable.
   Guillermo, habitante de dicha comunidad,  es un hombre responsable, generoso, educado pero sobre todo dedicado a su familia. Tiene catorce años de casado con Hermelinda y han formado una linda familia con cuatro hijos.
   Su actividad es la cría de pollos, actividad que desempeña junto con sus hermanos y que le ha resultado eficiente y práctica para obtener ganancias y brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. El nuevo préstamo lo ocupará para comprar más pollos aunque se ha comprometido a desarrollar su negocio con la compra de maquinaria que le ayude a independizarse de sus hermanos para así conseguir mejores ganancias.  Actualmente viaja a otras comunidades para vender su producto ya que dentro de la comunidad las ventas han disminuido, mas esto no lo atemoriza, al contrario, lo motiva para seguir adelante y buscar mejores oportunidades en otros lugares.
   Aunque ahora únicamente se ha enfocado en la venta de animales, tiene en mente conseguir máquinas para iniciar con la producción de carne y huevo que le permitirá incrementar sus ganancias.
   Guillermo sabe que aún tiene mucho camino por recorrer pero se muestra optimista y dice "Vale la pena seguir luchando día con día para poder darles a mis hijos y esposa la vida que ellos se merecen”. Guillermo se encuentra muy contento y agradecido con el apoyo que recibe pues le ha sido de gran  apoyo para cumplir sus metas en un tiempo más corto. 
   El grupo lo componen  Guillermo y Abel dedicados a la venta de pollos. Florentina quien maneja una tienda de abarrotes y Ma. del Carmen quien vende trastes.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal, Guillermo viste una playera color naranja*
texts.en:
If you had to describe this Mexican community, there would be two perfect words:  happiness and solidarity.  Furthermore, the view is incredible and in the fields where the corn is planted, streams pass through spreading their branches and ending in small canals.  The residents always show their warmth and education with a  smile and a friendly greeting.  

Guillermo, a member of this community, is a responsible, generous and educated many who above all is dedicated to his family.  He has been married to Hermelinda for 14 years and they have created a beautiful family with four children.  His trade is raising chickens, which he does together with his brother and has resulted in a very efficient and practical way to earn an income and bring better living conditions to his family.  He will use the new loan to buy more chickens, although he has also committed himself to buying machinery that will help him to operate independently of his brothers and have better income.  He currently travels to other communities to sell his products, as sales within the community have fallen. This doesn't scare him, on the contrary, it motivates him to move forward and seek better opportunities in other areas.  

Although he currently only focuses on selling animals, he has in his mind to obtain machines to begin meat and egg production that will allow him to increase his earnings.    Guillermo know that it is a long path to walk, but shows optimism and says "It is worth it to keep fighting every day to be able to give my kids and spouse the life they deserve."  Guillermo is very content and thankful for the help he has received, as it has been a great help and allowed him to achieve his goals in a shorter time.  

The group is made of Guillermo and Abel who sell chickens, Florentina who manages a grocery store, and Ma. del Carmen who sells dishes.  
*The picture was taken in the stairs on the municipal gazebo. Guillermo is wearing  the orange t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Gladys Sonia

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de 36 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional paceña.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘villa Fátima’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio informal; camiones cargados de frutas, verduras y carne llegan desde el norte de la ciudad para comercializarlos en el lugar por mayor, y por las paradas de transporte público con salidas a poblaciones del norte de la ciudad, de clima frio y ventoso, vientos que llegan de la cordillera a una altura de 3600 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Gladys es de tez morena, ojos pardos usa lentes de aumento, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su hijo que se inicia en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional lugareña, como;  saice (carne molida y arroz), plato paceño (choclo, papa, habas, queso y carne), trucha frita, revuelto de carne (papas fritas, carne molida, arvejas y arroz), sajta de pollo (pollo picante con chuño) y otros. Actividad que realiza de lunes a sábado en su domicilio para la hora de almuerzo, sus clientes en la mayoría son empleados de una fábrica cercana que almuerzan todos los días hábiles en su puesto de venta. “la mayoría de mis clientes son obreros, y llegan a la misma hora todos los días, no puedo hacerlos esperar porque se van todos a la misma hora…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes constantes, la desventaja es la falta de muebles e utensilios de cocina para atender a mayor número de clientes. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de utensilios de cocina como; cubiertos, vajilla, ollas, etc., También algunas mesas y sillas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Gladys solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios y muebles de cocina para vender comida a más clientes para pagar los gastos escolares de su hija.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 36-year-old woman, single, who has a 6-year-old child and her business is selling traditional food from La Paz.

She is a good mother, enterprising, understanding, patient, responsible and very hard-working. Her business is in the "Villa Fátima" zone, a place characterized by informal business: trucks loaded with fruit, vegetables, and meat arrive from the north of the city to sell them in bulk in this place, for the stops for public transport that head to the populated areas north of the city, and for its cold and windy climate, with winds that come off the mountains at an altitude of 3600 meters above sea level. 

Gladys has dark skin, dark eyes, wears glasses, has long black hair she keeps tied up, is short, has a robust physique, her native language is Aymará which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She lives her life in the company of her child who has begun to go to school. They live in a house which belongs to the family, and is built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting which has drinking water, electricity and sewer services. Her business is selling local traditional food such as saice (ground meat and rice), plato paceño (corn, potatoes, broad beans, cheese and meat), fried trout, revuelto de carne (french fries, ground meat, peas, and rice), saita de pollo (spicy chicken with freeze-dried potatoes) and more. She does this work from Monday to Saturday in her house for the lunch hour. Her customers are largely the employees of a nearby factory who eat every work day at her location. "The majority of my customers are workers and they arrive at the same time every day; I can't make them wait because they all go at the same time..." she says. The advantage of her business is that it has regular customers, the disadvantage is the lack of furniture and cooking utensils to serve a larger number of customers. Her dream is to open a restaurant, she wants to expand her business through the purchase of cooking utensils such as cutlery, silverware, pots, etc., and also some tables and chairs. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 1 year she has been doing this work. 

For these reasons Gladys asks for a loan to purchase utensils and kitchen furniture to sell food to more customers to pay for her daughter's school expenses.

loans.use: to purchase utensils and kitchen furniture to sell food to more customers to pay her daughter's school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar and bakery supplies.

loans.name: Grupo Sector Cancha Group

texts.es:
Manuel (es el primero del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de playera celeste) es un hombre de 30 años de edad,  tiene una linda hija que se encuentra aún bajo el cuidado de su madre, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Este humilde padre de familia para llevar el pan de cada día a la familia se dedica a la carpintería desde hace cinco años, gracias a esta labor ha sacado adelante a su familia.
Manuel gracias a la dedicación que le pone a su trabajo de carpintería, elabora muebles de calidad, y tiene mucha clientela, pero el necesita mejorar aún más la calidad de su trabajo, por tal razón a organizado a un grupo de personas para juntos solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de tablas, lijas, serruchos, clavos.
En gran sueño de este gran hombre es poder construir una casa más grande para sus hijos y contar con un local exclusivo para su carpintería.
texts.en:
Manuel (the first one on the left in the photo, with the light blue t-shirt) is a 30-year-old man. He has a lovely daughter who is still in her mother's care. This lovely family lives in a community of Sololá.

This humble father, to bring daily bread to his family, has worked in carpentry for the past five years. Thanks to this work, he has gotten his family ahead.

Manuel, thanks to the dedication which he puts into his carpentry work, makes quality furniture. He has many customers but he still needs to improve the quality of his work. For this reason, he has organized a group of people to ask for a loan together which he will invest in the purchase of boards, sand paper, hand saws and nails. 

This great man's great dream is to be able to build a larger house for his children and to have a space exclusively for his carpentry.

loans.use: to purchase boards, sand paper, hand saws and nails.

loans.name: Peou

texts.en:
Peou (shown in photo) is 65 years old and lives in the Khsach Kandal District of Kandal province, Cambodia. She had been married since 1979. She has two sons and five daughters. Four are married and two are garment factory workers.

Peou has been a weaver for 30 years. She is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her daughters to drive to work. She wants to save money rather than spending on taxis every month.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her daughters to drive to work.

loans.name: Oscar Eliodoro

texts.es: Oscar de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, y en algunas ocasiones cultiva maicillo, tiene 12 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y poder mejorar el terreno donde desea empezar a realizar las siembras y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Oscar, 37 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He works growing corn and beans, and sometimes he grows sorghum. He has been working for 12 years in this activity. He sells in the various markets which are near his house. He is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides and be able to improve the land where he wants to begin plant and in this way be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, and be able to improve the land.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 49 years old, widowed, and has four children, two of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Candelaria operates a coconut wine business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years.

Candelaria requested a loan from NWTF for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer de 37 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Para Catarina apoyar a sus padres es muy importante, y para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, desde hace seis años.
Ahora Catarina es una muchacha muy responsable que ahora se ha dado cuenta  que es muy necesario construir una pared de su cocina, para protegerse  mejor de la época de lluvia que se está acercando, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente, por tal razón solicita un crédito para comprar cemento, arena, hierro.
El gran sueño de esta humilde mujer es poder construir una casa más grande.
texts.en:
Catarina is 37 years old, single, and lives with her parents in a town in Sololá. For Catarina, supporting her parents is very important, and to earn a living she has worked buying and selling traditional clothing for six years. Catarina is a very responsible woman who has now realised that it is necessary to build a wall in her kitchen to provide better protection during the rainy season, which is approaching. However, one of the difficulties she faces is that she doesn't have enough money, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand and iron.

The biggest dream of this humble woman is to be able to build a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Caylene

texts.en:
Caylene is an employee of a garment factory in Carmona, which she has been doing for three years. Even at her young age, she already has engaged herself as a Human Resource Officer.  She is responsible for providing support in the various human resource functions, which include recruitment, staffing, training and development, performance, monitoring, and employee counseling. She also provides advice and assistance to supervisors and staff. This may include information on training needs and opportunities, job descriptions, performance reviews, and personnel policies of the Council.

Caylene handles different challenges every day at work and that what makes her to be more determined and focused to what she is doing. She is hopeful that a good life awaits her family, which is why she pushes herself beyond her limits and is willing to do extra miles. The problem is that she lack resources at times and her salary is not quite enough to provide for her needs and help support her family.

For this reason, Caylene requested a loan from CCT Credit Cooperative, which she will use to pay for the educational needs of her siblings. She will have no problem repaying the loan as the loan payment is deducted every pay day.  

Caylene meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and how God is continuously transforming her life.

The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

* CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks.

loans.use: to pay for the school needs of her siblings.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 39 years old and is married with four children who are in school. For the past four years, she has run a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. Annaliza is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Annaliza is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren, 34, is a married woman with six children, three of which are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Caren has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Caren has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Caren would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business, to save money for her children's education

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma agents, Sulaiman. Sulaiman lives in Surabaya, a city in East Java, located about 2 hours from Jakarta by plane. He is happily married. He lives there with his wife and his three children (two sons and one daughter). Sulaiman owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits. He was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system and he wanted to expand his business using technology. Sulaiman is a friendly and cheerful person and his community sees him as an informative mobile provider. 

As the business grows,  Sulaiman needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. As seen in the photo, Sulaiman is the one who is standing in front of his stall.  He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a portable solar home solution for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Philip Fon

texts.en:
Philip Fon is married and has two children. He lives in a three-bedroom house in Mbengwi in the northwest region of Cameroon. He has faced so many challenges in life: the death of his brother, who was very supportive to him and the family at large; sickness, an accident that almost killed his child, and inadequate finance to start up a business. 

With this new loan requested, he will buy a motorcycle and pay for the documents needed to use it for public transport. He has a positive view of the business succeeding because he has been doing it for a long time. With this business activity, the community members will benefit from easy means of transport and door-to-door services.
 
With the profit from this loan, he will improve his family's standard of living by providing them with good meals, paying for his family's medication, paying for his children’s' education, and providing them with other basic necessities. He will also put back some profits into the business and do repairs on his house. 

He prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and pay for documents.

loans.name: Sobhiya

texts.en:
Sobhiya is a 28-year-old married mother of two. Seven years ago, she started working as a tutor to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family. Sobhiya has found herself in this domain for she believes that all students are able to succeed in their schools with support and love. Sobhiya is also an ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business.

Sobhiya is requesting a youth loan through the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to legally register her car to help her move easily to her student’s houses. She hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to legally register her car to travel to her student's houses

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gemma is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Gemma has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other maintenance for her business.

Gemma has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other maintenance for her rickshaw business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 62 years old and widowed with five children. With one child in school, Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, junk foods, personal product care and other groceries.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, junk foods, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 44 years old and has seven children. Marilou is married and has two children who are in school.

Marilou is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marilou has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more Milo, milk, sugar, bread, prepare tea and buy kids dresses from the market at a wholesale price.

loans.name: Zesung - Niteynaba- Changli Group

texts.en:
Amida is 30-year-old hard working woman from Changli in the Northern region of Ghana. Amida is married and has 3 children. Amida is the individual pictured with the hand raised among members squatting in front.
	
Amida is a member of a ground nuts processing group that has been in business for about 4 years. The name of the group is ‘Zesung - Niteynaba- Changli’. Amida earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained on how to improve their ground nuts processing business so that they can always produce at premium quality for the local markets.

Amida and ‘Zesung - Niteynaba- Changli’ have asked for a loan of GHS 13,600.00. Amida share of the loan is GHS 600.0 which would help her to buy groundnuts for processing. Amida wants to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her children with clothing and food.
Amida is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts (peanuts)  for processing.

loans.name: Achmad

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of our Ruma agents, Achmad. Achmad lives in Lumajang, a city in East Java, located about 19 hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married and lives with his wife. Achmad owns a stall where he sells mobile airtime credits. He decided to join Ruma because he had heard before that Ruma has the best service and system and he wanted to expand his business using technology. Achmad is a friendly and cheerful person and his community sees him as an informative mobile provider. He also feels happy because, since he joined Ruma, he can give more contribution to his community.

As the business grows, Achmad needs additional capital. He is requesting a Kiva loan to provide more mobile airtime credits to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones. Achmad is shown standing in front of his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase prepaid mobile airtime credits for his business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old single man who opened a mobile phone shop two years ago to help in covering his family's needs and expenses. He is an ambitious man and a hard worker who has a good reputation in his region.

Today, Mohammad is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with a new collection of mobiles and accessories. This loan will help Mohammad attract more customers and satisfy their special requests.

He hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with a new collection of mobiles and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university fees for the new semester.

loans.name: Feda

texts.en:
Feda is a 24-year-old single lady from a village near Jenin City. Her father is a taxi driver who earns a low and unstable income. 

Feda is a student in the university where she studies accounting. She wants to complete her study and find a job in the future to improve her family's living conditions.

Feda took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will enable her to pay the university fees for the new semester. By taking this loan, Feda will be able to pay some of the urgent expenses she has.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the new semester.

loans.name: Brigette

texts.en:
Brigette is 29 years old and is married with two children who are in school. For the past 10 years, she has run a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Brigette is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Brigette is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and materials

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 57 years old and has seven children. Angelina is married and has two children who are in school.

Angelina is in the agricultural business of farming seaweeds in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business like plastic bags, etc.

Angelina has been in this business for 6 years now and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business like plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 40 years old and has five children. Brenda is married and has four children who are in school.

Brenda is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed like plastic bags, etc.

Brenda has been in this business for 3 years now and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Brenda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 44 years old and with one child in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Marilyn has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Miraflor is 53 years old and both her children are in school.

Miraflor has a general store business in the Philippines. Miraflor requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Miraflor has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Miraflor would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
This is 34 year old Umaru, he is married and has two children ages 15 and 6yrs old.  In 2012 Umaru establish his grocery shop.  He has taken his first loan and he repaid very well.   He began his business because he was trained in this type of business he is doing by his parents and he has to take care of his mother, father and younger sister.  

Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns SLL 600,000 every month from his business.  Umaru  would like a loan of SLL 6,000,000 in order to buy cartons of sweets, biscuits, soap, cream, Vaseline, bundles of pure water etc. He believe that loan will help him increase his monthly profit.  He thanks Kiva lenders for their kind support given to him. 

In the future, Umaru still plans to build his own house and educate his children to the university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mayonnaise, butter, powdered milk, soft drinks, and pure water to sell in his store

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 50 years old, mararied, and has seven children, one of whom is in school.

Diosdada is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Diosdada requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Diosdada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Elenita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elenita is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar for her food vending business.

Elenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar for her food vending business.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is the age of 37,mother of five children and living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband is a weaver and knots blankets at home. For knotting blankets, wool is used in making blankets. There is no better kind of the blankets than blankets made by hand; though this is far from implying that all hand-tufted blankets are superior to all machine-made ones.
 
Her husband is very expert and knots very fine blankets. This is very slow and time gaining procedure, he knots blankets over night. The demand for fine blankets has been increasing time to time.

However, her husband wants to buy more raw materials for knotting blankets but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible. 
Therefore, Irshad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy wool for knotting blankets and it could become the cause in increase in income.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for knotting blankets for her husband's blanket business and to increase the family income

loans.name: Elizbeth

texts.en:
Elizbeth is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is 53 year old woman. She lives with her one daughter and husband in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running a mobile phone shop for past many years. He sells new mobile phones and accessories such as chargers, batteries, hands free devices, blue tooth devices, etc. in his shop. He speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built up very good relation with his customers.

He wants to buy more stock of new mobiles as well as accessories such as batteries, chargers, hands free devices, and blue tooth devices to increase his business; but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Elizbeth has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband would be able to purchase relevant items for his business so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Elizbeth is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance in her husband's mobile phone shop.

loans.name: Valeri

texts.en: Valeri is 27 years old. He lives in Gurjaani district with his mother. His mother is unemployed and Valeri works as a physical worker to generate income. He decided to start a stable business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2000 USD. With the received credit he will purchase  a car and will start trading fruits and vegetables. Valeri will be able to earn stable income and to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a car in order to trade fruits and vegetables and increase income

loans.name: Mala'

texts.en:
Mala' is a 21-year-old married lady from Nablus city. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Mala' is a student in the university where she studies health management. She wants to complete her study and find a  job in the future to improve her family's living conditions.

Mala' took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will her to pay the university fees for the new semester. By taking this loan, Mala' will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Mala' appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the new semester.

loans.name: Ameneh

texts.en:
Ameneh is a 50-year-old divorced woman from Nablus city. She is a mother for a son and a daughter. Both of her children are studying at the university. Ameneh always wanted to complete her studies and earn the BA degree, but her economic condition was very bad. Now, she has registered at the university to study social sciences. She wants to complete her study and find a job in the future to improve her family's living conditions.

Ameneh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will her to pay the university fees for the new semester. By taking this loan, Ameneh will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Ameneh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the new semester.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 43-year-old married mother of two children. She works in clearing transactions and tailoring from her house to help her husband, who has a limited salary in covering the needs and expenses of their children.
Layla is sacrificing and depriving herself to provide her children with better living conditions. She considers her children' education as a priority and above everything, thus today, Layla is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees.
Layla hopes to expand her business more in the future to stay capable of building a better future for her children.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Gerber Anibal

texts.es: Gerber de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el cliente se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, también a la compra y venta de ganado, se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño ya que su padre le enseño esa actividad, el producto que cosecha es vendido en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su casa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi poder mejorar sus ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gerber, age 50, lives in his own house with his wife and his daughter.  He grows corn and beans.  He also buys and sells livestock.  He has been working in agriculture ever since he was a boy because his father taught him this business activity.  The product that he harvests is sold at the market that is close to his house.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.  This way he will be able to have better earnings in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Emelita Dela

texts.en:
Emelita Dela is a 47-year-old widowed woman with seven children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Emelita Dela has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Emelita Dela requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Emelita Dela has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Emelita Dela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 47 years old and married with four children in school, Felipa works very hard to provide for them.

Felipa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, candies, canned goods, groceries, home product care, etc. .

Felipa has been in this business for 3 years now. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Felipa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, candies, canned goods, groceries, home product care, etc.

loans.name: Choirul

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Choirul. Choirul lives in Surabaya, a city in East Java, located about 2 hours from Jakarta by plane. He is happily married. He lives there with his wife and his only son.  Choirul owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. He was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system and he wanted to expand his business using technology. Choirul is a friendly and cheerful person and his community sees him as an informative mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Choirul needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. As seen in the photo, Choirul is the one who is standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Bela Nabra-  Changli Group

texts.en:
Rukaya is a 30-year-old business woman from Changli in the Northern region of Ghana. Rukaya is married and has 2 children. She is the individual pictured first on the left among members sitting.

Rukaya is a member of a groundnuts oil processing group that has been in business for the last 5 years. The name of the group is ‘Bela Nabra-Changli’. She earns a good profit from the business simply because the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high quality groundnut oil and cake products for the Ghanaian market.

Rukaya and ‘Bela Nabra-Changli’ group have asked for a loan of GHS 12,500.00. Rukaya’s share of the loan is GHS 700.00 which she would use to buy groundnuts from local farmers for processing. She aspires to produce in large quantities in the future and earn more income to repay this loan, as well as support her family with food and pay school expenses for her children.

Rukaya thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts from local farmers for processing.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 39-year-old lady. She is passing her life with her six children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is taking a loan for her son. Her son owns a small embroidery firm as a partnership. He has been running this business for many years. A few days ago one of these partners withdrew his investment. To compensate for the withdrawn amount, each partner is contributing according to his financial position. Her son does not have enough money for the investment in the embroidery business. Therefore, Parveen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can make an investment like the other partners. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy material for her son's embroidery work.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Shabana is a 37-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of 6 children and her husband is a plumber by profession. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Shabana has also been doing business of cloth selling for the past six years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

Shabana needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes. Therefore, she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs so that she can earn more income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance, Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her own clothes sale business.

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
Zareena is 47-years old married woman, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  
Her husband owns a butcher's shop. He earns a sufficient income for the whole family. In the beginning he had been purchasing a small quantity of beef from the market then sold in his locality. Now, he has gotten a lot of experience and retained a list of good customers in a short time. Now he wants to buy a bull calf for producing more beef to sell but he does not have enough cash in hand.
