Therefore, Zareena requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy a bull calf for producing beef.
She is thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase their income from her husband's beef sales shop

loans.name: Timalitahima Changli Group

texts.en:
Salima is a 43-year-old business woman from Changli in the Northern region of Ghana. Adisah is married and has 5 children. She is the individual pictured with the hand raised among members sitting.

Salima is a member of a ground nut processing group that has been in business for the last 5 years. The name of the group is ‘Timalitahima Changli’. She earns a good profit from the business because the group has been receiving financial support from Grameen Ghana to process high quality ground nut oil and cake for the Ghanaian market.

Salima and ‘Timalitahima Changli’ group have asked for a loan of GHS 14,100. Salima’s share of the loan is GHS 1000 which she would use to buy ground nuts from local farmers for processing. Salima aspires to produce in large quantities in the future and earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her family with food and pay school expenses for my children.

Salima thanks Kiva lenders for their continuous support.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts from local farmers for processing.

loans.name: Salamty

texts.en: Salamty is a 46-year-old lady. She is a housewife and looks after her family which consists of seven persons. Her husband owns a sanitary items shop. He has been running a sanitary items shop for many years. He sells a variety of sanitary items like pvc pipes, Wash Basins, Bracket Pair for Wash Basin, Lead (Solid), Looking Glass etc. in his shop. He requires some capital to enhance in his business. So Salamty made contact with Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan. BRAC Pakistan staff visited her husband's sanitary shop and issued a loan. Salamty is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's sanitary items shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bags of drinking water and resell to her clients.

loans.name: Jeneris

texts.es: Jeneris de 38 años de edad se dedica a la venta de víveres y abarrotes, desde hace 5 años cuando decidida y con sus ahorros, al llegar a la ciudad de Barranquilla, encontró que en el barrio existía una gran demanda de productos de la canasta familiar y no existía la oferta que la comunidad requería. Ello la llevó a emprender el negocio con el cual empezó a generar ingresos,   apoyando a su cónyuge en el sustento del hogar, hasta ese momento solo a cargo de él. Hoy su negocio ha crecido paulatinamente, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograr sus sueños y es un gran desafío invertir y ganar más, porque tiene como metas brindarle una mayor calidad de estudios a su hijo, y finalmente tener una vivienda con su local contiguo. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, abarrotes, como arroz, cárnicos, refrescos, entre otros artículos que rotan rápidamente y no quiere que sus inventarios sean deficientes cuando lleguen sus clientes a comprarle. Con esta inversión planea impactar sus ventas e incrementar el inventario de artículos, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Jeneris is 38 years old. She has been selling provisions and groceries since five years ago, when, determined and armed with her savings upon arriving in Barranquilla, she found that there was a great demand for staple goods in her neighborhood; what the community required was not offered. It spurred her to start a business with which she could start to generate income, supporting her spouse in family sustenance, which up to that moment had been his sole responsibility. 

Today, her business has gradually grown, but her work capital is not sufficient to achieve her dreams. It is a major challenge to invest and earn more, because some of the goals she has are to offer better quality studies to her son and, finally, to have a home with an adjacent store. 

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, which is the first financing she has requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan, she will purchase provisions and groceries like rice, meat, and soft drinks, among other items that are frequently purchased. She does not want her inventory to be insufficient when the customers arrive to buy from her. With this investment, she plans to impact her sales and increase the inventory of items, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase provisions and groceries like rice, meat, and soft drinks, among other items.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin de 28 años de edad habita en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y su hija de 2 años de edad. Allí tiene una miscelánea donde ofrece artículos como productos de tocador, papelería, calzado, ropa, accesorios etc. Edwin tiene como meta tener su propia vivienda con un local independiente a su vivienda, para lograr un mayor sosiego familiar, pero su gran desafío es el insuficiente capital para aumentar sus compras, ganar más y generar utilidades prontas para cumplir sus sueños de prosperidad de manera inmediata. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará colonias, talcos, cremas, útiles escolares y artículos de lencería, con los cuales logrará el incremento de sus ventas y   aumentar el inventario de artículos, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa
texts.en:
Edwin is 28 years old and lives in a town near the city of Barranquilla with his partner and his two-year-old daughter. He has a store there where he sells items such as toiletries, stationery, shoes, clothing, accessories, etc. Edwin's goal is to buy his own house with a store located in a separate building, to achieve greater family tranquility. However, his biggest challenge is his lack of capital to increase his purchases, earn more and generate profits quickly to achieve his dreams of prosperity immediately.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first funding from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to buy perfumes, talcum powders, creams, school supplies, and lingerie. This will enable him to increase his sales and broaden his item inventory, making his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, talcum powders, creams, school supplies, and lingerie.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 53 years old and has six children. Eulalia is married woman.

Eulalia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Eulalia has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Eulalia requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Eulalia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Fanny Janeth

texts.es: Fanny propietaria de un pequeño negocio de venta de alimentos en el departamento de Cundinamarca, ubicado en el exterior de su vivienda, muy cerca de una parroquia, cuyos feligreses  potencializa sus ventas, de tamales, obleas, salpicón, empanadas,  actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 10 años. Para complementar sus ingresos familiares Fanny trabaja de lunes a viernes en un colegio en otra población de Cundinamarca donde genera con su empleo otro salario más como empleada de servicios generales. Fanny hace sus compras en la plaza del mercado del municipio para obtener precios competitivos y ofrecer una venta ajustados a la capacidad de acceso de su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará hojas de bijao, harinas, maíz, verduras, arroz, carnes etc: con los cuales logrará el incremento de su productividad  y con ello  aumentará el inventario de los deliciosos productos alimentarios que elabora, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Fanny owns and runs a small food business from the back of her home, in the department of Cundinamarca. Her home is located near to a parish, whose parishioners keep her afloat. She has sold tamales, wafers, salads, and empanadas for ten years. To complement her family's income, Fanny works Monday to Friday in a school in another area of Cundinamarca to generate another income as a general service provider.
Fanny makes her purchases in the municipal market plaza to get competitive prices and offer sales adjusted to her clients' capacities. She is now applying for a loan on Kiva, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan, she will purchase bijao leaves, flour, corn, vegetables, rice, meat, etc. With these items she will increase her productivity and inventory of delicious meals. This will thus be a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy bijao leaves, flour, corn, vegetables, rice, meat, etc.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 34 years old, married and has four children in school.

Geraldine is in the agricultural business farming seaweed in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her seaweed farming business.

Geraldine has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her seaweed farming business, to save for college funds

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is 46 years old; she is a married woman. She deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 46-year-old woman. She is a mother of two children. 

For meeting the expenses of her family, she is dealing in a business of selling animals. She earns enough to contribute in the family income. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more animals for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more animals for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 44 years old; she is a married woman. 

She deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Nyame Tse Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Nyame tse and are beginning their second loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The Nyame tse group is made up of five members who are into the sale of detergents, foodstuff, fruits, charcoal and firewood. The loan they are taking out will benefit these small entrepreneurs.

One of the group members is Susuana. She says that she joined ID-Ghana one years ago, at the invitation of of a relative who was a client of the institution. At present, Susuana has a business in the sale of foodstuff and fruits. She began this business with help of her parents and is now working hard to take care of her children. The loan that she will obtain this time is for an increase in capital to be used for the purchase of more banana, mango, pawpaw, palm fruits, cassava and plantain (at the wholesale level). She will sell these banana, mango, pawpaw, palm fruits, cassava and plantain to her clients, door to door. This kind of work enables her to generate resources to assist her family, since she is single and has children. When she was asked what she liked about ID-Ghana, she replied that she was pleased with the loan and with the training that the institution offers her.

loans.use: To purchase of more banana, mango, pawpaw, palm fruits, cassava and plantain (at the wholesale level).

loans.name: Surya

texts.en:
Surya is 47 years old, a married woman running a business of milk selling for many years, with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes and sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 4 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales, to earn a good amount of income.

loans.name: Foreen

texts.en:
Foreen is an energetic young lady and is well trained in cloth stitching. She belongs to a middle class family and wants to support her family through her abilities. That is the main reason she has been running a small boutique to earn more income for the purpose of supporting the family. Her husband also supports and encourages her profession, as he brings different varieties of designer clothing from markets, and Foreen stitches them into unique and attractive dresses. 

Ladies of the society like her dress collections a lot. That’s why her business is running very well, so Foreen needs to purchase more clothing and stitching material to increase her boutique business. For that, she has requested a loan from Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and stitching material to increase her boutique business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol durante el invierno, el cliente se dedica desde hace varios años a esta actividad, el producto lo comercializa de enero a febrero en el mercado municipal, con lo que obtiene de las ventas es como saca adelante a su familia, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para generar mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The youth's face is pixelated because he is 29 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He cultivates corn and beans in the winter, and has been doing so for several years. He sells his produce from January to February in the municipal market, to make an income to support his family.
He lives in his own home with family and is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc in order to continue with his work and generate a better income.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel the bathroom, to plaster and paint the walls, to install a shower, and other accessories.

loans.name: Rosendo Abel

texts.es: Rosendo de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y a la crianza de ganado, tiene 30 años de experiencia en la actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, vende sus productos durante todo el año y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  fertilizantes, abonos, productos para el control de plagas, entre otras cosas y así poder producir mejores cosechas para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Rosendo, age 31, lives in his own home with his wife. He cultivates grains and raises livestock. He has thirty years' experience in this area. He started his business with his own capital and sells his produce all year long. With his income, he is able to cover some household costs. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizers, manure, pesticides, and other items in order to produce a better harvest and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticides, and other items.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is the age of 35. She is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a shoe shop in which he sells a variety of shoes. He buys shoes from different shoe manufacturing companies and sells them from the shop. He has been selling gents' shoes only, but now he wants to offer ladies' shoes as well to meet customer demand. The major problem is the lack of a lump sum amount.
 
Therefore, Parveen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy stock of ladies' shoes as well. 

Parveen is very happy after taking this loan and says thank to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ladies' shoes for her husband's shoe shop

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta es una muchacha de 30 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Marta con el afán de generar sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa se dedica  a la compra y venta de ropa típica desde hace seis años, gracias a esta labor ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Marta a pesar de no contar aún con familia propia le preocupa el bienestar de sus queridos padres,  es por eso que ahora ha decidido remodelar su casa, aunque ella se ha esforzado mucho esto no ha sido posible, por tal razón solicita un crédito que lo utilizara para comprar cemento y arena.
El gran anhelo de marta es tener un corredor en su casa para poder vender mejor su mercadería.
texts.en:
Marta is a 30-year-old woman. She is single and lives with her parents in a community of Sololá.
With a desire to generate her own income and support her family with the household costs, Marta has bought and sold traditional clothing for six years. Thanks to this work, she has been able to support her family.
She does not have her own family at the moment, so she works for her parents' well-being. For this reason, she has decided to remodel the home. Even though she has worked very hard, this has not been possible. For this reason, she is requesting a loan which she will use to buy cement and sand.
Her great desire is to have a space in her home to better sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to remodel her home.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida has successfully built her milk sales business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Over time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. She has now applied for a loan of PKR45,000 to purchase another cow to increase her sales and earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales and earn more profits.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: Bashiran is 46 years old, living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a weaver and knits blankets at home. Wool is used for knitting blankets. Her husband is an expert and knits very fine blankets. This is a very slow and time-consuming procedure -- he knits blankets overnight. The demand for fine blankets has been increasing over time. However, her husband wants to buy more raw materials for knitting blankets but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible. Therefore, Bashiran requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy wool for knitting blankets, which could become the cause of an increase in income. Bashiran says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for knitting blankets for her husband's blanket sale business

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a married woman and has been running her own beauty parlor in her street. She is doing her job passionately, as she knows the techniques of makeup and hair styling. She is a well-known beautician in her town. Razia is a responsible mother of 2 children. Her husband is not in good physical shape to be employed, so she is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Now she has requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams to cater to a large number of customers efficiently and to earn a good amount of income for bearing her everyday expenditures.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams to cater to a large number of customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a shower in the bathroom, paint it, install new water pipes, a toilet to provide better sanitary conditions for her household.

loans.name: Buen Porvenir Group

texts.es: Antonio, tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo y reside en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de donde obtiene ingresos para su familia. Lleva 15 años de cultivar, maíz, frijoles y café. Este cultivo de café es lo que le genera mayor ingreso ya que se vende a mejor precio. Antonio a decidido formar un grupo y solicitar un préstamo por 16,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos, insumos, limpieza para su finca de café y siembra de mas plantas,con el fin de mantener en buen estado la finca y obtener mejor cosecha este año. Con las ganancias piensa ampliar el cultivo y darle educación a su hijo. El grupo que formó se llama  Buen Pastor, que lo integra Gregorio, Antonio, Jerónimo y Alberto que en la foto están identificados de izquierda a derecha. Ellos trabajan la agricultura y se conocen en la comunidad. Cada uno del grupo solicita un préstamo que suman 56,000 lempira en total para dar asistencia a su finca de café.
texts.en:
Antonio is 32 years old, and lives with his partner, with whom he has a child. He lives in a village in the municipality of Intibucá. He has always made a living in agriculture, from which he earns an income for his family. He has grown corn, beans and coffee for the past 15 years. Coffee is the most profitable of his crops and sells at the highest price.

Antonio has decided to form a group and request a loan of 16,000 lempiras to buy compost and inputs, clean his coffee farm and grow more plants, in order to keep his farm in good condition and get a better harvest this year. With his earnings, he plans to expand his crop and educate his child. 

The group is called Buen Pastor, and is made up of Gregorio, Antonio, Jerónimo and Alberto, from left to right in the photograph. They work in agriculture and are known in the community. Each member of the group is requesting a loan, adding up to a total of 56,000 lempiras to assist their coffee farms.

loans.use: to buy compost and inputs, clean and grow more coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to paint the bathroom, install a shower, avoid the deterioration of the walls, and install  a toilet.

loans.name: Sitara

texts.en:
Sitara  is 40 years old, married and has five children. She operates a business of milk selling, which she does with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. 

Sitara requested a loan from Kashf Foundation for 45,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase one more buffalo. The loan will help increase her milk sales and income so she can provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo

loans.name: Hajiran

texts.en:
Hajiran is married and has six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales, which she has been doing for many years. Hajiran has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, Hajiran has gradually improved her business. She requested a loan from Kashf Foundation for 50,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase another buffalo. This loan will enable her increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is 45 years old, married woman. She is been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over the time she has attained regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute in the family income. She needs to deal more customers time after time. 

That is why; she has applied for a loan of 40000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. It will allow her to purchase combs, hair straightener, make up kits, and cleansers for treating many customers at a time to earn more revenue for running her household activities efficiently.  She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward positive direction as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase combs, hair straightener, make up kits, and cleansers for treating many customers at a time, to earn more revenue for running her household activities efficiently.

loans.name: Daysi Aracely

texts.es: Daysi de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal, posee 15 años de dedicarse a las ventas y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa interior para damas y caballeros y asi poder continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Daysi is 37 years old and lives in her own home with her two children. She makes a living selling underwear. Her business is located in the municipal market. She has worked selling for 15 years, and with her earnings, she is able to move forwards. She is requesting a loan to buy more men's and women's underwear, and in this way, keep selling and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more men's and women's underwear.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her ,as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Sajida is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. 

However, due to a shortage of raw materials, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers and cloth to sew more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers and cloth to sew more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: María  Del Carmen

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 41 años de edad, ella está muy agradecida por el crédito al que tuvo la oportunidad de tener acceso. 
María cuenta que con la inversión que realizo gracias a Dios le fue muy bien pues logro mejorar su negocio  ahora sus mercaderías han aumentado y así también sus ingresos han mejorado.
Ella solicita un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en su negocio de compra y venta de ropa típica para cubrir mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
El gran sueño de maría  es que sus hijos sean grandes profesionales y darles una casa más grande.
texts.en: María is a 41 year old woman. She is very grateful for the loan which she had the opportunity to receive. María  says that with the investment that she made, Thank God, was very good as she managed to improve her business. Now her merchandise has increased and her income has improved also. She is requesting a new loan to invest in her business, buying and selling traditional clothing to better fulfill the needs of her clients. María' s big dream is for her children to become great professionals and provide them with a larger house.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Chiyanjano Group

texts.en:
Esnart thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her. She used the loan to buy assorted items for her grocery store and this helped to successfully increase her profits. She used the profits gained to pay school fees for her children and provide them with other basic needs such as food.

Esnart is requesting for another loan in order to diversify her business into a wholesale. This business will help her, to greatly improve and alleviate her households levels of poverty from the profits to be obtained. The loan have helped Esnart to be able to provide food to her children three times a day.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries to help to provide food for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in fans, pressure cookers and blenders as well as a ladder and cordless drill.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina (shown in photo) is 24 years old, single, and lives at Chroy Changva district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Nowadays, Sina is a student and has studied at Chenla University in Phnom Penh, Cambodia in the field of nursing; he is in his third year, the first semester. He will graduate later in 2015.

He would like to apply for a loan to pay his school fees. 

He hopes that he will get $400 after he finishes the university.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees.

location.town: Chroy Changva district Phnom Penh city

loans.name: Cecilian

texts.en:
Cecilian is twenty six years old, married and a mother of two children.  She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings and especially on the enterprise development and financial management.  

She grows maize and beans and also keeps dairy. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides to boost maize and beans production for increased incomes. This will enable her to cater for her children’s’ clothing, food and other needs for the family. 

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support and promises to repay loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides to boost maize and beans production for increased incomes.

loans.name: Kyeni Kya Kyasioni S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Caroline. She is fifty two years old, married and a mother of five children. She has benefited from the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's training especially on enterprise development and financial management. After the training, she was able to commercialize her farming and increased income.

She does mixed farming where she grows maize, beans and also keeps dairy cows and poultry. She is borrowing Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides to boost her farming production. This will greatly increase her income which will enable her pay for her children’s clothing and food.
 
Caroline is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides to boost her farming production for increased income.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 47 years old and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2012 to benefit from training, especially savings mobilization, enterprise development and financial management.

She operates a small kiosk where she sells foodstuffs like salt, rice, maize flour etc. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to to diversify her kiosk business by buying second-hand clothes to sell. This will increase her income level and also enable her meet her customers demands.

She is thankful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to sell, hence increasing her income level and meeting customers demands.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 40 years old, a married woman. She has been doing a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. She is keen to provide her family with the basic necessities of life through her work. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 55000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improving her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Together Group

texts.en:
The group Together is located in Teshie-Accra, Ghana and is a group of two very active women who, above all, want to better their quality of life. They are selling firewood and smoked fish. Gladys is 59 years old and a single mother who children are all grown. She is a member of the group and is very excited to begin a eighth loan cycle with ID-Ghana, Teshie branch. Gladys sells firewood. Her business income is able only to pay for the costs of maintaining her home. She is requesting a new loan in order to buy more firewood to cover all of her customer demand because without more investment capital, she feels that her own income is not sufficient. 

Besides the loans, Gladys and the other member of Together also benefit from a combination of loans and education (training). The loan officer and the training officer share timely and useful information with the members on a variety of subjects like health, hygiene, and nutrition as well as self-esteem and violence against women. The members learn about effective business management practices and customer service, as well as gaining essential knowledge about business planning, customer service, marketing and pricing. All of these subjects help them better their lives both economically and developmentally.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to cover all of her customer demands.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es: Don Rosalio de 60 años de edad vive solo en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol cuenta con más de 30 años de de experiencia, vende sus productos en los meses de diciembre y abril y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pesticidas, fertilizantes abonos, controles de plagas, entre otras cosas y asi continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Rosalio is 60 years old and lives on his own in his own home. He makes a living growing corn and beans and has over 30 years' experience. He sells his produce in December and April, and with his earnings he is able to support himself. He is requesting a loan to buy pesticide, compost fertilisers, pest control, and other items so he can keep working.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, compost fertilisers, pest control, and other items.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is the age of 26, living in Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a medical clinic in which she provides first aid services to the patients. She got proper training from professional MBBS doctors, so now she owns his own small clinic on the basis of her experience. She has been treating her patients and they are recovering well. 

So she has become very famous in local society and she wants to establish her clinic through buying vaccines, injections, medicine, drips etc.
Sobia requested a loan for her clinic. She hopes that she would be able to buy medicine, vaccines, injections so that she can earn maximum profit.

loans.use: to buy medicines such as vaccines, injections, medicine, drips etc. for her own clinic

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an additional machine and boards to make some furniture

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 48-years-old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband and has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Yasmeen’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. 

However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Yasmeen has requested for 45000 PKR loan to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Tolgonai

texts.ru: Толгонай, 35 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей, все активно помогают по хозяйству. У Толгонай среднее образование, сельским хозяйством занимается с 2000 года. На сегодня в хозяйстве есть 2 лошади, 6 коров, 24 овцы. Также на 2,0 Га собственной земли Толгонай с семьей выращивают люцерну и ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 20,000 сом (KGS). Толгонай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 жеребцов для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Толгонай планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и накопить средства на воспитание и обучение ее детей.
texts.en:
Tolgonai is 35 and married with five children who all help her actively with the farm. She has a high school education and has been working in farming since 2000. She currently has two horses, six cows and 24 sheep on her farm as well as 2 hectares of her own land where she and her family grow alfalfa and barley both for their own use and for sale. Her monthly income is about 20,000 KGS.

Tolgonai has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 KGS to purchase four foals to increase her head count of livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and to save toward her children's care and education.

loans.use: to buy four foals in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 47-year-old divorced mother of one child. Eleven years ago, she returned from Colombia to Lebanon with her little child after her divorce and decided to open a clothing shop to cover the needs and expenses of her child, in addition to her parent. 

Amal used to work in a clothing shop when she was in Colombia, which helped her a lot in managing her new shop and attracting customers. She worked hard to develop her shop, and with the help of her sister, she became able to import clothes from Turkey and Brazil.

Today, Amal is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business more and increase her business merchandise with a new collection of clothes for the upcoming summer season. 

Amal hopes to expand her business more in the future through the wholesale business, to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions, for she is their only breadwinner.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of clothes for this summer season

loans.name: Ndemi Maendeleo Ya Wanaume Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand is John, 48 years old, married and blessed with three children. He is a member of Ndemi Maendeleo Ya Wanaume Shg. The group has completed all the training modules of Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) and their members are mostly involved in mixed farming of dairy and vegetable cultivation as their main economic activity. 

Through HiH EA intervention, John has been able to improve his farming business whereby he keeps good records to ensure that the enterprise is providing enough income for his family needs. 

John is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizer and seeds to improve his  vegetable farming business.

John is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer to help improve farming that will increase income.

loans.name: Sunshine S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Nelius; a member of Sunshine SHG. She is married and a mother of two children. She has benefited from the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, especially in enterprise development and financial management. 

She practices poultry farming as a business and she is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more chicken (broilers) to meet the rising demand for them in the market.  This will enable her to increase her poultry stock and earn more income. 

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more chicken (broilers) to meet the rising demand in the market and also increase stock to earn more income.

loans.name: Ziadah

texts.en:
Ziadah is a hard working woman. She is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past five years, Ziadah has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Ziadah has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Ziadah to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for the business. Ziadah hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a retail shop. 

Ziadah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, tiene varios años de trabajar en la tierra y gracias  a eso es como ha logrado salir adelante, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un  crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, productos para el control de plaga, abobos, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder empezar a presarse para la siembra.
texts.en: The young man, whose face is pixellated because he is 27 years old and lives in a high-risk-area, makes a living growing basic grains. He has worked the land for a number of years and thanks to this, has managed to move forwards. He lives in his own home with his family. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilisers, pest control products, compost, etc. and improve the land shown in the photograph and in this way, begin to prepare for growing his plants.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, pest control products, compost, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a hard-working woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past three years, Rehema has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes, and will help Rehema to generate greater profits and improve the economic status of her business. Rehema hopes that in the future she will be able to start a boutique. 

Rehema is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking woman. Irene is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past three years, Irene has been working hard to manage her brick-laying business, which deals in bricks. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for bricks, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and expand the business. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to start another business. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more materials for bricks

loans.name: Suglo Mbori Buni - Nyeko Group

texts.en:
Rukaya is a 38 year old hard working woman from Nyeko in the Northern region of Ghana. Rukaya is a mother of 4 children. Rukaya is the individual pictured with the hand on the shea nuts in the pan.
  
Rukaya is a member of a shea nuts processing group that has been in business for the past 4 years. The name of the group is ‘Suglo mbori buni – Nyeko. Rukaya earns a good profit from the business, as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process premium quality shea nuts to meet the demands of the local markets.

Rukaya and Suglo mbori buni – Nyeko have requested for a loan of GHS 3210.00.
Rukaya’s share of the loan is GHS 214.00 which would help her to buy processing equipments. Rukaya wants to acquire processing equipment as well as earn more income to support her children’s education.

Rukaya is thankful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy a shea nuts processing equipment.to support her children's education

loans.name: Shini Ka Doliba - Nyeko Group

texts.en:
Abiba is a 39-year-old hard working woman from Nyeko, in the northern region of Ghana. She is married and has seven children. Abiba is the individual pictured sitting in front with the hand on the shea nuts basin. 
	
Abiba is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for about five years. The name of the group is ‘Shini Ka Doliba - Nyeko’. She earns a good profit from the business, as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea nuts & butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local and export markets.

Abiba and ‘Shini Ka Doliba - Nyeko’ have asked for a loan of GHS 4,700. Abiba's share of the loan is GHS 300, which would help her to buy shea nuts for processing. She wants to earn more income, as well as to repay this loan and help her register her children with the health insurance scheme for affordable medical care.

Abiba thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Kenya Canners Retired Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Millicent, 48 years old, married and a mother of three children.

Millicent joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014. She has benefited a lot from training on saving, enterprise and financial management, where she was able to get skills on better saving methods and enterprise development. She has also gained skills on how to run her tomato-selling enterprise well and manage her income from the enterprise.

She is borrowing from Kiva to add more stock of tomatoes to her enterprise, which will earn her more income enabling her to uplift her living standards by providing a better diet and quality education.

She thanks Kiva and their lenders for the assistance and promises to repay back promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tomatoes that will help boost profit.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 25 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Динара 5 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 6 коров, 3 овцы. На 1,17 Га земли она выращивает люцерну. Деятельность приносит Динаре ежемесячный доход в сумме 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Динара обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели. На доходы от кредита Динара хочет увеличить свой бизнес и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Dinara is 25 years old, married, and has three children. Dinara has been engaged in agriculture for five years. On her homestead, she has six cows and three sheep. On 1.17 hectares of land, she grows alfalfa. The activity brings Dinara a monthly income of 6,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her business, Dinara applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase a heifer.

With the income from the loan, Dinara wants to expand her business and to save for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy one heifer in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hard working woman. Maria is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono Region of Uganda. For the past four years, Maria has been working hard to manage her food stall, where she sells raw food like onions, tomatoes, and bananas. To help expand her business, Maria has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva's partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw food items and will help Maria to generate greater profits and develop her business. Maria hopes that in the future she will be able to purchase land. 

Maria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more food items for her stall

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is a hard working woman. Peace is 18 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono Region of Uganda. For the past two years, Peace has been working hard to manage her retail clothing business. To help expand her business, Peace has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva's partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Peace to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Peace hopes that in the future she will be able to own a boutique. 

Peace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a hardworking woman. Stella is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past five years, Stella has been working hard to manage her agriculture business, which sells cash crops. 

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cash crops, and will help Stella to generate greater profits and increase capital. Stella hopes that in the future she will be able to start a retail shop. 

Stella is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more cash crops

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a hard working woman. She is 22 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Eva has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 950,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Eva to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Eva hopes that in the future she will be able to own rental units. 

Eva is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Kimiyakan

texts.ru: Кимиякан успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Сегодня в ее хозяйстве насчитываются 2 коровы, 10 овец и земельный надел мерою 2,0 Га, где она выращивает клевер и картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кимиякан вновь обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 120,000 (KGS) для покупки овец для разведения. Увеличение поголовья скота непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Кимиякан планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на постройку дома.
texts.en: Kimiyakan has successfully repaid her [prior] loan. She thanks Kiva and everyone who had helped her with financing. At present she has two cows, 10 sheep and a field of 2.0 ha [5 acres], where she grows clover and potatoes. In order to develop her farm further, Kimiyakan once again applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 120,000 KGS to buy sheep for raising. Increasing her livestock headcount will certainly improve her family’s financial situation. Kimiyakan plans to use the resulting revenues for an additional livestock increase. She also plans to save up for building a house.

loans.use: to buy some sheep and increase her livestock.

loans.name: Munarakan

texts.ru: Мунаракан, 43 года, замужем, 5 детей (сын и 4 дочери). У Мунаракан- среднее образование. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она 11 лет назад стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Мунаракан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 4 теленка, 10 овец и 1 лошадь. Также есть земельный надел мерою 1,0 Га, где она выращивает картофель и кукурузу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мунаракан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и ягнят для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Мунаракан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины. Также она мечтает накопить средства на ремонт дома и покупку автомобиля.
texts.en:
Munarakan is 43 years old, married, and has five children (a son and four daughters). Munarakan has a secondary education. In search of additional income for her family, she started 11 years ago to raise livestock and crops. Thanks to her hard work, Munarakan currently has on her homestead one cow, four calves, ten sheep, and one horse. She also has a 1.0-hectare plot of land, where she grows potatoes and corn to sell. Monthly income amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her homestead, Munarakan applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves and lambs to increase her headcount.

Munarakan plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating her livestock count. She also dreams of saving money for home repairs and to purchase an automobile.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves and lambs in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Kuweta Na Kwika Young Mothers Group

texts.en:
Priscillar is the name of the lady raising her hand in the photograph. She is forty years old, married and a mother of three. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training sessions, especially the enterprise development and financial management training. 

She operates a general retail shop where she sells commodities like sugar, salt, tea leaves, soap, cooking fat and other household goods. She also does dairy farming. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more household goods to add stock to her general retail shop. This will enable her to increase her income and be able to provide her family's needs with ease. 

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more household goods hence as stock for her general retail shop for increased income to provide for her family's needs.

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.ru: Камолиддин, 32 года, женат, 3 детей дошкольного возраста. У Камолиддина среднее образование, работу в селе найти трудно, он подрабатывает в сезон на стройках, но нужно содержать семью и достойно воспитывать детей, поэтому Камолиддин уже 14 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря целеустремленности, ответственности и трудолюбию Камолиддина, на сегодняшний день у него в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. Также на собственной земельной доле мерою 0,45 ГА он выращивает картофель и помидоры для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыли составляет около 27,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Камолиддин обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для покупки коров для откорма, часть средств направит на полеводство. Камолиддин намерен развивать свой бизнес, и расширить площадь сараев.
texts.en:
Kamoliddin is 32 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Kamoliddin has a secondary education. Work in the village is difficult to find. He works part-time seasonally in construction, but one must support a family and bring up children adequately. Therefore, 14 years ago Kamoliddin got involved in raising crops and livestock. Thanks to his determination, responsibility and hard work, Kamoliddin currently has on his homestead two cows. Also, on his own plot of land measuring 0.45 hectares, he grows potatoes and tomatoes for sale. Monthly profits amount to about 27,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing his farm, Kamoliddin applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow for fattening and a part for preparing the land.

Kamoliddin intends to develop his business and to expand the area of his barns.

loans.use: to buy some cows and to cultivate his land.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hard working woman. Imelda is 18 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono Region of Uganda. For the past three years, Imelda has been working hard to manage her used clothing business. To help expand her business, Imelda has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva's partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more used clothes and will help Imelda to generate greater profits and develop economically. Imelda hopes that in the future she will be able to own land. 

Imelda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: St. Paul & Paulines School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Fred. He is the head teacher of St. Paul and Paulines Secondary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Masaka with 350 students. St. Paul and Paulines Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term because they won't have to buy firewood. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Paul and Paulines Secondary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Fred ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a hard working woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Prossy has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Prossy to generate greater profits and expand her business. Prossy hopes that in the future she will be able to live a better life. 

Prossy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Abahuje Group

texts.en:
ABAHUJE is a group led by Chantal who is 60 years old. The group name means “Altogether” in English. She is married with three children aged between 17 and 29 years. She has a shop and has been doing in a business for the past 20 years. 

The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice,soap, sugar; salt and cooking oil for sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice,soap, sugar; salt and cooking oil for sell.

loans.name: Chynar

texts.ru: Чынар, 46 лет, в разводе, есть сын. У Чынар среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Чынар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, на ежедневной основе продает экологически чистое молоко. Ежемесячный доход Чынар составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения удоя молока. Доходы от кредита Чынар планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, она хочет отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Chynar is 46 years old, divorced, and has a son. Chynar has a secondary education. As a source of income for her family for the last 15 years, she has been raising livestock. Thanks to her hard work and determination, Chynar currently has on her homestead three cows, from which she daily sells organic milk. Chynar's monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her homestead, she applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow for increasing milk production.

Chynar plans to invest income from the loan in further developing her business and she wants to do renovations on her home.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to increase the volume of organic milk sales.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hardworking woman. Agnes is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past one and a half years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and boost the business. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to start a boutique. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Muminahan

texts.ru: Муминахан успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На  сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, а также на 0,30 Га земли выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Муминахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки нетели, часть средств будет потрачена на полеводство. Муминахан является лидером группы "Достук-7", всего в группе состоит 3 человека. Доходы от кредита Муминахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины в будущем.
texts.en:
Muminahan successfully repaid her loan. She is grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with financing. She currently has four cows, and also on 0.30 hectares of land she grows potatoes. Monthly income amounts to 17,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her homestead, Muminahan applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to increase her livestock headcount with the purchase of heifers, and part of the money will be spent on preparing the land. Muminahan is the lead of the Dostuk-7 Group, which consists of three people.

Muminahan plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating her livestock count and plans to save money to purchase an automobile in the future.

loans.use: to buy one heifer and to cultivate her land

loans.name: Mobeen

texts.en:
Mobeen is 50 years old, married woman. She is been in business of a beauty parlor for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best providing services she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  That is why she has applied a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers for gaining profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers for gaining profits to build her own house.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 48-year-old, married lady. She is very talented and excels in her work of stitching. She has received a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring for running her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She has now requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for sewing more dresses on time, to get a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on providing a quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for sewing more dresses on time.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is a hardworking woman. Cissy is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Cissy has been working hard to manage her business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Cissy to generate greater profits and add stock to the business. Cissy hopes that in the future she will be able to start another retail business. 

Cissy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a hard working woman. She is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Annet has been working hard to manage her salon. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy braids and chemicals, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and increase her business. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to earn more profits. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy braids and chemicals

loans.name: Rancho Caporal Group

texts.es:
Rancho Caporal es un grupo de préstamo conformado en una comunidad mexiquense. Los integrantes eligieron el nombre porque cerca de donde viven, había una pequeña granja con ese nombre. En aquellos años, los habitantes se dedicaban al cultivar maíz y a criar caballos que eran el medio más usual de transporte. Ahora lo único que prevalece de la granja es el portón con su nombre.
Doña Adela es una de las integrantes del grupo, tiene 74 años y a pesar de su edad aún se siente motivada para seguir invirtiendo en sus actividades: la cría de animales y su tienda de abarrotes. El préstamo lo utilizará para mantener la tienda bien surtida, comprando detergentes, productos enlatados, leche, queso, azúcar, huevo, pan y refrescos. Fue hace 13 años que doña Adela abrió su tienda que está ubicada frente a un panteón, lo que ayuda a mantener ventas altas por las personas que visitan o llevan flores a sus seres queridos que los han dejado.
El desafío de Adela es la competencia que hay alrededor, sin embargo la atención a los clientes y el surtido siempre han ayudado a mantenerla. Además por una u otra razón, la competencia siempre ha terminado cerrando mientras que la tienda de Adela ha prevalecido durante estos años. Incluso, pensando en seguir creciendo ella planea mejorar el local y comenta entre risas "mi changarrito necesita una buena mano de gato para que quede presentable".
Todos los integrantes del grupo se muestran muy agradecidos por la oportunidad de recibir un crédito ya que su dificultad general es tener el capital adecuado para seguir invirtiendo.  Miguel, Manuel, Fernando, Severiano y María del Rocío son los demás miembros y ellos utilizarán su crédito para comprar borregos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el municipio, junto al taxi de Don Fernando, su actividad principal. Doña Adela, es la señora de mayor edad en el grupo.
texts.en:
Rancho Caporal is a loan group in a Mexican town. The members chose the name because there was a small farm of the same name near where they live. In the past, the inhabitants made a living growing corn and raising horses, which were the normal means of transport. Now, the only thing that remains of the farm is the gate with its name.

Adela is one of the group's members. She is 74 years old and despite her age, she still feels motivated to continue investing in her activities raising animals and running her grocery store. She will use the loan to keep the store well stocked, buying detergents, canned goods, milk, cheese, sugar, eggs, bread and soft drinks.

Adela opened her shop 13 years ago, and it is located opposite a pantheon, which helps to keep sales high due to the people who visit it or bring flowers for their loved ones who have passed on.

Adela's challenge is the competition around her. However, her customer service and her stock have always helped her. In addition, for one reason or another, the competition has always ended up closing while Adela's shop has prevailed over the years. Thinking of continuing to grow, she even plans to improve her premises and says laughingly, "my little store needs a helping hand to make it presentable".

All of the group's members are very grateful for the opportunity to receive a loan as their general difficulty is having enough capital to continue investing. Miguel, Manuel, Fernando, Severiano and María del Rocío are the other members and they will use their loan to buy sheep.

*The photograph was taken in the town, next to Don Fernando's taxi, which is his main business. Adela is the elderly lady in the group.

loans.use: to buy milk, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

location.town: Loma linda, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is 46 years old, a widow. She is been involved in the business of the cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Rasheeda  has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business, to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is 44-year-old, married woman. She has been doing a business of selling fruits for many years with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She is very enthusiastic in her work and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of 4 children. She is responsible for their food, health and clothing and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. 

For the improvement for her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently, which ultimately enables her to cover her utility bills timely.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently, which ultimately enables her to cover her utility bills timely.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a hard-working woman. She is 17 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past three years, Prossy has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soft drinks, and will help Prossy to generate greater profits and expand the business. Prossy hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land to construct rental houses. 

Prossy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 18 years old and has one child. She is a hard working woman and lives in Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small kiosk where she sells snacks. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan from BRAC Uganda for 700,000 Ugandan Shillings. She will use the loan to buy more snacks to increase her sales and generate greater profits. She will be able to attract more customers and manage to buy a plot of land. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a tailoring machine. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more snacks

loans.name: Kanini Kaseo Self Helpgroup

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Margaret; she is fifty-eight years old, married, and has five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 and has undergone training on group formation, savings and resource mobilization, enterprise development, financial management, value addition, and market linkage and focus on the environment. The training helped her mobilize money and start small enterprises which are currently their source of income.

Margaret does dairy goat rearing and also vegetable farming. Her main economic activity is goat farming where she sells goat milk which has higher demand in her area.  She is borrowing to buy more goats to increase her milk production. She plans on  using the anticipated profits to cater for her basic needs.

She greatly appreciates Kiva and their lenders for their assistance and promises to repay in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy goats that will help improve milk production thus bring in more income that will help provide for the family.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.es: Ronel de 24 años de edad, reside en un barrio ubicado al suroccidente de Barranquilla, en donde funciona su negocio de cosmetología y peluquería hace catorce años. Su idea de negocio surge por herencia familia de donde aprendió este arte, sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, familiares y referidos, quienes pueden acceder a los servicios que ofrece todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. a 9 p.m., es un horario muy amplio para que puedan disfrutar de masajes capilares, tinturaciones, cortes de cabello, exfoliaciones corporales y faciales, peeling, manicure, y demás.  Ronel por su amplia experiencia en el campo de la belleza, elabora sus propios productos a base de plantas hidratantes y tonificantes, como la sábila, aguacate, romero y quina, los cuales ofrece a sus clientes de acuerdo a sus necesidades.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir insumos como shampoo, masajes, tintes y demás.  Él considera que esta inversión permitirá ofrecer un mejor y oportuno servicio.  Su meta a largo plazo es mejora las condiciones de su vivienda familiar y su negocio y su principal desafío es lograr cancelar oportunamente sus compromisos financieros.
texts.en:
Ronel is 24 years old and resides in a barrio southeast of Barranquilla where he has been a cosmetologist and hair stylist for 14 years. His idea for the business sprang from his family inheritance where he learned this art. His principal customers are his neighbors, family members and referred customers. They can access his services every day between 8:00 am and 9:00 pm, a very ample schedule, so that his customers can enjoy skin massages, hair coloring, hair cuts, skin and facial ex-foliations, peeling, manicures, and more.

Ronel, with his ample experience in the field of beauty, makes his own products from moisterizing and toning plants, such as sable, avocado, rosemary and quinoa, which he offers his customers as needed. 

At present, Ronel is requesting a Kiva loan, his first financing through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in inputs such as shampoo, massage supplies, hair coloring, and other items.
