He believes this investment will permit him to offer better and opportune services. Ronel's long-range goal is to improve his family's conditions of life and his business. Ronel's principal challenge is to pay off his financial obligations.

loans.use: invest in inputs such as shampoo, massage supplies, hair coloring, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is thirty seven years old, married and a mother of three children. She has benefited from the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa trainings especially on enterprise development; whereby she was equipped with skills to effectively manage her business. 

She operates a general retail shop where she sells commodities like sugar, salt, tea leaves, soap, cooking fat,cabbages and other household consumable items. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy more food stuffs, hence to increase stock and also earn more income. This will enable her to provide basic necessities to her family with ease.
 
Alice is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her general retail shop, for increased income to enable her to provide  basic necessities for her family.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a hardworking woman. Aisha is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Aisha has been working hard to manage her business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal, and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and improve standards of living. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hard-working woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has twp children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells raw food like onions, tomatoes, and bananas. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy chicks for a poultry business and add on to her food stall, and will help Lydia to generate greater profits and expand business. Lydia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land to construct rental houses. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy chicks for poultry business and add on to her food stall

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a hardworking woman. Florence is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Florence has been working hard to manage her business, which sells fruits. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy tomatoes and other fruits, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and increase the quantity of fruits in stock. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a shoe sales business. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and other fruits

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a hardworking woman. Viola is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Viola has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Viola has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase vegetables, and will help Viola to generate greater profits and increase capital. Viola hopes that in the future she will be able to start a retail shop. 

Viola is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Kadie.  She is a widow and has three (3) children aged 18, 13 and 10 years old.

In 1983, Kadie established her palm oil and gari (cassava flakes) business.  She began her business because she wants to take good care of her children. She has taken her second loan and she repaid it well. Working six (6) days a week and eleven (11) hours a day, she earns 800,000 SLL every month from this business.

Kadie would like a loan of 5,000,000 SLL in order to buy more gallons and bags of palm oil and gari for resale which will increase her profit as a result.

In the future, Kadie plans to build a house that she did not succeed in doing. However, Kadie managed to complete the unfinished house that her husband left for the children.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gari and palm oil for resale

loans.name: Aabas

texts.en:
Aabas is a Lebanese married man. He’s 45 years old and has one daughter and is really attached to his family. He is the main income provider in his family.  He has worked in the agriculture field since 2000 to be able to cover the heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay his daughter's educational fees. One of his greatest dreams is to see her achieving higher positions. Aabas wants to develop his work in the near future so he can better support his family.   For safety, his faced is blurred here.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's educational fees

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is a 24 year old young man, who lives in a village called Tsiplavake. He has a wife and 2 children and his parents. His mother is a cook and father is a private artisan, who gets a small income. The main part of family's income is from agricultural activity. They are engaged in cattle and pig breeding, in cultivating a family-owned vineyard, growing grapes and selling agricultural products at the local market. As Lasha started work at very young age, he was unable to study for a professional career and he has no stable job nowadays. 

Lasha has a great desire to make his family's business more productive and to start sheep breeding. He will build a cattle-shed, purchase sheep and after growing, Lasha will sell them at a good price. The start-up program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Lasha's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3200 GEL and it will expand his agricultural activity.
 
The loan will be great help to this motivated man and his family, as their income will greatly increase and Lasha will improve the living condition thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To build a cattle-shed and to start sheep breeding to improve the family income

loans.name: Kenya Canners Retired Shg Group

texts.en:
The person on the left in the photo is Pauline. She is 31 years old, married and a mother of four children.

Pauline joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014. She has benefited a lot through training, especially in financial management, and she was able to acquire skills in prudent financial management and bookkeeping. She has also gained skills on how to run her green grocery and poultry enterprise in a profitable way and how to manage her income from the enterprise.

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more chicks and chicken feed to expand her poultry enterprise. This will boost her income, thus providing her family's needs with ease.

Pauline is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their assistance and promises to repay well.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feed, which will boost her income thus providing her family's needs with ease.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre de 52 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de 3 hijos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Francisco con el afán de generar sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de banano desde hace cinco años, gracias a esta labor ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Francisco gracias a la amabilidad con la que atiende sus clientes, sus productos tienen mucha demanda, pero el ahora con el objetivo de satisfacer mejor  las necesidades de los clientes ha pensado en surtir mejor su negocio, aunque una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente, por tal razón solicita un crédito que lo invertirá bananos de seda, chocolate, oro.
El gran sueño de francisco es que su negocio sea más grande y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 52-year-old man. He is married and has a beautiful family with 3 children. They live in the community of Sololá.

Francisco has the desire to generate an income. He has been dedicated to buying and selling bananas for five years. Thanks to this work, he has succeeding in taking his family forward.

Thanks to the kindness with which he serves his clients, Francisco’s products are in high demand. But now, his goal is to satisfy his clients’ needs ever better. He has planned to supply his business better. However, one of his challenges is that he doesn’t have enough capital. For this reason, he requests a loan that he will invest in green, brown, and yellow bananas.

Francisco’s biggest dream is for his business to become bigger and to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy and sell green, brown, and yellow bananas.

loans.name: Jikaze Ujisaidie Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Angelina. She is thirty three years old and blessed with 5 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. She began training with Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the same year and has undergone the training on the savings, enterprise and financial management.

The main economic activity is dressmaking and she is applying for a Kiva loan to add more stocks of textile fabrics, sewing threads and needles to help improve customer service. This will lead to more income thus ensure food security in her household. 
She is grateful to Kiva  and its lenders and promises to pay on good time.

loans.use: To buy more stock of textile fabrics, sewing threads and needles to help improve customer service.

loans.name: Zirinah

texts.en:
Zirinah is a hardworking woman. Zirinah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past year and a half, Zirinah has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Zirinah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy irish potatoes, cooking oil, and baking flour, and will help Zirinah to generate greater profits and increase the size of her business. Zirinah hopes that in the future she will be able to open a big hotel. 

Zirinah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy irish potatoes, cooking oil, and baking flour

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a hard working woman. Annet is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Annet has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which sells sacks of charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of charcoal to increase her stock and will help Annet to generate greater profits and to use the profits to complete her unfinished house. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land to contract rental houses. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: purchase more sacks of charcoal to increase her stock

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a hard working woman. Linet is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has one child. For the past 2 years, Linet has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which sells charcoal in her small stall. 

To help expand her business, Linet has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase more stock in her business by adding more sacks of charcoal, and will help Linet to generate greater profits and invest more in her business. Linet hopes that in the future she will be able to manage to build a very big commercial house. 

Linet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: increase more stock in her business by adding more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Dallal

texts.en:
Dallal is a 51-year-old Lebanese divorced woman. She lives with her mother.

She is working hard and trying her best to be as helpful as she can in her family. Dallal started her own job. She opened a beauty salon in her house nine years ago. She has her loyal customers and is glad with the results she has attained so far.

Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase hairdressing tools such as BaByliss, hair dryer, etc. In that way, Dallal will be able to serve her customers with good quality products. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty center.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing tools

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is 29 years old from Baniswef. He is single and used to work in Cairo for a mechanic. After his father's death, he went back to his hometown to take care of his old mother and younger siblings. 

In his hometown, Ashraf started a business selling and changing car and irrigation machines oils, and also fixing irrigation machines and small generators project but the prices of oil and spare parts have increased more than those of previous years. So, he requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy spare parts and car and machine oils.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and car and machine oils.

loans.name: Kpangmanga - Nyeko Group

texts.en:
Meeli is a 34-year-old hard working woman from Nyeko in the Northern region of Ghana. Meeli is married and has 4 children. Meeli is the individual pictured with the hand on the shea nuts basin among members sitting in front.
	
Meeli is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for about 4 years. The name of the group is ‘Kpangmanga - Nyeko’. Meeli earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea nuts & butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local and export markets.

Meeli and‘Kpangmanga - Nyeko’ have asked for a loan of GHS 5,210.00. Meeli's share of the loan is GHS 208.40 which would help her to buy shea nuts for processing. Meeli wants to earn more income to repay this loan and support her children with clothing and food.

Meeli is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Artesanos Del Oro Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad mexiquense, enorme no por su espacio territorial sino por la grandeza de sus tradiciones y de las virtudes  de sus habitantes que organizan carnavales inundados de música, bailes, vestuarios de colores y gastronomía dignos de uno de los llamados Pueblos Mágicos de la nación. 
En este lugar se consolidó un grupo llamado Artesanos del Oro  ya que, como el nombre lo indica, la mayoría de los integrantes son artesanos de tradición. 
Tiburcio es un hombre de sólidos valores que sabe cómo alentar a otras personas con sus buenas ideas. Él está casado con Alicia y es padre de 5 hijos. 
Hace un tiempo, Tiburcio se quedó sin trabajo, pero gracias a los ahorros que tenía, pudo comprar algunos bueyes y vacas para revender. Con dedicación y esfuerzo, sigue haciendo crecer su actividad; siempre reinvierte sus ganancias o los préstamos para comprar más animales. 
Las ganancias del negocio, también le han ayudado a Tiburcio a mantener a su familia y a pagar los gastos de educación de sus pequeños con mayor facilidad. 
A pesar de que las personas en la comunidad han disminuido su compra de carne, Tiburcio sigue confiando en su actividad y seguirá buscando los medios para conservarla. 
El mayor anhelo de Tiburcio es poder ser un ejemplo claro de trabajo para sus hijos para que ellos sigan sus pasos. 
Los demás integrantes del grupo son Abigail quien invertirá en latón para sus artesanías; Antonio, en su veterinaria; Angélica,  en su papelería;  Austroberto, en cerdos; Magalli, en ocochal; Ana Laura, en borregos y Carmen, en carpintería.
*La fotografía fue tomada afuera de la casa de Magalli y Abigail y muestran algunas piezas de artesanías que elaboran.
texts.en:
There is a Mexican community, which is big, not because of its land but because of the largesse of its traditions and virtues of its residents, who organize carnivals filled with music, dancing, colorful clothing, and food, that is worthy of being one of the so-called “Pueblos Mágicos” (“Magical Towns”) in the country.

In this place, meets a group called “Artesanos del Oro” (“Golden Artisans”). As the name suggests, the majority of the members are traditional artisans.

Tiburcio is a man of solid values, who knows how to encourage other people with their ideas. He is married to Alicia and is the father of 5 children.

For some time, Tiburcio was unemployed, but thanks to the savings that he had, he was able to buy some oxen and cows to resell. With dedication and strength, he continues growing his business. He always reinvests his earnings or the loans to buy more animals. 

The earnings from the business have also helped Tiburcio take care of his family and to pay the education expenses for his children more easily.

Despite the fact that people in the community have decreased their purchases of meat, Tiburcio continues trusting in his business and will continue seeking ways to save it.

Tiburcio’s biggest desire is to be able to provide a clear example of work for his children so that they will continue going forward.

The other members of the group are Abigail, who will invest in brass for her crafts; Antonio, who will invest in his veterinary business; Angélica, who will invest in her stationery shop; Austroberto, who will invest in pigs; Magalli, who will invest in weaving; Ana Laura, who will invest in sheep; and Carmen, who will invest in carpentry.

* The photograph was taken outside Magalli and Abigail’s house. It shows some artisanal pieces that they made.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Kitulani Shg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is called Jemima; a member of Kitulani S.H.G.  She is married and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially on enterprise development and savings mobilization. 

Jemima engages in farming of indigenous vegetables where she sells them in a local supermarket. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more vegetables seeds and manure which will increase her vegetables production and hence meet her customer's demands.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy vegetables seeds and manure to increase her vegetables production hence meet her customer's demands.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 60 years old; she takes care of her two grandchildren.  She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially on savings and enterprise development. 

To earn an income, she is involved in weaving traditional baskets as a business. She also buys and sells sugarcane. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more weaving materials e.g wool and sisal to enable her make more baskets for increased income. This will enable her pay secondary school tuition fees for her grandchild.

Martha is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more weaving materials e.g. sisal and wool thus make more baskets for increased income to pay secondary school tuition fees for her grandchild.

loans.name: Arkan

texts.en:
Arkan is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man who lives with his mother and his brother. They cooperate together to fulfill their lifestyle. 

He works as a private teacher. He takes this profession as he feels that he is helping students to get the needed education. He prepared a special room in his house where he receives his students. 

Today, Arkan is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new laptop to help in his work with the aim of increasing his productivity and income. 

He wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, salt, soap, biscuits, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA ESPERANZA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina ella es soltera y tiene 51 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank, “Nueva Esperanza.” This bank is located in the Calca District, belonging to the Calca Province and the Cusco Department.

This member is Paulina. She is single and 51 years old. She works in her grocery store. She sells staples like rice, sugar, milk, and crackers. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She already has worked for many years in this business and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to grow her grocery store business. She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.

The other members make their livings from businesses selling sweets, selling clothing, a grocery store, and a bookstore.

Paulina is thankful to those who are part of this dream through this means and she promises to make her payments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.

loans.name: Patzulin 3 Group

texts.es:
Diego (es el segundo del lado derecho de la fotografía de playera verde) un hombre de 55 años de edad, él se encuentra  muy agradecido por el crédito al que tuvo la oportunidad de acceder pues gracias a ello logro comprar sus insumos agrícolas y logro producir una buena cosecha de banano, él ahora solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar sus fertilizantes, y pagar la mano de obra para el mantenimiento del cultivo de café.

El gran anhelo de Diego es poder incrementar su cultivo y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Diego (the person second from the right in green t-shirt in the photograph) is a 55-year-old man. He is very thankful for the loan that he had the opportunity to get. Thanks to this, he succeeding in buying his agricultural supplies and succeeded in producing a good banana harvest. 

He now requests a new loan to buy fertilizers and to pay workers to maintain his coffee crop.

Diego’s biggest desire is to be able to grow his crop and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay workers to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Tiempo De Esperanza Group

texts.es: Doña Emilce es una de las integrantes del Banco Mujer Tiempo de Esperanza, tiene 56 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de su actividad, uno mayor de edad y otro menor de edad que cursa la primaria. Vive en una parcela que les otorgó una institución del estado el I.D.A., en una comunidad rural llamada La Curia. Ella junto con su esposo trabajan en su parcela, crian animales y siembran. Ha trabajado muy fuerte para ayudar en su hogar, debido a que es la única fuente de ingreso económico en su familia. Tiene gran experiencia en la cria de cerdos, la cual es la actividad principal. Debido a eso ve en los créditos de Fundación Mujer una ayuda para seguir reforzando su proyecto de crianza de cerdos, generando así ingresos a su hogar. Ella ha hecho un plan de trabajo en el que involucra a sus hijos para realizar las labores domesticas y de campo. Tiene muchas metas y deseos de superación, pero una de las cosas más importantes para ella es poder brindarles estudio a sus hijos, y tener un negocio propio para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y sus familias.Junto con Emilce trabajan tres socias más que invertirán su préstamo en ganado y cerdos.
texts.en:
Emilce is a member of the communal bank called Banco Mujer Tiempo de Esperanza. She is 56, married, and has 2 dependent children, one of whom is an adult and another who is a minor studying at primary school. Emilce lives on a plot of land given to them by the state through the IDA programme, in a rural community called La Curia. She works with her husband on their land, rearing animals and planting crops. She has worked really hard to support the home, as she is the family's only source of economic income. She has a lot of experience rearing pigs, which is her main area of work.

This is why she looks to the Fundación Mujer for help to continue rearing pigs, and thus generating a family income. She has designed a work plan that involves her children helping out with domestic and farming chores. She has many goals and desires to get ahead. One of the most important things for her is to provide an education for her children and to have her own business to improve her own and her family's quality of life.

Three other female members of Emilce's group want to invest their loan in livestock and pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrates (a type of pig feed).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy material to recycle.

loans.name: Mohigul

texts.ru: Мохигул успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день у нее с хозяйстве имеется: 5 коров, 6 овец, а также на 0,10 Га земли выращивает огурцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мохигул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля, удобрений. Мохигул является участником группы "Достук-7", всего в группе состоит 3 человека. Доходы от кредита Мохигул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины.
texts.en: Mohigul successfully repaid her loan and she is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone who helped to finance her. Now she has five cows and six sheep, and also grows cucumbers on 0.1 hectares of land. Her monthly income is 18,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Mohigul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy seed potatoes and fertilizer. Mohigul is a member of the "Dostuk-7" group which comprises three people. Mohigul plans to invest the profits from the loan in further expanding her business, and plans to save up to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy high quality seed potatoes and fertilizer to grow organic produce.

loans.name: With God Group

texts.en:
These members are part of With God Group, and they are beginning their sixth loan cycle with ID Ghana. The group is made up of four members. The members’ businesses include beads, panties, cooked food (fufu and soup, banku and stew, etc.), and groceries. 

This loan will help their small businesses, including Mildred's. This is her sixth loan from ID Ghana, having joined at a friend’s invitation. 

Mildred has a business selling assorted underwear and beads, and says that she started this business with a little bit of capital on her parents’ recommendation. 

She will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy more assorted underwear and beads at wholesale price and then sell them to customers. 

This work will allow her to generate income with which to support her family. She is married and has three children. When asked what she likes abut ID Ghana, she says that she likes the health care that the institution provides. 

The group will need a total amount of GHS 6,400 to better their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more assorted underwear and beads at wholesale price and then sell them to customers.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 51 year-old woman, who lives in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. She is widow and takes care on her own with a student son. 

Nino works as a sales lady at the local store and gets insignificant income, that is hardly enough to meet even basic needs of her family. She is eager to make her own business and somehow increase the living condition of family. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living.  

So she decided to start clothing trading business with the loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Nino’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. 

She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  Nino will purchase stock of clothing at wholesale prices in Turkey and will sell in her community in increased prices. She will work on a private orders also and get the chance to tackle with the financial difficulties. 

Nino and her son rely on the good will of lenders and will be very grateful for the financial support. They await your kindness.

loans.use: To start her own business to trade with clothing

loans.name: Cintia Lucero

texts.en:
Cintia is 20 years old, single, and works in retail. She lives with her parents who have a business where they rent chairs, tables, etc., for family events.

Cintia used to help them, but two years ago she decided to start her own business and began to sell clothes, shoes, jewelry, and other items outside of her house. 

She is asking for a loan to buy women's clothes for Mother's Day and the spring season. Her goal is to become independent and achieve financial stability on her own.

loans.use: To buy clothes and jewelry for Mother's Day and the spring season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chickens and primary materials for her embroidery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy baby goats for rearing and selling for profit

loans.name: Juliana's Group

texts.en:
These members form a group called Yesu mo. They are on their ninth loan cycle with ID Ghana. The group has five members. They sell cooking utensils, slippers, laddles, beads, head gears and frozen food. 

The featured borrower is Evelyn, who is 32 years old and single and has no child. This loan benefits the small group of micro-entrepreneurs where Evelyn is a member. She says that this is the ninth time she has joined ID Ghana. She joined through an invitation from a cousin who is a member of the institution. Currently, Evelyn has a business selling slippers and cooking utensils. She buys slippers and cooking utensils from the main market at wholesale prices and sells them to her customers. She says that the business started with a little capital she had and that it still will need financial support. That is why she has come to ID Ghana, so that she can grow the business. 

The group will need a total amount of GHS 4,100 to grow their businesses, and they will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy slippers and cooking utensils from the main market at wholesale prices and sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 50 years old from Baniswef. She is married and has 3 sons and 2 daughters and another married daughter. Her husband is a part time farmer with a very low income. 

Zeinab sells fruits and vegetables and she requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy a kiosk and more fruits and vegetables, such as tomatoes, potatoes and apples to increase her sales and her income for the family.

loans.use: to buy a kiosk and more fruits and vegetables to increase income for the family

loans.name: Shama

texts.en: Shama is 37 years old and is from Baniswef. She is married and has two sons and a daughter. Her husband suffers from arthritis and has knee issues so he is unable to resume his regular job. He now works as a security guard earning a very low salary. Sahma rented a shop and started a small falafel restaurant business to be able to cover her family's monthly expenses. She requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy a fryer and some raw materials.

loans.use: To buy a fryer and some raw materials.

loans.name: El Arroyo Group

texts.es:
En un municipio mexiquense aún se conservan riquezas naturales admirables como el arroyo que es símbolo de identidad y orgullo para sus habitantes quienes cuidan celosamente este lugar turístico ya que, para ellos, es un patrimonio donde se da cita una gran variedad de aves.
   En esa comunidad se encuentra Lourdes, una mujer emprendedora, activa, alegre pero sobre todo trabajadora. Ella lucha todos los días por sacar adelante a su familia; Alfredo es su esposo y juntos han criado a cinco hijos.
   Lourdes se dedica a la cría y venta de becerros, compra los animales desde pequeños y tarda aproximadamente seis años en que alcanzar el peso adecuado para su venta. El proceso puede parecer tardado pero las ganancias que obtiene son mayores y eso la motiva para seguir adelante con el negocio. Actualmente tiene clientes fijos en su comunidad y éstos le ayudan a conseguir nuevos clientes.
   Lourdes busca mejorar sus recursos económicos para mantener a su familia y especialmente para pagar los gastos de educación de sus hijos ya que su mayor anhelo es que terminen una carrera profesional. De esta manera los pequeños podrían tener mejores oportunidades de vida.
   Los miembros del grupo se muestran muy agradecidos con el crédito, a Lourdes le ayuda a comprar más ganado y a mantener su fondo para gastos de emergencia, por ejemplo, medicamentos o alimentos especiales que necesitan los animales si estos llegan a enfermar. Clara, Mauricia, Juana y Teresa invertirán en su propia actividad que es la crianza de borregos.
 *Lourdes es quien tiene el suéter verde, la fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras debajo del kiosco municipal*
texts.en:
In a Mexican municipality, they still conserve the rich, admirable nature, such as the stream, which is a symbol of identify and pride for the residents who zealously take care of this tourist site, since, for them, it is part of their heritage, where one can see a great variety of birds. 

Lourdes lives in this community. She is an enterprising, active, and happy woman, but above all, she is hard working. She fights everyday to take her family forward. Alfredo is her husband, and together, they have raised five children. 

Lourdes is dedicated to raising and selling cattle. She buys the animals when they are young and waits about six years until they reach an adequate weight to sell them. The process can seem long, but the earnings she obtains are better, and this is her motivation for continuing on with the business. At present, she has fixed clients in her community, and these people help her get new clients. 

Lourdes wants to improve her income to take care of her family and, in particular, to pay for the education costs for his children, since her biggest desire is that they complete professional degrees. In this way, the young ones will be able to have better opportunities in life. 

The members of the group are very thankful for the loan. It will help Lourdes buy more cattle and to maintain her fund for emergency expenses, such as medicines or special foods that the animals need if they become ill.

Clara, Mauricia, Juana, and Teresa will invest in their own work raising cattle. 

* Lourdes is wearing the green sweater. The photograph was taken on the stairs under the municipal gazebo.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

location.town: San Juan Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Bukuri Sung - Nyeko Group

texts.en:
Fati is a 36-year-old woman from Nyeko in the Northern region of Ghana. Fati is married and has 6 children. Fati is the individual pictured with the raised hand seated in the middle among members sitting.
	
Fati is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for about 4 years. The name of the group is ‘Bukuru Sung - Nyeko’. Fati earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea nuts & butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local and export markets.

Fati and ‘Bukuru Sung – Nyeko’ have requested a loan of GHS 5,210.00. Fati's share of the loan is GHS 208.40, which would help her to buy shea nuts for processing. Fati wants to earn more income to repay this loan and enable her to take good care of her children in school.

Fati thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Dilnozahon

texts.ru: Дилнозахон, 22 года, замужем, есть сын. Дилнозахон занимается сельским хозяйством, на 0,70 Га земли она выращивает картофель, огурцы и помидоры. Есть дойная корова с теленком, на ежедневной основе Дилнозахон продает молоко. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дилнозахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки нетели, часть средств будет потрачена на полеводство, Дилнозахон купит удобрения и семена хлопка. Она является участником группы "Достук-7", всего в группе состоит 3 человека. Доходы от кредита Дилнозахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Dilnozahon is 22 years old, married, and has a son. Dilnozahon is a farmer and grows potatoes, cucumbers and tomatoes on 0.7 hectares of land. She has a dairy cow and calf, and Dilnozahon sells milk on a daily basis. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Dilnozahon has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to increase the number of her livestock by buying a heifer, and to spend part of the funds on crop farming. Dilnozahon will buy fertilizer and cotton seeds. She is a member of the "Dostuk-7" group which comprises three people. Dilnozahon plans to invest the profits from the loan is further expanding her business and plans to save up money to renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy a heifer, cotton seeds, and fertilizer to grow organic produce.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
This is 47 year-old Saidu.  He is married, and has four children aged 22, 20,18 and 7yrs. In 2011, Saidu established his electronics business. He began his business because he is not educated, so the only source of survival was to do business. His business is located in outskirts of the city and his main customers are men and women. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 900000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Saidu requires a loan in order to improve the business to buy more electronics like touch lights, radios, tapes, stabilizers etc. for resale. 

He hopes that this loan will help the business to grow and cater for more customers which as a result would increase his profit margin.  In the future, Saidu plans to extend his kiosk to a shop to accommodate more stock. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more electronics like touch lights, radios, etc.

loans.name: La Corona Group

texts.es:
Dentro de una tranquila comunidad mexiquense dedicada principalmente al cultivo de maíz se formó el grupo La Corona. Los integrantes concentran las características de todo el pueblo, es decir, son amables, alegres y trabajadores. 
   Con un claro gesto de emoción, Miguel Ángel recuerda como inició su actividad "Desde muy pequeño aprendí el oficio de mis padres, siempre me gustaba ayudarles" comenta. Desde hace ocho años es comerciante de productos para el hogar; desde muy joven vendía entre la gente que acudía a los tianguis, plazas y eventos del municipio. Gradualmente fue adquiriendo más mercancía, incluso ahora vende en otras entidades del país. 
   Apenas hace seis meses Miguel Ángel se casó con Jazmín y aunque aún no tienen familia, están muy felices porque lograron adquirir un local donde ahora venden productos para el hogar y artículos de fantasía como accesorios para el cabello y otro tipo de adornos. A pesar de ello, Miguel Ángel no deja de vender de forma directa en la calle mientras que Jazmín se dedica a atender el local. La meta de ambos es lograr convertirse en micro empresarios y para ello trabajan incansablemente, siempre pensando en mejorar sus ingresos para el momento en que decidan tener niños. 
   Con la oportunidad del préstamo podrán comprar vasos de licuadora, trapos para cocina, cucharas, pinzas, moños, bolitas, listones, cortaúñas, limas para uñas, entre otros accesorios.

Miguel se muestra muy emocionado con su negocio y no pierde la esperanza de algún día emplear a mas personas de su propia comunidad o del lugar donde vende.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el pastizal donde Doña Magdalena saca a pastar a sus borreguitos.
texts.en:
In this tranquil Mexican community dedicated mainly to corn cultivation, the La Corona group was formed. The members bring together the characteristics of all of the village, that is, they are kind, happy, and hard-working.

With a clear expression of emotion, Miguel Ángel remembers how he began his activity. “From very young, I learned the trade from my parents; I always liked to help them,” he comments. For eight years he has sold products for the home; from a very young age, he has sold to the people who go to the street markets, plazas, and municipal events. Gradually, he went acquiring more merchandise, and even now he sells in other parts of the country.

It has barely been six months since Miguel Ángel got married to Jazmín, and although they don’t yet have a family, they are very happy because they were able to acquire a store where they now sell products for the home and novelty items, such as hair accessories and other types of ornaments. Despite this, Miguel Ángel he has not stopped selling directly on the streets while Jazmín looks after the store. For both of them, their goal is to be able to convert themselves into small business entrepreneurs and for this they work untiringly, always thinking of improving their income for the time when they decide to have children.

With the opportunity of the loan, they will be able to purchase blender glasses, kitchen rags, spoons, tongs, bows, beads, ribbons, nail clippers, and nail files, among other accessories.

Miguel is very excited by his business and is not losing the hope that someday he will employ more people from his own community or the place that he makes his sales.

*The photograph was taken in the pasture where Magdalena takes her lambs to graze.

loans.use: to purchase products like cleaning cloths, kitchen rags, spoons, tongs, etc.

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a borrowing for the first time from UGAFODE Microfinanace. She applied for ugx1,000,000. Esther is a fresh graduate of Makerere University who managed to start up a small retail shop. Her working capital is so small. She managed to raise her startup capital with the help of her mother in the village who sold off some of her goats. 

She operates her retail shop in the outskirts of the city. Esther has many clients that frequent her shop for her merchandise since her shop is the only one in the area. She has always found herself not in position to serve all of them since her stock is still small. 
She applied for the loan to boost her working capital. This will help her increase her sales and profits.
Esther has high hope of growing her business to an extent of transforming it to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy retail stocks of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Haladu

texts.en:
Haladu is a Babban Gona farmer from Rogo Daggu Vilage. Haladu joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Haladu will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. 

This year, Haladu is very optimistic and hopes to harvest 60 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona, Haladu has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and would like to use his extra earnings from his farm to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food for reselling, a refrigerator and showcases in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Pedro Vicente

texts.es: Pedro llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla hace 20 años oriundo del departamento de Santander.  En su búsqueda de conseguir una oportunidad laborar, inició como conductor y en compañía de su cónyuge quien es confeccionista, colocó un enfriador surtido de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas que comercializa desde su vivienda ubicada en la zona metropolitana de Barranquilla.  Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del sector y transeúntes, quienes pueden acceder a consumir estos productos todos los días en un horario muy amplio de 8 a.m. a 10 p.m En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en canastas de cervezas y gaseosas.  Este negocio ha favorecido la economía familiar, permitiéndole generar ingresos adicionales para el beneficio de su familia.  Pedro es padre de tres hijos de 20, 17 y 7 años y una hija de 15 años de edad, a quienes desea ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor educación. Su meta familiar es hacerle mejoras a su vivienda con los recursos que puedan proveer él y su esposa.
texts.en:
Pedro moved from the department of Santander to the city of Barranquilla twenty years ago. In order to find job opportunities, he started out as a driver. Alongside his wife, who is a seamstress, he also started a home business selling cold drinks like soda and beer. His home is located in Barranquilla's metropolitan area. His main customers are local neighbors and passers-by, who can access his product virtually all day every day. His schedule is from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm.

He is currently requesting a Kiva loan, which is his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest it in cases of beer and soda. This business has improved his household finances by allowing him to make extra income for the benefit of his family. Pedro is a father of four. He has three boys ages twenty, seventeen, and seven, and a fifteen-year-old girl. He wants to be able to give them a better quality of life and a better education. His goal for the family is to make improvements on his home, using the resources generated by him and his wife.

loans.use: to invest in cases of beer and soda.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Doña  Blanca tiene 51 años de edad y vive con su hija en casa propia ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos para consumo, tiene más de 15 años de experiencia la cual inicio con capital propio, vende sus productos durante todo el año con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pesticidas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Doña Blanca is 51 years old and lives with her daughter in her own home. She makes a living by cultivating bulk grains for consumption. She has more than 15 years of experience, which she started with her own capital. She sells her products throughout the whole year. With what she earns, she manages to pay for some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan so she can buy pesticides, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. and by doing so have a better income.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers, manure, pest control,etc.

loans.name: Kpanmanga- Nakpayili Group

texts.en:
Safura is a 46-year-old hard working woman from Nakpayili in the Northern region of Ghana. She is married with four children. Safura is the individual pictured in the middle waving with both hands among members standing at the back.
	
She is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for about 18 years. The name of the group is Kpanmanga - Nakpayili. She earns a good profit from the business since the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business so that they can always produce premium quality for the local and export markets.

Safura and Kpanmanga - Nakpayili have requested a loan of GHS 8,000. Her share of the loan is GHS 700 which would help her to buy shea nuts for processing. She wants to earn more income to repay this loan and support her children with food and clothing.

She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 43 years of age. He is married with three children. The ages of his children are 11, 8, and 6 years old. All the children are in school. Daniel lives in  Cape Coast in the Cape Coast Metropolitan Assembly of Central Region of Ghana. Daniel completed, but due to financial difficulties he was not able to further his education. 

He sells electrical goods and has been in business for the past ten years and has gained considerable experience on the field. He has been with the field partner since 2009 with good repayment records. Daniel is very optimistic about the future prospects of his business and plans to be a major distributor of both tropical  and coaxial cables in the next 5 years. 

Daniel is hopeful that the income he will earn in future from his electrical sales will enable him to uplift the living standards of his family and to give the best education to his children. Daniel needs additional working capital to add to his existing capital to enable him buy varieties of electrical goods at wholesale price for resell to his customers so as to meet his business aspirations. Daniel is most grateful to all his micro-lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: To buy televisions, extension boards, bulbs, gas cylinders, burners, rechargeable lights, and electrical wires for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal so she can meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Gulbarg

texts.ru:
Гулбарг женщина, которая очень любить готовить блюдо. Она вкусно готовить и талантливая женщина. Гулбарг занимается поваром в столовое. Она с детства мечтала стать хорошим поваром, и она после окончания школы выбрала эту деятельность. Гулбарг занимается поваром более 5 лет. Она обращается любезно и с уважением к своим клиентам. Вот почему она всегда имеет множество клиентов. 
Гулбарг 41 летняя и замужняя женщина, и у нее одна 18 летняя дочка. Дочка учиться  в университете. Она занята с учебой. У Гулбарг еще есть одна сестренка. Ее сестренка скора, выходить замуж. Гулбарг ее сестра и решила помочь сестренке купить свадебные принадлежности. У Гулбарг не хватает денежных средств для покупки свадебные принадлежности. Из-за нехватки денежных средств Гулбарг обратилась за кредитом.  Вы можете помочь Гулбаргу и ей сестренке. Гулбарг будет очень рада за Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulbarg is a woman who very much likes to prepare food. She cooks tasty food and is a talented woman. Gulbarg works as a cook at a canteen. Since childhood she dreamed of becoming a good cook and after finishing school she chose this profession. Gulbarg has worked as a cook for more than five years. She addresses her customers with courtesy and respect. Therefore she always has many customers. 

Gulbarg is a 41 year old and married woman, and she has an 18 year old daughter. Her daughter studies at the university and is busy with her studies. Gulbarg also has a sister. Her sister is soon getting married. Since Gulbarg is her sister, she decided to help her purchase wedding accessories. 

Gulbarg does not have enough money to purchase wedding accessories. Due to this she applied for a loan. You can help Gulbarg and her sister. Gulbarg will be very happy for support.

loans.use: to purchase wedding accessories for her sister

loans.name: Mohamed A.

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Mohamed.  He is married, and has 3 children aged 7, 5 and 2. He has one additional dependent, who live with him for schooling.  In 2005, Mohamed established his ready made items business. He began his business just to develop himself and his family. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,624,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to develop his business by purchasing more stock like dozens of shoes and shirts for resale. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits. In the future, Mohamed plans to expand his business to educate his children and build another house.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more ready made cloth for his shop

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия 49 летняя женщина. Она замужем и мать троих детей. У нее двое сыновей и одна дочка. Сыновьям 20 и 16 лет. Дочке 17 лет. Муж занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота на районе. Многие жители района занимаются сельскохозяйственной деятельностью, но Зулфия выбрала швейную деятельность, потому что ее мама раньше занималась этой видом сфере и она решила продвигать деятельность метери. Зулфия профессионал своей работе. Ее доходы только от этой деятельностью. Ей на работе нравится ежедневные доходы, и сшить больше женские одежды. Зулфия хочет  увеличить  ежедневный доход и улучшить условия жизни семью. Для увеличения дохода ей необходимо купить новую швейную машинку,  чтобы  ускорить процесс работы. Новая швейная машинка стоит дорого, но у Зулфии нет такое количество денег для купли машинки, и она решилась обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: Zulfiya is a 49-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of three children. She has two sons and a daughter. Her sons are 20 and 16 years old, and her daughter is 17. Her husband raises cattle in the area. Many residents of the area are engaged in farming, but Zulfiya has chosen the sewing business because her mother used to work in this type of field and so she decided to carry on her mother's activity. Zulfiya is a professional in her work. Her sole income is from this business. What she likes about this work is having daily income and sewing women's clothes. Zulfiya wants to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. In order to increase her income, she needs to buy a new sewing machine in order to speed up her work. A new sewing machine is expensive, but Zulfiya does not have such a sum of money to buy one and she has decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in his business repairing his bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more steel plates, pipes, flat bows, welding rod etc to help his children continue to higher education

loans.name: Los G De San Joaquin Group

texts.es:
En México aún existen comunidades con elementos tradicionales y naturales sorprendentes. Aunque para llegar a ellas hay que caminar varios kilómetros el hecho de conocer el gran ambiente y tradiciones de dichos pueblos hace gratificante el esfuerzo.
   Felipe y María Raquel tienen dieciséis años de relación durante los cuales han cuidado de sus cuatro hijos, tres de ellos continúan con sus estudios y son la motivación de la familia. 
   Desde los catorce años Felipe ingresó al mundo laboral como chofer de taxi, entonces era empleado y así permaneció durante diez años. Sin embargo, el hecho de formar su propia familia y generar mayores ingresos lo llevó a comprar su propia unidad. Con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo conseguir las placas y la documentación para reglamentar su auto y ahora labora libremente en la comunidad. 
  Felipe trabaja desde el amanecer y hasta que se pone el sol, ya que, además de solventar los gastos corrientes de la casa, quiere que sus hijos tengan una formación académica profesional. Otra meta es poder remodelar su unidad para ofrecer mayor comodidad a los pasajeros. 
   El mantenimiento de su taxi es de suma importancia y por eso el préstamo es de suma importancia ya que podrá comprar llantas, amortiguadores y cambiar los aceites.
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son María Raquel quien invertirá en un centro de cómputo; Yolanda, en su taxi; Santiago y Elizabeth, en adquirir borregos.
texts.en:
There are still communities in Mexico that have surprising traditional and natural elements. In order to get to them you have to walk several kilometers, but getting to know the great atmosphere and traditions of these villages is well worth the effort.

Felipe and María Raquel have been together for sixteen years and have raised four children. Three of them are still in school and are the family's motivation. Felipe entered the workforce at age fourteen as a taxi driver. He remained employed at this job for ten years. However, having started his own family and in order to generate more income, he decided to buy his own cab. His effort and dedication allowed him to get the license plates and documents that he needed for his cab to comply with regulations and now he works on his own throughout town. Felipe works from sunrise to sunset because, aside from covering regular household expenses, he wants his children to have a higher education. Another of his goals is being able to update his cab so that his customers can travel more comfortably.
 
Maintenance on his cab is of utmost importance, which is why this loan is vital to him. It will allow him to buy new tires, shock absorbers, and motor oil for oil changes. 

The other members of this group are María Raquel, Yolanda, and Santiago. They will invest in a computer station, a taxi, and lambs, respectively.

loans.use: to buy tires, shock absorbers, and motor oil.

loans.name: Bello

texts.en:
Bello is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rogo Yanoko Village. Bello joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for his children's school fees. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Bello will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Bello has set high goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize. With increased yields and incomes, Bello has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Tercer Cielo Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad mexiquense se creó el grupo Tercer Cielo conformado por personas honestas, trabajadoras y con una amplia devoción por sus tradiciones religiosas, de ahí la razón de su nombre. 
   Felisa, mejor conocida como Feli, es una persona muy amable pero también muy precavida y respetuosa, madre de tres hijos.
   Ella se dedica a la venta de joyería de oro y plata y productos de plástico para el hogar por lo que todos los días se  levanta muy temprano para salir y ofrecer la mercancía. No hace mucho tiempo le robaron el muestrario donde colocaba la joyería hecho que la detuvo por algún tiempo pero comprendió que no podía darse por vencida pues sus hijos también dependen, de cierta manera, del éxito de su actividad.
   El sueño de Felisa es poder obtener un medio de transporte propio esto le ayudaría a mejorar sus ventas al llevar las piezas a otras localidades. Este sueño lo veía muy lejano tiempo atrás pero hoy es casi una realidad. El préstamo que ella espera recibir lo utilizará para comprar más artículos de plástico. Con un poco más de esfuerzo y algunos ahorros, podrá cumplir su objetivo.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Judith quien invertirá en una dulcería, Felisa en recipientes de plástico, Alicia y Ricardo en ropa y Martha en bordados artesanales.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio, Felisa es quien tiene el vestido largo*
texts.en:
In a community in the State of Mexico the "Tercer Cielo" group was formed, made up of honest, hard-working people who share a great devotion for their religious traditions, which is where the name comes from.

Felisa, better known as Feli, is a friendly person who is also cautious and respectful. She is the mother of 3 children. She works selling gold and silver jewellery and plastic goods for the household. So every day she gets up very early to go out and offer her goods. Not long ago someone robbed her display where she hung her jewellery which stooped her for some time. But she understands that she can't give up, defeated, as her children also depend on her and in a manner, on the success of her business.

Felisa's dream is to be able to obtain her own means of transportation as it would help her to increase her sales transporting her pieces to other places. She has had this dream from a long time back and today it is almost a reality.

The loan she hopes to receive will be used to buy more plastic goods. With a bit more effort and some savings she can achieve her objective.

The other members of the group are Judith who will invest in her candy store, Felisa in plastic goods, Alicia and Ricardo in clothing and Martha in handcrafted embroidery. The photo was taken in the municipal garden. Felisa is wearing the long dress.

loans.use: to buy more plastic goods.

loans.name: Annette

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Annette. She is married and has 4 children, aged 19, 9, 3 and 3 years. 

In 2013, Annette established her bar where she sells drinks. She began her business because she was trained by her parents to be self-employed. Her business is located in a city center, and her customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week, 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from her business. 

Annette would like to take a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL in order to buy more crates of assorted drinks to resell. She hopes that this loan will help her business grow, allow her to cater to more customers, and increase her profit margin.  

One of Annette's major challenges is the shortage of drinks which could reduce her number of good customers. In the future, she plans to have a big business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more crates of assorted drinks to resell.

loans.name: Wuni Ni Song -Pusuga Group

texts.en:
Jamila is a 48-year-old hard working woman from Pusuga in the Northern region of Ghana. She is married and has five children. She is the individual pictured carrying a basin of shea nuts standing among members.
	
She is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for about four years. The name of the group is Wuni Ni Song-Pusuga. Jamila earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea nuts and butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local and export markets.

Jamila and Wuni Ni Song-Pusuga have asked for a loan of GHS 5,400. Jamila’s share of the loan is GHS 500 which would help her to buy shea nuts for processing. She wants to earn more income to repay this loan and support her children with clothing and food.

She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Rugiatu, 34, is married and has three children aged 23, 20 and 18 years. Her husband’s nephews are dependent on her and live with the family as well.

In 2001 Rugiatu started selling charcoal in order to support the home because her husband was unemployed. Her business is located in the outskirts of Freetown East. Working six days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about 600,000 SLL every month.

Rugiatu is applying for a 5,000,000 SLL loan through Kiva’s field partner ARD in order to buy more bags of charcoal to sell and so increase her stock. In the future Rugiatu plans to build a house for her family and a bigger carpentry shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hugo Yeshiel

texts.en:
Hugo Yeshiel is a 25-year-old entrepreneur. He has an agency that makes corporate videos used to promote business. 

He is asking for a loan to pay for some expenses that he needs to cover before obtaining his college degree. He says that he started the company six years ago and fortunately he has been able to maintain it. 

His goal is to grow it and offer different types of services to his clients. His parents describe Hugo Yeshiel as hard working and very responsible. They are willing to vouch for him.

loans.use: To pay for expenses related to his college degree.

loans.name: Chogola Group

texts.es: Luis, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero, tiene 3 hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá junto a sus hijos, padre y hermanos. Hace 15 años que se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando maíz, frijol y papas, la producción la vende en la misma zona. Luis está solicitando un préstamo por 8,000 Lempiras y es en forma grupal, con este préstamo va comprar semilla, insecticidas, fertilizantes para siembra y asistencia al cultivo de papas. Su fin es incrementar el nivel de producción para obtener mejores ganancias en la próxima cosecha. El grupo que ha formado se llama Chogola, esta integrado por tres personas que se dedican al cultivo de papas, maíz y frijol, ellos se conocen en su comunidad y solicitan un préstamo de 8,000 lempiras cada uno haciendo un total grupal por 24,000 lempiras. Con este préstamo van a comprar semillas e insumos para el cultivo de papas. En la foto esta Santos Leonardo a la izquierda, Santos Anastacio y Luis a la derecha.
texts.en:
Luis is 32 years old, single, and has 3 children. He resides in a small village in the Intibucá Municipality along with his children, father, and siblings. For 15 years he has made a living from agriculture, cultivating corn, beans, and potatoes. He sells the products in the same zone. 

Luis is requesting a loan for 8,000 Lempiras and it is in group form. With this loan he is going to purchase seed, insecticides, and fertilizers for sowing and helping the potato crop. His goal is to increase the level of production to make better profits from the next harvest. 

The group that he has formed is called Chogola. It is made up of three people who make their livings from cultivating potatoes, corn, and beans. They know each other from their community and are requesting a loan of 8,000 Lempiras each, for a group total of 24,000 Lempiras. With this loan they are going to purchase seed and supplies for cultivating potatoes. In the photo, Santos Leonardo is on the left, and Santos Anastacio and Luis are on the right.

loans.use: to purchase seed and supplies for sowing and helping the potato crop.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Mohamed.  He is married, and has two children aged eleven and four years. He has one additional dependent, his younger brother who lives with him to assist in the business.  In 2010, Mohamed established his drinks business. He was trained to do business by his late uncle, so he decided to continue with the same business. His business is located in outskirts of the city and his main customers are men and women. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1000000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5000000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy more assorted cartons of drinks, bundles of pure water etc for resale. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his stock level and to gain more profit to meet his target.  In the future, Mohamed plans to educate his children to university level.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more assorted cartons of drinks etc. for resale to be able to afford university for his children

loans.name: Priscilla Abiodun

texts.en:
Priscilla, 48, is married and has four children who are nineteen and nine plus three-year-old twins. In 2013 Priscilla started a used clothing business in order to bring in some income. Her business is located in the center of Freetown East, and her customers are both men and women. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 1,300,000 SLL every month.

Priscilla is applying for a 5,000,000 loan through Kiva’s field partner ARD in order to buy used items such as chairs, tapes, DVDs, etc. to sell and so increase her profits. In the future, Priscilla plans to have a big business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy used items such as chairs, tapes, DVDs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ado

texts.en:
Ado is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rogo Yanoko Village. Ado joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ado will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. 

This year, Ado has grand plans of harvesting 50 bags of maize, which will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ado now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe es una mujer de 49 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo varón de 13 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 10 y 18 años, y su negocio es la venta de frutas. 
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, buena madre, constante, luchadora, y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en un puesto fijo de venta en la zona ‘Tejar’ Ubicado al noroeste de la ciudad, donde el comercio es la principal actividad, llegando a tener un movimiento económico superior a los 500 mil dólares por día. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4 -15 grados centígrados. 
Guadalupe es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro/gris largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que desarrolla. Su vida la realiza con su esposo que trabaja como chófer y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de frutas por mayor, los productores del campo llegan hasta su puesto de venta a entregarle grandes cantidades de frutas que ella almacena y vende al por mayor. Su rutina diaria comienza desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana cuando saca la fruta para acomodarla y exponerla escogiendo las de mejor apariencia para que se vea fresca y saludable. “inicié mi negocio como vendedora ambulante, luego compré un puesto fijo de venta y trato de seguir mejorando mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes constantes la desventaja es que no cuenta con capital de inversión para ofertar mayor cantidad. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y abrir otro puesto de venta y desea realizar la compra de fruta de temporada como; fresa-fresón, nísperos, plátano, naranja, mandarina, limón, pomelo y otros por mayor, para ofertar fruta de temporada a sus clientes y abrir un nuevo puesto de venta. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años de experiencia en que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Guadalupe solicita un préstamo para comprar fruta de temporada por mayor para abrir un nuevo puesto de venta y ayudar a sus hijos a terminar la escuela.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 49 years old and married. She has a son, who is thirteen, and two daughters, ages ten and eighteen. She is an enterprising and independent woman, a good mother, and a persevering and dedicated hard worker.

She works at a permanent fruit stand, located in Tejar, an area in the northwestern part of the city where there is lots of business activity and trade moves over $500,000 a day. The weather is cold and dry and temperatures during the day range between 4 and 15 degrees Celsius.

Guadalupe has dark skin, brown eyes, and black long hair with some grey, which she wears pulled back. She is short and of medium build. Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks at home, and she also speaks Spanish, which she uses in general and for her business. She lives with her husband, who works as a driver, and their children, who go to school. They live in their own home, which was built with bricks and cement, with a sheet metal roof. The home has electricity, water, and sewer. Her business is selling wholesale fruit. Local farmers come to her stand to deliver large quantities of fruit, which she stores and sells at wholesale prices. Her daily routine starts early in the morning when she brings out the fruit in order to arrange and display it, picking the best-looking pieces so they look fresh and healthy.

"I started my business as a street vendor, but then I bought a permanent stall and I'm still trying to continue to improve," she says. The advantage of her business is that she has regular customers, and the main disadvantage is that she doesn't have enough investment capital to offer larger quantities of her product.

Her goal is to expand her business and open a second fruit stand. She wants to buy seasonal fruit like strawberries, medlars, bananas, oranges, tangerines, lemons, grapefruit, and other wholesale fruits, in order to open her new stand. This is her fourth loan cycle through this organization, and she has twenty years of experience in her business.

For these reasons, Guadalupe is requesting a loan to buy wholesale seasonal fruit. She will open a new fruit stand and help her children finish school.

loans.use: to buy wholesale seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Jalpa La Bella Group

texts.es:
Jalpa la Bella es un nuevo grupo de préstamo en VisionFund. Los integrantes se encuentran emocionados de poder invertir en sus negocios o incluso comenzar una actividad. Socorro invertirá en desperdicio de leña; José Teófilo, en borregos; Carolina, en gorros y chalecos y Angelina, en una herrería. 
El grupo se conformó en una comunidad mazahua donde aún se conservan costumbres e incluso su lengua indígena. La mayor parte de la población se dedica a confeccionar guantes, gorros, bufandas de lana que se aprovechan muy bien en la temporada de invierno en la cual, las temperaturas son muy bajas. 
Idalia es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, tiene 26 años y está casada con Ismael quien trabaja como guardia de seguridad. Idalia es madre de cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya se encuentran estudiando secundaria y preescolar. 
Hace tres años, Idalia e Ismael decidieron emprender su propio negocio. Ismael estaba desempleado en aquél entonces, pero decidieron invertir el dinero de su finiquito para iniciar una actividad que les generara más ganancias. El dinero lo destinaron a la compra de computadoras, equipo y otros materiales requeridos en un Cibercafé. “Afortunadamente nos va muy bien porque no tenemos competencia, de hecho fue lo que nos animó, hacía falta un negocio así” comentó  doña Idalia.
Durante este periodo, la única dificultad que ha vivido Idalia ha sido durante la época de lluvia que afecta el funcionamiento de la Internet. Por esta razón ocupará el nuevo préstamo para comprar antenas de Internet y algunos accesorios como ratones y teclados. 
El sueño de Idalia es seguir expandiendo su negocio que actualmente cuenta con 10 computadoras. El objetivo de sus ganancias es seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que puedan terminar una carrera profesional. También le gustaría terminar de construir su casa y comprar muebles nuevos. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en una parte del parque del municipio, Idalia es quien tiene el suéter verde*
texts.en:
Jalpa la Bella is a new group with VisionFund loans. The members are excited to be able to invest in their businesses or even start new work. Socorro will invest in waste wood. Jose Teófilo in sheep, Carolina in hats and vests and Angelina in a blacksmith’s workshop.

This group was formed in a Mazahua community where they still preserve the customs and indigenous language. Most of the people work making gloves, hats, and woolen scarves taking advantage of the winter season when the temperature is very low.

Idalia is a very friendly and hardworking woman. She is 26 years old and is married to Ismael who works as a security guard. Idalia is a mother of four children, three of them are already in secondary and preschool.

Three years ago Idalia and Ismael decided to start their own business. Ismael was unemployed at that time, but they decided to invest the money from his settlement to begin a new business to generate more income.
