The money was used to buy computers, equipment and other supplies needed in an Internet cafe. “Fortunately we are doing very well because we do not have competition. In fact, we were motivated because of the lack of a business like this,” Idalia said.

During this time the only difficulty that Idalia lived through was during the rainy season as it affects the functioning of the Internet. This is the reason that she will use the new loan to buy Internet antennas and some accessories such as mice and keyboards.

Idalia’s dream is to go on expanding her business as currently she has 10 computers. She will use the income to continue to support her children in their studies so they can obtain a professional career. She would also like to finish building her home and buy new furniture.

The photograph was taken in a part of the municipal park. Idalia is wearing a green sweater.

loans.use: to buy Internet antennas

loans.name: Guadalajara Group

texts.es:
La mayoría de los habitantes de una comunidad mazahua en el Estado de México se dedican a la siembra y cosecha de maíz, pero a manera de apoyo también realizan artesanías.
   Rafael es un joven artesano que dedica su vida a la creación de ropa elaborada a base de estambre. El gusto por esta actividad se originó desde que él era muy pequeño, siempre estuvo habituado al oficio pues sus padres también son artesanos; “Es una actividad que se transmite de generación en generación” comenta lleno de orgullo Rafael. 
   Siempre quiso iniciar su propio negocio, es por eso con la ayuda de sus padres pudo comprar los materiales necesarios para la creación de las prendas. Posteriormente con las ganancias obtenidas compró más material y con esto aumentó su producción. 
   Todo el año se dedica a elaborar las prendas, lo que más le piden sus clientes son gorras, bufandas, guantes, calentadores, chalecos. A pesar de que sus ventas sean prácticamente sólo en invierno, Rafael procura tener siempre lista la mercancía para no fallar con ninguno de los clientes que le piden encargos. 
   En estas fechas Rafa, como le llaman sus compañeros de grupo, aprovecha para incrementar su producción por lo tanto el préstamo le ayudaría a comprar ganchos, estambres y agujas. 
   La visión emprendedora hace que Rafa sólo piense en el porvenir y conseguir más clientes para fin de año. Con las siguientes palabras expresa el plan que tiene a futuro “me gustaría darle trabajo a otras personas y poco a poco expandirnos a otras comunidades”.
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son Yolanda e Ivene dedicadas a vender ropa y Claudio quien tiene un negocio de comida. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleritas del kiosco, Rafael es quien viste una camisa a cuadros*
texts.en:
The majority of the inhabitants of a Mazahua community in the State of Mexico work in the sowing and harvesting of corn, but to supplement this, they also do crafts.

Rafael is a young artisan who makes a living by making clothing made out of yarn. The pleasure he gets from this activity developed at an early age. He was always accustomed to this trade because his parents are also artisans. "This is an activity that is transmitted from generation to generation," says Rafael, full of pride.

He always wanted to start his own business, that is why, with the help of his parents, he was able to buy the necessary materials for the creation of the clothing. Afterwards, with the earnings he obtained, he bought more materials and with these he increased his production.

Throughout the whole year he makes the clothes. What his customers most request are caps, scarves, gloves, stockings, and vests. Despite the fact that his sales practically only occur in winter, Rafael strives to always have his merchandise ready so that he won't disappoint any of the customers who place orders with him.

Around these dates, Rafa, as he is called by his fellow group members, tries to increase his production and therefore the loan would help him to buy hangers, yarn, and needles.

Rafa's entrepreneurial vision makes him think of the future and to get more customers by the end of the year. With the following words he expresses his future plans: "I would like to provide employment for other people, and little by little expand to other communities".

The other members of the group are Yolanda and Ivene, who sell clothes for a living, and Claudio, who has his own food business.

*The picture was taken at the stairs of the kiosk. Rafael is the one wearing the plaid shirt.

loans.use: to buy yarn, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 64 years old, married, and has three adult children. She resides in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Evelyn operates a passenger multi-cab manned by her husband. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month. 

Evelyn requested a loan from PMPC, which she will use to purchase multi-cab spare parts such as tires, tubes, and other accessories for maintenance. Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for almost 11 years. In the future, she hopes to purchase an additional multi-cab unit for hire.

loans.use: to purchase cab spare parts such as tires, tubes, and other accessories

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is 57 years old, married, and has three adult children. She lives in San Isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Pedrita is engaged in hog fattening, which she has been doing for five years. The couple earns approximately 2,500 PHP each month. 

Pedrita requested a loan from PMPC, which she will use to purchase two piglets and feed for her hog fattening business. She has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Pedrita hopes to expand her hog fattening business by purchasing more heads of piglets.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and feed

loans.name: Phebe

texts.en:
Phebe is 72 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children now at their adult ages. 

Phebe is presently enjoying her monthly pension in the amount of Php1,500 as a survivor of her late husband. She is also receiving support from her children. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing medicines for her maintenance. 

Phebe has been a member of PMPC for almost 13 years. She is now enjoying the products of PMPC, particularly on savings and insurance.

loans.use: to purchase medicines

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jovita is 64 years old now.

Jovita has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish for her business.

Jovita has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock such as Caro White skin lightening cream, Nutrelac baby food, hair weavons, sardines, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amalia is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.

Amalia has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Amalia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Generous

texts.en:
Generous is 37 years old, married with 5 children, and lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Generous is involved in farming, growing crops such as tomatoes, mangoes, bananas, as well as many others. She ventured into her commercial farming business in 2009 with the goal of educating her children, improving her family's standard of living, and obtaining food security for her family.  

Generous is a hardworking woman who is requesting a loan to put in fertilizer and improve her banana plantation. Nevertheless, many changes in weather, such as flooding, still hinder her business growth.

loans.use: to purchase manure to improve her banana plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plaster his house and complete his toilet.

loans.name: Mamoud

texts.en:
This is 25 year-old Mamand.  He is married, and has 2 children aged 15 and 3 years. He has one additional dependent, to assist him in the business.  In 2005, Mamand established his electrical appliances business. He began his business because he was trained up in business and studied business management that why he decided to set up his own business to be self-employed. His business is located in outskirts of the city and his main customers are contractors and the general public. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2000000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5000000. Mamand requires a new loan in order to buy more electrical appliances, like a musical set, television, home theatre and electrical fan for resale. He hopes that this loan will support him to grow and cater for more customers.   In the future, Mamand plans to be going out for more business stock in the United States of America and open another out let for business expansion.  He thank all Kiva lenders for their support.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more electrical appliances like musical set, television etc.

loans.name: Matiya

texts.en:
Matiya lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is 41 years old and a hardworking married man. He is also a farmer, does motorcycle transport to earn additional income. He has 6 children and 4 of these children attend school. He has managed to increase his monthly income and pay school fees for his children. He intends to buy a pickup vehicle to enable him to transport his produce to the market though he faces a challenge of inadequate capital.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, manure and pesticides for his coffee garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and pesticides for his coffee garden.

loans.name: Goodness Traders Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 54-year-old woman who hails from Assin Fosu in the Central Region of Ghana. Beatrice is married with 5 children aged 35, 32, 30, 27, and 13 years respectively. The husband is a retired Ghana post service man. The 4 of her children completed school and the last born is currently schooling. 

Beatrice is a very industrious trader and has been in business for the past 20 years, with rich experience gained. She has one employee who assists in the day to day business activities. Beatrice has never been to school, but been aware of the importance of education, she was able to educate 4 of her children up to tertiary level. Beatrice also vowed that her house will be full of literates. Beatrice's family is her top priority. She has been with the field partner over the past 5 years. 

Beatrice sells cosmetics and artificial hair products. She also operates commercial vehicle which serves as additional source of income to her. Beatrice has plans of expanding her shop, to buy in large quantity  take advantage of quantity discounts and to be a major distributor of artificial hair and cosmetics products within her community and the surrounding villages in the next 5 years. 

Beatrice needs additional working capital support to buy more to increase her stock levels to meet the demand of her customers on time. She will use the profit from the business to meet the expansion needs and to see her last born through her education. Beatrice thanks all her micro-lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and artifcial hair products for resale

loans.name: Fabiano

texts.en: Fabiano is a produce dealer who is 49 years old, has 10 children, and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He also farms for extra income. He got involved in business in 2009 with the aim of earning a living. He has a business dream of stocking a lot of produce that can meet his customers’ demand and help him attain profits throughout the year. However, price fluctuation of produce is a challenge that he faces. He intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is married and has five children. She is a resident of Kagadi-Uganda. She operates a boutique mainly selling ladies’ wear, which she has been doing since 2010 in order to improve her standard of living. 

Violet requested a loan, which she will use to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to always trade in the latest fashions and designs that women are usually looking for despite the hardship of competition from people with similar businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rogo Yanoko Village. Hassan joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Hassan will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Hassan now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields and enable him to buy more land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida sells bananas, other fruits, and vegetables. She also makes copra, which requires her to buy coconuts. She earns 6,000 PHP per month. 

Aida requested a loan from PMPC, which she will use to purchase light materials to add a business space extension for the sale and display of her products and to purchase inventories of bananas, other fruits, and vegetables for retail and whole coconuts to make copra. Aida wishes nothing more than to live a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase light materials to add a business space extension for the sale and display of her products and to purchase inventories of bananas, other fruits, and vegetables for retail and whole coconuts to make copra

loans.name: Los Ullpus De Lamay Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS ULLPUS DE LAMAY, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Santusa  tiene 43 años de edad  es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar alimentos y animales.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos  por el préstamo y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Los Ullpus de Lamay, which is located in the Lamay district, Calca province in the Cusco department. 

The member Santusa is 43 years old, living with her partner and has one child. She alternates her daily activities working in the business of raising small animals. She has worked in this business for quite a while, which is going well thanks to the effort she applies to her business every day. She is a responsible and determined person. The member wants to continue working to keep supporting her family. She is requesting a loan to buy food and animals. 

The members are grateful for the loan and promise to make their payments.

loans.use: to buy food and animals.

loans.name: Ma. Genelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Genelyn is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Genelyn is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Ma. Genelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food vending business.

Ma. Genelyn has been in this business for one year now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married and lives in Maular, Aloran. She owns and operates a sari-sari store, selling various commodities, which she has been doing for over six years. She earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. 

Unfortunately, Rebecca almost lost her capital when her family was facing financial crises and unexpected expenses came up. PMPC came to the rescue for Rebecca so she could gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Rebecca is requesting a new loan from PMPC for 45,000 PHP,  which she will use to purchase grocery items to add to her store's inventory and as working capital. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Saofaiga

texts.en:
Saofaiga is 41 years old and a single woman with 1 child. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for 4 years. 

Saofaiga has requested a loan to buy a fishing boat,fishing net,gear,torches etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Saofaiga will hope to support her family financially and to save to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat, fishing net, fishing gear, torches etc

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es: Doña Maria de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas el cual inicio con capital propio, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 59 years of age, lives in a home she owns with her husband. She has made a living for several years making and selling tortillas which she began with her own capital. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. 

She is requesting a loan to buy corn in bulk and lime powder in order to continue making the tortillas. As a result, she will be able to have a better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime powder

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio has always been an enthusiastic farmer who has grown rice on his land in Palayan, Aloran. He consistently has a good yield and strong earnings from his work, but would like to be even more productive. Out from his savings on his faming activities, he has made the walls of his house into concrete. He has big plans to renovate his entire house. 

To realize his plans, he doubles his effort to make his harvest. He has applied for a loan to prepare his land and seedbed and ensure that his rice field is ready for planting. Melecio knows that he has to get things right to earn a higher income in the upcoming season. In the future, he hopes to buy a truck to haul his produce to market and finish the renovation of his house.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation, to be able to afford to buy a truck

loans.name: Orzigul

texts.ru: Орзигул, 33 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Орзигул среднее образование, уже много лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Сумев развить свой бизнес, на сегодняшний день, благодаря ее упорству и целеустремленности, в хозяйстве Орзигул имеется 3 коровы, 5 овец, дополнительно она занимается полеводством, на собственной земле, мерою 0,15 ГА и арендованном мерою 0,50 ГА она выращивает кукурузу. Орзигул хочет и дальше приумножить ее бизнес, в связи с этим она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), на полученные средства она приобретет скот для откорма, а также семена и удобрения. На доходы от кредита Орзигул хочет увеличить поголовье скота и в скором будущем закончить ремонт нового дома.
texts.en:
Orzigul is 33 years old and the mother of three children. Orzigul has secondary education, and has already worked in animal husbandry and field husbandry for many years.

Having managed to develop her business, today, thanks to her perseverance and firmness of purpose, Orzigul has three cows and five sheep on her farm, and additionally she cultivates crops on 0.15 hectares of her own land and 0.5 hectares of rented land, growing corn. 

Orzigul wants to further augment her business, and thus she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). With the received funds she will obtain livestock for fattening up, and also seeds and fertilisers. With the profits from the loan, Orzigul wants to increase her livestock headcount and in the near future finish renovating her new home.

loans.use: to buy some livestock, seeds, and mineral fertilizers to cultivate her land

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty  de 53 años de edad habita en la ciudad de Cartagena con sus hijos,  donde se dedica a la venta de almuerzos trabajando desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde, de lunes a viernes. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos en su propio barrio, quienes le compran diariamente para que su familia consuma los deliciosos almuerzos que prepara Betty , mientras ellos trabajan. Su idea de negocio nació hace 4 años, cuando observando que en los alrededores donde habita no existía negocio de esta naturaleza y esto la llevó a decidir  emprender su propia aventura empresarial. Sus ventas las realiza de contado  y sus compras a crédito a tenderos del barrio y esto hace que su capacidad competitiva se reduzca. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en un mayor volumen víveres, como arroz, cárnicos, aves, etc, con el fin de disminuir los costos de venta comprando en un mayor volumen, lo cual hace de su credikiva una inversión de éxito.
texts.en:
Betty, 53, lives in the city of Cartagena with her children. She sells lunches, working from 10:00 am until 2:00 pm, Monday to Friday. Her customers are mainly neighbors, who buy from her so that their families can enjoy the delicious lunches she prepares while they are out working.

She had this business idea four years ago, after realizing that there were not such businesses where she lives. She decided to start her own business. Her customers pay in cash, but she gets her supplies on credit, which makes her business less competitive.

This is why Betty is applying for a CrediKiva for the first time with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy more supplies, such as rice and different types of meat. Her costs will decrease by buying in bulk, and that will mean that she made a successful investment.

loans.use: to buys supplies in bulk, such as rice and different types of meat.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 45 years old, married with six children.

Angelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, junk foods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Angelina has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Angelina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, junk foods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Chhoeum's Group

texts.en:
Chhoeum is ages 58 years old, a mother of two children, living in Siem Reap province. The sources of her family’s income are from growing rice and feeding ten chickens for sale for more than five years. Through these businesses, she could earn about 17,600KHR per day. 

Now she is leading a group to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer for farming. She hopes to earn more income to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farming to lead to an improved standard of living

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Apaula

texts.en:
Apaula is 49 year old a widow with 5 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes and iced cakes in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. 

Apaula has requested a loan to buy sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, fry pan etc. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Apaula will hope to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil,fry pan etc.to help support her family

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en:
Jovito is from Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is very responsible when it comes to the welfare of his family and is known to provide the best for them.

Jovito has a store from which he makes a living. To create more income, Jovito decided to expand his business after learning that he could access financial assistance through Kiva's field partner PMPC. He has now applied for a 49,900 PHP loan in order to restock his store with groceries and veterinary supplies for farms to increase sales. He smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing his family a better one.

loans.use: to restock his store with groceries and veterinary supplies for farms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her two children’s university fees

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a 33 year old woman, who is married with 4 children. She runs a business of selling lava-lava and puletasi in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Elena has requested a loan to buy materials,a sewing machine,scissors,threads etc. She plans to use her profits to buy new equipment for her business, and to support her family as well. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials,a sewing machine,thread,scissors, etc.

loans.name: Joventina

texts.en:
Joventina is married and lives in Aloran in the Philippines. Eight years ago she dreamed of opening and managing her own sari-sari, or small grocery store to support her needs, and so she did.

Joventina has applied for a 15,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner PMPC to restock her store with basic inventory items like sugar, oil, milk and canned goods. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits and earning extra profits to support her children. She is working to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic inventory items

loans.name: Grupo Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Una comunidad mexiquense se caracteriza por las fiestas patronales que son un espacio de esparcimiento familiar donde hay actividades como corridas de caballos y las tradicionales peleas de gallos. 
En este lugar se conformó el Grupo Las Flores, Juan es uno de los miembros, tiene 36 años y es padre de 5 hijos, su motivación principal y la razón para esforzarse día tras día en su actividad. Él se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras que transporta en su camioneta e incluso en burro cuando necesita entrar a las comunidades más lejanas donde aún no hay caminos. Siendo una persona comprometida con su trabajo y con su familia, Juan siempre intenta mantener el equilibrio para dedicar suficiente tiempo a los suyos.
El nuevo crédito lo utilizará para comprar fruta y verdura para continuar con su actividad y seguir solventando los gastos de su familia y de educación de sus hijos. 
La meta de Juan es rentar un local bien ubicado donde ofrecer las frutas y verduras, aunque sabe que las rentas en la región son elevadas, confía en que pronto hallará el mejor lugar. 
Juan considera que al desempeñar su actividad, no sólo beneficia a las personas sino que sirve como un ejemplo para sus hijos, para que trabajen y se dediquen a realizar una actividad honesta. 
Los demás integrantes del grupo son Paula y Apolinar, quienes invierten en pollos, mientras que Angelina y Braulio lo hacen en borregos. 
*La fotografía fue tomada al pie del quiosco municipal. Don Juan viste una camisa azul a cuadros y pantalón gris*
texts.en:
This Mexican community is known for its patron festivals—a time for family recreation where there are events like horse shows and traditional cockfighting.  This is where the Las Flores group gets together.  

Juan is one of the group members.  He is 36 years old and is father to five children—his main source of inspiration and the reason that he makes an effort day after day in his work.  He works selling fruits and vegetables that he carries in his truck or even by burro when he needs to go to the most distant communities where there aren’t roads.  Being a person committed to his family and his job, Juan always tries to keep a balance and give enough time to both of these responsibilities.

He will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables to continue his work and keep covering the expenses of his family and his children’s education.  Juan believes that doing his job benefits not only the people around him, but also serves as an example to his children, so that they will work and find an honest job.

Juan’s goal is to rent a well-located shop where he can sell his fruits and vegetables.  Although he knows that rental costs in the area are high, he trusts that soon he will find the best spot. 

The other group members are Paula and Apolinar, who invest in chickens, while Angelina and Braulio are into sheep.

*The photo was taken in front of the city gazebo.  Juan is wearing a blue checked shirt and gray pants.*

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

location.town: San Felipe del Progreso, Estado de México

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is a married woman with four children.  She is 51 years old and one of her children is in school. 

Magdalina is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 14 years.  Magdalina requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.  

In the future, Magdalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with five children. She is 30 years old and four of her children are in school. 

Milagros is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 3 years. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell. 

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy dried fish

loans.name: Pedita

texts.en:
Pedita is a married woman with five children. She is 32 years old and three of her children are in school.

Pedita is a very hardworking entrepreneur.   She has a fish selling business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her business.

Pedita has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Bevelyn

texts.en:
Bevelyn is 41 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Bevelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Bevelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.   Bevelyn has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Bevelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Marie-An

texts.en:
Marie-An is 32 years old and has three children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Marie-An is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marie-An has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marie-An would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy pig feed & supplies

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is a woman with four children. She is 37 years old and all her children are in school. 

Ronalyn is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a business making dried fish in the Philippines.  SHe has been in this business for 7 years.  Ronalyn requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to dried and to sell.

In the future, Ronalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Ronna

texts.en:
Ronna is a married woman with one child.   She is 26 years old.

Ronna is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a dried fish selling business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Ronna has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Ronna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy dried fish

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a parent of four children, Virginia works hard to support her family.   Virginia has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Virginia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with two children. She  is 27 years old and both children are in school. 

Cristina is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years.  Cristina requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: buy fishing gear

loans.name: Theavy

texts.en: Theavy has one dependent child and lives in Buk Toek Village.  She runs a clothes shop. Getting up early in the morning is her daily activity to start her business. She needs to get up early to prepare her shop before the sun rises. Currently, Theavy uses a car battery to sustain her business, however a car battery is not reliable. It has short life span and is easily damaged. Sometime the car battery runs out during the night time. After seeing her neighbor's  shop use a solar home system to sustain their business day and night without lacking of energy, Theavy decided to apply for a KIVA loan to buy a solar home system. She believes this decision will improve her energy to run her business and also save utility fees.

loans.use: buy a home solar system

location.town: Buk Toek Village, Preaek Brasab Commune, Preaek Br

loans.name: Sreyan's Group

texts.en:
Sreyan, 26, is a mother of a child, living in Kampong Cham province. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice, corn and sesame for sale about eight years. She could earn around 41,700KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a loan with VisionFund by using her loan portion to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more money and ability to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees, in the hope of being able to renovate her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 54 years old, and is married with six children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, personal product care, school supplies, and other groceries.

Elvira has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elvira aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, personal product care, school supplies, and other groceries.

loans.name: Vai

texts.en: Vai is 19 years old and a single woman with 1 child. She runs a small business selling pancakes and iced cakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Vai has requested a loan to buy sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, fry pan etc. She joined SPBD in April this year 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Vai will hope to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, fry pan etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plasticware such as cups, multipurpose bowls, and hermetic containers.

loans.name: Taman Indah Group

texts.en:
The Taman Indah group had success in paying off all their first loan. They really greatful and thankful to MUK, Kiva and Lenders for supporting their business. Now they can be example to other breeder to run the business.

Ni Wayan, a housewife, runs her pig business to improve the income of her family. With the last loan, she purchased 2 piglets and succeed in selling all the pigs to a big buyer. With the profit she earned, she can support her husband with income to fulfill their daily needs and saving for their future.

The Taman Indah group continue to take a loan to increase their business. They were motivated by their friend who already had success to run the business by themselves.

Ni Wayan used her loans to purchase piglets and feed. With motivation from her friend, she’s manages the business better then before and hopes for a satisfactory profit. The goal for her is she can have enough capital to run the business. One member could not attend the meeting because of a religious ceremony at her temple.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Madilyn

texts.en:
Madilyn, 35, is a married woman with seven children, three of whom are in school. For the past nine years she has worked hard as a fisherwoman to support her family.

Madilyn has requested a 5000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college someday.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Dally

texts.en:
Dally is 20 years old and single. Dally works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Dally runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Dally has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Dally would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Estela works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Estela is borrowing PHP 12 000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Estela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Jairo de 37 años de edad,  se dedica a la comercialización de repuestos para vehículos en la ciudad de Bogotá;  Como empleado de una empresa aprendió mucho de repuestos y accesorios para autobuses de servicio público y aprovechó esta experiencia para iniciar una actividad independiente que le generara ingresos ,  con los cuales sostener a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijo; esto ocurrió hace 8 años  y hoy su negocio ha crecido, lo cual le permite comprar a mayoristas que le ofrecen precios con los cuales competir en su mercado y vende de contado trabajando todos los días, desde las 7 de la mañana,  hasta las 8 de la noche. En la actualidad está aplicando a un  credikiva, primer financiamientos que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará repuestos para carros, pues tiene un pedido de gran tamaño por parte de una importante empresa, con ello planea responder efectivamente para lograr potencializar su clientela y generar nuevos clientes, lo que significa el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Jairo is 37 years old and works selling auto spare parts in the city of Bogotá. As a company employee, he learned a lot about auto parts and accessories for public transportation buses. He took advantage of the experience he gained to generate income on his own to support his family. His family consists of his spouse and 2 children. He started doing this 8 years ago, and today his business has grown enough that it allows him to purchase from wholesalers who offer better prices to compete in the market. He sells for cash and works every day from 7 in the morning until 8 at night.

Currently, he is applying for a credikiva, this is his first financing from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan he will buy spare parts for cars because he has a large order request from an important business. He plans to respond effectively to strengthen his customer base and get new clients which means success from his credikiva.

loans.use: to purchase spare auto parts.

loans.name: Lawan

texts.en:
Lawan is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rogo Yanoko Village. Lawan joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for his children's school fees.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Lawan will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Lawan has set high goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize.

With increased yields and income, Lawan now has the opportunity to further increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields

loans.name: Yiep's Group

texts.en: Yiep, 37, is a married mother of a small child who lives in the Kampong Cham province. To earn money to support her family’s living, she has grown cassava for sale for more than five years. Due to the price of cassava depreciating, she now lacks funds to do the farm again. She leads a group of four to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for a plowing fee. She hopes to earn more money and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for a plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Dédé vit à Adamavo et est âgée  de 39 ans. Mariée, Dédé est mère de quatre enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser son épanouissement. Dédé vend des cures dents et des pates dentifrices en se promenant dans son quartier et ses environs pour avoir son revenu pour leur subsistance. Dédé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander un tronc de cure dent et des pates dentifrices, Dédé demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire.
texts.en: Dédé lives in Adamavo and is 39 years old. Married, Dédé is the mother of four children and labors dynamically to help them flourish. Dédé sells toothpicks and toothpaste by foot in her neighborhood and the surrounding areas in order to have revenue for their subsistence. Dédé stocks up two times per month in the market. In order to order a case of toothpicks and toothpaste, Dédé is requesting this loan, so that she can make the purchase and keep her necessary profitability.

loans.use: to buy one case of toothpicks and 18 tooth pastes

loans.name: Vailolo

texts.en: Vailolo is a 64-year-old married woman with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily items such as chicken, noodles, snacks, coffee, toiletries, drinks, etc. She has been doing this for three years. Vailolo needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken, sausages, noodles, tins of fish, corn beef, a new cooler, etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, sausages, noodles, tins of fish, corn beef, a new cooler, etc.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a hardworking female entrepreneur with six children, one of whom is in school. She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing store in the Philippines, and she industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like running a general store and raising pigs. Glenda dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.


She successfully repaid her previous loan and has now requested another loan to further build her businesses. She has requested a 25000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Kea, 36, is living in a family with two dependent children. Growing rice on five hectares of farmland and working on other farms for a fee have been the sources of her family’s income for eighteen years and earn her about 69,900 KHR per day. She is now applying for a loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for a plowing fee. She hopes her crops will grow well, and she could gain a greater yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for a plowing fee.

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 36 ans, Kokoè est une femme très entreprenante et active dans la gestion de ses besoins. Avec deux enfants à charge, Kokoè habite à Adamavo pour vendre de la pate bandée et de la boisson locale faite à base du sorgho pour la restauration de ses clients. Ce commerce lui apporte son bénéfice et Kokoè s’approvisionne une fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. Pour acheter des bols de sorgho et un sac de maïs, Kokoè demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande et réaliser assez de profit pour répondre favorablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Married and 36 years old, Kokoè is a woman who is very entrepreneurial and is active in the management of her needs. With her two children in her care, Kokoè lives in Adamavo to sell pastry strips and locally-made, sorghum-based drinks for the eating needs of her clients. This business will bring her profits and Kokoè stocks up once a month from suppliers. In order to buy bowls of sorghum and a bag of corn, Kokoè is requesting a loan so that she can finance her order and to make enough profit to favorably respond to the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bowls of sorghum and one bag of corn

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 26 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising chicken in the Philippines. Jenelyn is borrowing 11000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chicken.

Jenelyn has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling spare parts.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chicken.

loans.name: Grupo Sector Chuatuj Group

texts.es:
Diego(el primero del lado derecho de la fotografía de playera gris) es  un hombre de 49 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de siete hijos de las edades entre 6 y 22 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad denominada, Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan.
Diego con el afán de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de Maxan en el mercado de su comunidad, esta labor lo realiza el desde hace 10 años, gracias  a esta actividad él ha logrado mantener a su familia.
Diego es un hombre  muy amable y responsable, es por ello que mucha gente  lo busca para adquirir sus hojas de Maxan. Diego tiene la gran fortuna de cultivar el mismo las hojas de Maxan para luego comercializarlas, entonces desde hace algún tiempo había sembrado una parcelas de Maxan que ahora ya necesitan de su mantenimiento, pero lamentablemente Diego no cuenta con el dinero necesario, es por esa razón que junto a un grupo de personas que tienen las mismas necesidades solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento.
Diego gurda las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder producir este  año una buena cosecha e Maxan y con ello mejorar sus ingresos y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en la escuela hasta que sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Diego (the first on the right in the photo, wearing a grey t-shirt) is a 49-year-old man, married with a beautiful family of seven children aged between 6 and 22. This humble family lives in a community called Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan. 

In an effort to generate income and provide for his children, Diego earns a living selling maxan leaves at the market in his community. He has been doing this for 10 years and as a result he has managed to support his family. Diego is a very friendly and responsible man and for this reason many people seek him out to buy his maxan leaves. Diego is fortunate to grow the leaves he sells himself. 

A while ago, he sowed some fields of maxan and now they are in need of care, but unfortunately Diego does not have enough money. This is why he is requesting a loan, together with a group of people with the same needs, to invest in buying agricultural supplies for maintaining his crop. Diego remains hopeful that he will obtain this loan, allowing him to produce a good maxan harvest this year and so increase his income and continue to support his children through school until they are great professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the cultivation of maxan plants.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 37 ans qui vit à Adamavo avec ses quatre enfants. Pour contribuer à l’épanouissement de sa famille, Afi vend de la bouillie qu’elle prépare à l’aide du mil dans son quartier. Afi s’approvisionne une fois par mois auprès des fournisseurs du quartier pour disposer en permanence ses ingrédients. Pour acheter du sac de mil, Afi demande ce crédit pour financer son achat et développer favorablement son activité pour avoir plus de rentabilité.
texts.en: Afi is a married woman, who is 37 years old and lives in Adamavo with her four children. In order to contribute to the flourishing of her family, Afi sells porridge that she prepares from millet in her neighborhood. Afi stocks up once a month from the neighborhood's suppliers in order to permanently have ingredients available. In order to buy a bag of millet, Afi is requesting this loan in order to finance her purchase and to favorably develop her business to have more profitability.

loans.use: to buy one bag of millet

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en: 45-year-old Claudio is a resident of Kagadi, Uganda. His business is motorcycle transportation, the most lucrative business that can easily be done, employing 20% of the Ugandan population. He also does farming as a source of additional income. He ventured into business to earn a living. His dream is to buy a taxi for his transport business, despite being challenged by bad roads leading to constant mechanical breakdowns. Claudio is requesting a loan to buy motorcycle tyres.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle tyres.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ailyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store and raising pigs. Ailyn is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell for her buy and sell fruits and vegetables business.

Ailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell, to secure the future of her family

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jessica is 45 years old and has five children who are in school.

Jessica has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell .

Jessica has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell, so that she may send her children to college

loans.name: Elbin Antonio

texts.es: Hace siete años que Don Elbin se dedica a la agricultura, siembra frijoles, maíz y trigo, tiene un hijo el cual ha sido su apoyo. Don Elbin poco a poco ha ido aumentando su producción con el apoyo de toda su familia. Para lograr sacar la producción que se aproxima en el mes de Julio Don Elbin solicita un crédito para comprar veneno refrescante y pagar los mozos para sacar la cosecha. Todo esfuerzo es bien remunerado y cuando termine la cosecha Don Elbin lograra obtener buenos ingresos para mantener a su familia. Dentro de sus metas esta seguir mejorando la fachada de su casa y realizar una nueva inversión en la cosecha.
texts.en: For seven years Elbin has been working in agriculture sewing beans, corn and wheat. He has a son who helps him. Elbin little by little has been increasing his production with the help of all his family. To mange to harvest the production that will be ready in the month of July, Elbin is requesting a loan to buy poison and pay for labor to harvest. All effort is well repaid and when the harvest is complete Elbin will manage to obtain good income to provide for his family. Amongst his goals is to improve the front of his house and make a new inversion in his harvests.

loans.use: to buy poison and pay for labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Luis Uriel

texts.es: Luis de 37 años es el propietario de un taller de latonería y pintura;  mediante esta actividad presta el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de vehículos estrellados y pintura desde hace 10 años, pues su padre desde muy pequeño le enseño en su experiencia este oficio. Su clientela la conforman los propietarios de vehículos y cuenta con muchos referidos,  pues su servicio resulta para ellos óptimo. Allí llegan los vehículos con sus propietarios, hacen su valoración con el diagnóstico que Luis entrega a cada uno, dando a su cliente toda la información que ellos necesitan para decidir la compra del servicio. En la actualidad está aplicando  a un credikiva, primer finanaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un compresor,  para hacer más efectivo su servicio de pintura , con ello cumplirá su meta de lograr este equipo de trabajo con una gran potencia, para  entregar un trabajo de una mayor calidad . Su máximo desafío diario, es lograr nuevos clientes y poder cumplir con sus responsabilidades que genera un crédito, por eso trabaja diariamente sin  descanso, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde o más,  cuando los clientes lo requieren, especialmente cuando estos exigen ser oportunos y cumplidos. Con esta inversión su credikiva será un éxito pues poco a poco Luis podrá ser más eficiente y cumplir sus sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en: Luis, 37, is the owner of a metal repair and paint garage; for the last 10 years, he has maintained, repaired and painted cars that are damaged in crashes. When he was little, he learned this  profession from his father. His clientele includes car owners and he gets lots of referrals because his service is optimal. The owners and their cars arrive at Luis' garage, he appraises the car and offers  them an estimate, giving them all the information they need to decide if they want to buy his services. He's currently requesting a loan, his first from Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which he will buy a compressor in order to provide a more efficient paint service. With this new powerful piece of equipment, he'll accomplish the goal he has of providing a higher quality of service. His daily challenge is to find new clients and fulfill his services in order to generate income; for that reason he works hard every day from 8 in the morning to 6 in the evening or later, when his clients need him, especially when they require the work done in a timely manner. This loan will successfully, little by little, allow Luis to be more efficient and fulfill his dreams of prosperity.

loans.use: buy a compressor.

loans.name: Soim's Group

texts.en:
Soim, 37, is a mother of a child, living in Kampong Thom province. She has been a rice farmer for ten years. 

In order to fulfill her needs, she is now forming as a group of three to take a loan via VisionFund to buy a decent latrine. She hopes her family’s members will have good health.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for the health of her family

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora works hard to support herself. She is single and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Rhodora requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her stall.

She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Rhodora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her stall, to be able to expand her business

loans.name: Lucilyn

texts.en:
Lucilyn works hard to support her family. Lucilyn is married and has a selling used clothes business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

Lucilyn has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

In the future, Lucilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell, to save money to send her children to college

loans.name: Selesitina

texts.en:
Selesitina is a 35-year-old woman and a partner with five children. She runs a business selling designed lavalava in her community. She has three years of experience with this business.

Selesitina has requested a loan to buy materials, design board, paint, sponges, paint brushes, etc. She plans to use her profits to start a new shop to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, design board, paints, sponges, etc.

loans.name: Khamidamo

texts.ru: Хамидамо жительница района Хамадони. Ей всего 21 лет. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Хамидамо дехканка. Она 3 года занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Она решила заняться этой деятельностью потому, что ее родители тоже занимались именно  этой сфере деятельности. И родители ей научили, как выращивать растение и правильно вести работу.  Сейчас Хамидамо нуждается в кредит, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения, ей  необходимо для обработки землю и посева урожай. Это кредит поможет ей во время провести новый посев и получить качественный урожай. Хамидамо ждет Вашу поддержку и доброту.
texts.en:
Khamidamo is a resident in Khamadoni district. She is only 21 years old. She is married and has one child. Khamidamo is a farmer. She has worked in the agricultural business for three years. She decided to work in this business because her parents also were in this very sphere of work. Her parents taught her how to cultivate plants and how to properly conduct work. 

Now Khamidamo needs a loan in order to buy mineral fertilisers, which are essential to her so that she can treat the land and sow the crops. This loan will help her during the new sowing and also help her to receive a high-quality harvest. Khamidamo is waiting for your support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilisers.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lydia is 59 years old now.

Lydia has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Lydia requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like slippers, etc..

Lydia has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like slippers, etc.so as to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Yoth's Group

texts.en:
Yoth is 64 years old, is a mother of six children living in Kampong Thom province. Nowadays, she earns money to support her family through growing rice and working for other farm to get a fee.

Due to a lack of money to renovate her old private toilet, she is now leading a small group to take a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner to fulfill her needs. She hopes to improved her family’s living condition and all members will have good health.

loans.use: to renovate her old private toilet, for the health of her family

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 59 years old, married with eight children.

Leila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leila has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Leila aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, to secure the future of her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, chemicals, bush knivies, weed sprayer, rake,spade, etc.

loans.name: Aishakan

texts.ru: Айшакан, 54 года, вдова, мать 3 детей. В 2009 году, начала бизнес по разведению скота и полеводству. Айшакан на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеет 2 коровы. На участке мерою 0,50 Га она выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Совокупный среднемесячный доход составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому Айшакан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели и обработку полеводческой земли. Доходы от кредита позволят Айшакан развить бизнес и улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en:
Aishakan is 54 years old, widowed, and the mother of three children. In 2009, she started her business of cattle breeding and field husbandry. Today, Aishakan has two cows on her farm. On a plot of 0.5 hectares she cultivates beans for on-farm consumption and selling. Her total average monthly income is about 13,000 som (KGS). 

These funds are not sufficient for living respectably, therefore Aishakan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to buy one heifer and cultivate her land. The income from the loan will allow Aishakan to develop her business and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy one heifer and to cultivate her land in order to invest in her business and increase her income

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Violeta works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy more clothes to offer for sale.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to offer for sale.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: A 53-year-old mother of four children, living in Kampong Cham province, Sokhon has been a cassava farmer for more than five years. Growing mango on one hectare of farmland is an additional source of income for her family. Due to a lack of funds, she is now applying for a loan via VisionFund to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay the labor fee. She hopes to earn more income to support her family and be able to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay the labor fee.

loans.name: Suluga

texts.en: Suluga is a 42-year-old married woman with two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. Suluga has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, fry pan, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. Suluga will use her earnings to support her family's development and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, fry pan, etc.

loans.name: Herginia

texts.en: Herginia signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed additional capital to expand her sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the financial assistance that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Herginia was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in papayas, mangos, strawberries, watermelon, pineapple, and other fruits for her business.

loans.name: Tapaalii

texts.en: Tapaalii is 32 years old and married woman with 3 children. She runs a small business selling chips in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Tapaalii has requested a loan to buy sack of flour,yeast,taro,banana,cooking oil,fry pan and etc. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tapaalii will plan to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy sack of flour, yeast, cooking oil, taro, banana,f ry pan etc…

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en: Rocelyn makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a sari-sari store in Liloy and earns a promising income to support her family. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she availed herself of a loan to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. Rocelyn hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all her children to school.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Los Vecinos Group

texts.es:
Los vecinos es un grupo conformado por cuatro personas muy trabajadoras que viven en una comunidad mazahua donde los habitantes aún conservan sus costumbres. Gran parte de la población se dedica la cultivo de maíz y cría de animales.

Doña Adelina tiene 54 años de edad, está casada con Juan y tienen siete hijos aunque sólo la más pequeña continúa estudiando su educación primaria. 

Durante muchos años, Adelina se dedicó a la cría y engorda de animales como cerdos y borregos, actividad que legó a uno de sus hijos para entregarse de lleno a la venta de ropa. 

La madre de Adelina confeccionaba trajes típicos mazahuas, oficio que también aprendió y decidió convertir en una actividad económica. Al inicio, Adelina sólo contaba con tres prendas para vender ya que no contaba con el capital suficiente para comprar más material. Actualmente, Adelina tiene una máquina de coser que le ayuda a crear los coloridos y típicos trajes de su región que muestra en su local. Además, el préstamo le ayuda a tener suficiente tela, hilos, agujas y estambres para continuar con la creación. 

Aprovechando el espacio de su establecimiento, Adelina también revende ropa moderna, regalos, accesorios para cabello e incluso el mismo material que ella utiliza para la confección de ropa como las mismas agujas, hilos y estambres. Sin embargo, Adelina siempre busca incrementar sus ventas por lo que aprovecha otros espacios: “También vendo en plazas y tianguis, en un puestito en este tipo de lugares es en donde vendo más y mis ganancias son mejores”. 

Adelina está muy agradecida con sus prestamos ya que desde su primer actividad, la inversión le ayudó a crecer y gracias a ese esfuerzo ahora tiene su tienda de ropa; con las ganancias pudo construir dos casas para su familia y sus hijos han podido salid adelante. A pesar de todos estos logros, Adelina aún desea seguir adelante con su venta y seguir apoyando a su marido con los gastos del hogar. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son: René quien invertirá en la cría y engorda de cerdosy  Valeria y Rosa, en sus bordados.

*En la imagen aparecen los cuatro integrantes del grupo en el negocio de Doña Adelina.
texts.en:
Los Vecinos (The Neighbors) group comprises four hard-working people who live in the mazahua community, where the inhabitants continue to preserve their traditions. A large part of the population works in corn cultivation and animal husbandry.

Adelina, 54, is married to Juan and they have 7 children, of which only the youngest is still in elementary school.

For many years, Adelina worked in animal husbandry, fattening animals such as pigs and lambs, a business that she left to her one of her sons so she could give herself fully to her business of selling clothing.

Adelina's mother made traditional mazahua garments, a skill she learned, too, and then decided to turn it into a business. At first, Adelina only had 3 outfits to sell as she didn't have enough capital to buy more material. Currently, Adelina has s sewing machine that helps her create the colorful traditional garments of her region that she sells in her locale. Also, this loan will help her have sufficient thread, needles and yarn to continue creating.

Taking advantage of the space of her establishment, Adelina also sells modern clothing, gifts, hair accessories and even the same raw materials she uses to make clothing, like needles, thread and yarn. However, Adelina is always looking to increase sales, so she also sells in other places: "I also sell in plazas and open air markets, in a little kiosk and it's in those kinds of places that I sell more and earn more”.

Adelina is grateful for her loans, since her first business, the loan helped her grow and thanks to that effort she now has her clothing store. With her earnings, she was able to build two houses for her family and her children were able to get ahead. Despite these achievements, Adelina still desires to get ahead with her business and continue supporting her husband with the household expenses.

The other members of the group are René who will invest in raising and fattening of animals, and Valeria and Rosa who will invest in their embroidery.

*This photo is of the four members in Adelina's store.

loans.use: buy raw materials, like fabric, thread, needles, yarn, etc.

location.town: San Nicolas Guadalupe, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 54, is a mother of one child. She wants to provide her child with a good living and be able to help her husband in their family. She has been engaged in a sari-sari store business for two years already and it was a good business for the family because it helps them a lot in their daily needs. 

She needs financial assistance to increase her store inventory and increase her income, So she decided to take a loan again to purchase additional goods for the store to sell.

Myrna wants for the future to expand her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for the store to sell, to sustain the needs of her family

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24 000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, and bamboo, etc for her fishing business.

Elsie has been in this business for 13 years. Elsie earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, and bamboo, etc

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children who are in school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, egg, milk, sugar, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Mildred dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, egg, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Merceditha

texts.en:
Merceditha is 31 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 10.000 through NWTF to to buy pigs, feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

Merceditha has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

loans.name: Ma.cheryl

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma.Cheryl works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Ma.Cheryl is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, personal product care and other groceries for her general store business.

Ma.Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Aira

texts.en:
Aira is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries in harvesting coconut and to buy fertilizers.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store and raising pigs.

Aira dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries in harvesting coconut and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia, 47 years old, is married and has six children, three of them in school. She works hard to provide for her family. Amalia has been running a general store in the Philippines for 25 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

Amalia has previously borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosario works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosario is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell in the city.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell in the city

loans.name: Allein

texts.en:
Allein is 23 years old, married and has two children.

Allein is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Allein requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Allein has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs, to secure the future of her family

loans.name: Halmatzhon

texts.ru: Халматжон, 25 лет, холост. Подрабатывает на стройках, также занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Халматжона есть 2 коровы, на 0,45 Га выращивает картофель и помидоры. Халматжон хочет и дальше развивать свой бизнес, поэтому он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма и перепродажи, часть средств направит на полеводство. Доходы от кредита Халматжон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также покупку автомобиля.
texts.en:
Halmatzhon is 25 years old and unmarried. He works as a construction worker on the side, in addition to working in farming. Today Halmatzhon has two cows on his farm, and on 0.45 hectares he cultivates potatoes and tomatoes. 

Halmatzhon wants to further develop his business, thus he has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS). This will help him to buy some cows for fattening up and reselling, and also to put a direct of the funds into crop husbandry. Halmatzhon plans to invest the income from the loan in the further increase of his number of livestock animals, and also to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy some cows and to cultivate his land

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal is aged 30, married, and a resident of Kyengera, a city suburb.
