He appreciates the support given to him by UGAFODE and the Kiva lenders, especially towards his previous loans which he used to buy poultry feed that increased his poultry's growth and profitability. Faisal has three children and also looks after one of his brother’s children, since his brother has no capacity for looking after the child.

Faisal is a boda boda (motorcycle) cyclist in Kampala city center, and this is how he has managed to cater for his family. Faisal wakes up at 6:00 a.m. every day to start his daily routine. In addition, he also keeps poultry, which increases his income; hence, enabling him to adequately meet his family's needs.

Faisal approached Ugafode Microfinance for another loan to purchase feed for his young chicks.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 37 years old and married with six children. With five children are still in school, Analyn works very hard to provide for them.

Analyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, cooking oil, noodles, drinks, etc.

Analyn has been in this business for 4 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, cooking oil,etc, to send her children to college

loans.name: Tamaitia

texts.en: Tamaitia is 29 years old and single woman with 3 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Tamaitia has requested a loan to buy sack of flour,sugar,yeast,cooking oil,fry pan and etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tamaitia will hope to start a new business to support her family and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sack of flour, sugar ,yeast, cooking oil, fry pan etc. to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Anlyn

texts.en:
Anlyn is 30 years old and single. She wants to help her parents with their family needs, so she is engaged in a transport business. Her motorcycle is rented by somebody and then she only receives a rent income daily. As part of motor maintenance, she needs financial assistance to purchase motor parts for maintenance so she decided to take a loan from GDMPC.

Anlyn's plan for the future is to buy a new motorcycle for expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase motor parts for maintenance.

loans.name: Meleseke

texts.en: Meleseke is 19 years old and partner woman with 1 child. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Meleseke has requested a loan to buy fishing net, spears, torches, goggles, etc. She joined SPBD in April this year 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Meleseke hopes to increase her family development.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, spear, torches, goggles, etc.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen food business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of frozen foods to resell.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to resell.

loans.name: Deisi

texts.es: Deisi de 48 años de edad, luego de retirarse del trabajo que ejercía empezó a buscar nuevos horizontes, gracias a sus conocimientos en estética decidió que la mejor forma de ocupar su tiempo era trabajar en lo que más le gustaba.  Tomó en arriendo el local donde funciona  su  salón de belleza, el cual acondicionó con sillas de peluquería, espejos, mesa de pedicure y manicure, para ofrecer un servicio confortable.   Todos los días en el horario de 9 a.m. a 9 p.m. los habitantes del barrio en el que ella reside al sur occidente de Barranquilla, pueden solicitar servicio de corte de cabello, tinturaciones, blower, manicure y pedicure, el horario es muy amplio para disfrutar de sus servicios.   Los productos utilizados en los tratamientos de belleza los compra de contado a mayoristas, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, invertirá en la compra de shampoo, masajes, tintes y demás productos necesarios para ofrecer un servicio de calidad.  Con esta inversión Deisi proyecta incrementar sus ventas y ampliar su surtido.  Su meta a largo plazo pese a su escaso capital es abrir otro salón de belleza.
texts.en: Deisi, 48, left her old job and started to look for new horizons. Thanks to her knowledge of esthetics,  she decided that the best way to occupy her time was to work in what she liked most.  She leased the space where her beauty salon is, she added hair dresser chairs, mirrors, and manicure and pedicure tables to provide a comfortable service. Every day from 9am to 9pm, the inhabitants of the neighborhood that she lives in, southwest of Barranquilla, can request a haircut, color, blow dry manicure and pedicure -- the hours are long so there's enough time to enjoy her services. The products she uses in the beauty treatments are bought wholesale and in cash. She's requesting a Kiva loan, first one she is requesting from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to invest in shampoo, massages, hair color and the other products she needs to provide a quality service. With this loan, Desi will increase her sales and assortment. Her long-term goal, despite her lack of capital, is to open another beauty salon.

loans.use: invest in shampoo, massages, hair colour and the products necessary to provide a quality service.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Arlene works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Arlene is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials such as linen, zippers, thread, etc. for her tailoring business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as linen, zippers, thread, etc.

loans.name: Sakhorn's Group

texts.en: A 47-year-old mother of five children, living in Kampong Cham province, Sakhorn is a rice farmer and factory worker for more than five years. She could earn about 44,400KHR per day through these businesses. Due to a lack of funds, she is now applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee. She hopes to earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Solecitos Group

texts.es:
El clima veracruzano se caracteriza por ser muy cálido, “La novia del sol” es una comunidad donde los habitantes también poseen esta cualidad en su carácter. El grupo Solecitos lleva su nombre en referencia a esa calidez, los integrantes y sus actividades son: Aracely quien vende comida; Rosa, mochilas  y ropa; Miriam, artículos de plata; Anayeli y Margarita, ropa y zapatos; Ana, perfumes y postres; Deysi, antojitos típicos; Osman, calzado y María, mochilas y ropa. 

   Rosa es una joven de veintidós años trabajadora y entusiasta que vive muy contenta con Ricardo, su pareja desde hace un año. Se volvió comerciante siete años atrás con la veta de dulces en el corredor de su casa; recuerda que colocaba su mercancía en una mesa antigua que tenía su mamá. Todos los días, después de llegar de la escuela, acomodaba los dulces y  mientras hacia la tarea cuidaba de su negocio; de esta manera apoyaba a su madre con los gastos de la casa y obtenía un ingreso extra para gastos personales. 

Después de cuatro años, Rosa decidió incursionar en la venta de mochilas, maletas y bolsas de mano, las cuales compra en un municipio aledaño y en la capital del país. Asimismo, vende cachorros de raza pitbull, y recientemente también comenzó a vender ropa para caballero junto con su hermana, el porcentaje de ganancias lo dividen por la mitad. 

Esta vez Rosa ha solicitado un préstamo ya que próximamente realizará un viaje para comprar más mercancía como mochilas para niño, niña y bolsas de mano de diferentes modelos.

El sueño de Rosa es establecerse en un local fijo y ofrecer un amplio surtido de productos y excelentes precios a sus clientes de tal manera que logre posicionarse en el mercado de manera exitosa.

*La fotografía fue tomada afuera de la casa de Anayeli, Rosa es quien viste camisera gris y short azul.
texts.en:
Veracruz's weather is known for being very warm. Often referred to as "The Sun's Girlfriend", the community is know for having people of high character. The "Solecitos" group gets its name from that same warmth. It's members work in the following businesses: Aracely sells food, Rosa sells backpacks and clothing, Miriam sells silver items, Anayeli and Margarita sell clothing and shoes, Ana sells perfumes and desserts, Deysi sells traditional snacks, Osman sells hosiery, and María sells backpacks and clothing. 

Rosa is a hardworking and enthusiastic, 22 year old woman.  She lives happily with Ricardo, her partner of one year. She became a business woman seven years ago, selling candy from the porch of her house.  She remembers placing her merchandise on an antique table that her mother had.  Everyday after school, she would arrange her candy, and she would tend her store while she did her homework.  This allowed her to help her mother with the household expenses as well as earn a little extra spending money.  After four years of that, Rosa decided to start selling backpacks, luggage and handbags, which she purchases in a neighboring town as well as in the capital.  She also sells pit bull puppies, and recently, she started selling men's clothing with her sister. She splits the sales with her 50-50.  

Rosa is now seeking a loan because she is about to go on a trip to purchase more merchandise such as, backpacks for children and handbags.  Rosa's dream is to have a set retail location and offer a wider assortment of products at unbeatable prices for her customers, so that she can be successful in her business.

The picture was taken outside of Anayeli's home. Rosa is dressed in a grey shirt and blue shorts.

loans.use: purchase children's backpacks and handbags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour tortillas with rice and cheese.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Ruth works hard to support her family.

She has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a repair shop. Ruth is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business like make up, etc. for her beauty parlor business.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business like make up, etc... to save money for the future

loans.name: Zanaida

texts.en:
Zanaida is 43 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child in school.

Zanaida buys and sells coconut wine in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

Zanaida has been in this business for eight years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Zanaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married mother of 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 41 years old, and all of her children are in school.

Mary Jane has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Belinda requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 39 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marcelina is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marcelina has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell gasoline business in the Philippines.

Divina has requested a 27,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional gallons of gasoline. She has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer de 38 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 5 y 19 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan.
Para Manuela no hay nada más importe que su familia, es por ello  que con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica  a la venta de almacigo de café desde hace cinco años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos ella también se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica.
Por vivir en un pueblo rodeado de mucha naturaleza y hombres de campo el negocio de Manuela es muy rentable y bastante buscado por los pobladores quienes se dedican a la agricultura, es por ello que ahora Manuela ha decidido mejorar e incrementar sus almácigos de café para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de la clientela, aunque una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el  capital suficiente para poder incrementar su negocio,  es por tal razón que solicita un crédito para poder comprar  bolsas y algunas semillas de café.
El gran sueño de manuela es poder comprar dos cuerdas de terreno donde pueda cultivar.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 38 year old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family with five children between the ages of 5 and 19.  This humble family lives in the community of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan. For Manuela, there is nothing more important than her family, which is why she is so eager to earn and income and help her husband with the household expenses by selling coffee seedlings for the past five years.  However, in order to supplement her income she also makes traditional clothing. 

Given that she lives in a town that is surrounded by lots nature and farm workers, Manuela's business is very profitable and highly sought after by the locals who work in agriculture.  For this reason, Manuela has decided to improve and increase her coffee seedlings in order to better meet the needs of her customers.  However, one of her challenges is that she does not have enough capital with which to expand her business, which is why she is seeking a loan to purchase bags and coffee seeds.  Manuela's biggest dream is to purchase two acres of land that she can farm on.

loans.use: purchase coffee seeds and bags for her seedlings.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 30 years old and single. He wants to help his parents with their family living. He wants to earn income to give his parents what they need. 

He is engaged in a transport business and is also the one who drives his motorcycle. He needs financial assistance for his motorcycle maintenance. That's why he decided to take a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle repair, so that he can continue to cater to more passengers.

In the future, William plans to buy a new motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 46 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Margarita works very hard to provide for them.

Margarita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, home product care and other groceries.

Margarita has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Cirpa

texts.es: Sirpa  de 43 años de edad habita en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 12 y 15 años; ella se dedica a la venta de helados y también ofrece productos mediante guías especializadas.  Su negocio inició hace 2 años, cuando una amiga le propuso la idea de genera ingresos autónomos, Sirpa no lo pensó dos veces e inició y poco a poco ha ido creciendo. Sus ventas las hace de contado y a crédito vendiendo de lunes a sábados, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde ; su oferta la hace entre sus vecinos de barrio que potencializan su ventas  y hacen crecer su negocio, por eso hoy cuenta con 3 triciclos a través de los cuales se realiza la venta de helados, porque su meta es tener su propia casa y esto también es su mayor desafío. En la actualidad está aplicando  a un credikiva, primer finanaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa y accesorios para damas , con el fin de continuar haciendo el ascenso en sus ventas y esto es justamente el éxito de un credikiva.
texts.en: Cirpa, 43, lives in Cartagena with her partner and two children, aged 12 and 15. She sells ice cream and also has dedicated sellers who sell her product for her. She started her business 2 years ago, when a friend suggested that she generate income autonomously. Sirpa didn't have to think twice and started her business and little by little it's been growing. She makes her sales by cash and credit, selling from Monday to Saturday from 9 in the morning to 4 in the afternoon; her neighbors are among those that sell her product and grow her business and that's why she now has 3 three-wheeled bicycles from which her ice cream is sold. Her goal is to have her own house and it's also her biggest challenge. She is requesting a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy clothing and accessories for women in order to increase sales, which is exactly the success a Kiva loan can provide.

loans.use: buy clothing and accessories for women.

loans.name: Beverlyn

texts.en:
Beverlyn is a married woman with 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has 2 children who are currently in school.

Beverlyn has a weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase abacá, or Manila hemp, and other materials for her business.

Beverlyn has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase abacá and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en: Lena is 41 years old with 8 children. She runs a small business selling tomatoes, beans, cabbages, etc. in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Lena has requested a loan to buy seeds, chemicals, bush knives, rake, spade, etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lena hopes to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemicals, rake, spade, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Pama

texts.en:
Pama is 36 years old and a married woman with four children. For the past two years, she has owned and operated a small store, selling daily items such as noodles, biscuits, snacks, drinks, etc. 

Pama needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken, sausages, tinned fish, corned beef, noodles, etc. to sell . She hopes to use her profits to achieve the best improvement of her business. Pama became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, sausages, tinned fish, corned beef, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Los Emprendedores De Sharon Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  5 personas responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “LOS EMPRENDEDORES DE SHARON” una de ellas es la Sra. Giovanna  de 44 años soltera  y con 2 hijos, la Sra. Giovanna  se dedica ya hace 3 años a la venta de abarrotes en un pequeño local  todos los días con el mérito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de sus hijos, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. Giovanna  ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales es por eso  que la Sra. Giovanna  trabaja mucho, Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más mercadería (Arroz, leche, golosinas, ETC) y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez a la Sra. Giovanna se encuentra sentada y se le distingue con un polo color morado, se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Los Emprendedores de Sharon is a communal group made up of five members who are responsible for different commercial activities.

Giovanna is one of them. She is 44 years old, single, and she has two children. She earns a living selling groceries in a small store every day. She's done this work for three years, looking to get ahead and pay for the children's school.

Through her efforts, she's been able to improve her home and support her children in their education. Her greatest wish is to see them become professionals, and this is why she works hard to keep improving her business.

With the loan, she will buy more groceries such as rice, milk, snacks, and other items, so that she can get more income.

Giovanna is seated wearing a purple top. She sends a hug to Kiva and Edaprospo lenders, giving thanks to all for the loan which makes her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy legumes, vegetables, and meats.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is managing a retail store for income. She sells grocery items to the people in her village. She was able to gain income to sustain the needs of her family. She is already widowed. She wanted to increase her sales and revenues but had insufficient funds. To achieve this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy soft drinks, eggs, breads, soap, and other grocery items to sell. These merchandise will increase sales capacity and income as well. She hopes to continue expanding her store.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, breads, soap, and other grocery items to sell

loans.name: Roselaina

texts.en:
Roselaina, aged 34, is the mother of six children. She wants to help her husband to earn a living to provide for their children's needs. For the past two years, she has been engaged in vegetable gardening, selling vegetables at the market and also around her community. 

Roselaina wants to increase her income and aims to have a good and plentiful supply of vegetables during harvest. This is the reason why she decided to take out a loan to buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden plants.

Roselaina wants to save money from her business income for the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden plants.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 63 years old and married with eight children, five of whom are in school. Estelita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of household goods to sell.

Estelita has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Celsa dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cheryl Sweet

texts.en:
As a single parent of three children, Cheryl Sweet works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store. 

Cheryl Sweet has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to  buy more fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Cheryl Sweet hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en: Kunthea, a 27-year-old mother of two children, living in Battambang province, has been a cassava and sesame farmer for more than five years. Due to her lack of funds, she is now forming as a group of two to take out a new loan via VisionFund to pay the fees for plowing and labor. Kunthea hopes to earn more money and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to pay the fees for plowing and labor

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en: Evelina is a 56 year old married woman with 6 children. She runs a small business selling cabbages, beans, cucumbers, tomatoes, etc. in her community, and has been doing this for 4 years. Evelina has requested a loan to buy seeds, bush knives, weed sprayer, chemicals, rake, spade, etc. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Evelina hopes to extend her house and support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, rake, spade, chemicals, bush knives, weed sprayer, etc.

loans.name: Lolelai

texts.en: Lolelai is a 57 year old married woman with 7 children. She runs a business sewing t-shirts and puletasi in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Lolelai has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, threads, scissors, materials, etc. She plans to use her profits to start a new business. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, threads, scissors, materials, etc.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 48 years old, married, and has two children who are still in school.

Caridad is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Caridad requested a loan of PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Caridad has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana is 63 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. Cresenciana has run a general store in the Philippines for the past five years.

Cresenciana has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy grocery items such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell.

Cresenciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en: A 53 year old mother of four children, living in Battambang province, La has been a cassava farmer on three hectares of farmland for eight years. To earn more income, she works on another farm as well. Due to a lack of funds, she is now forming a group to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and pay for labor fees. She hopes to earn more money and improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor fees

loans.name: Los Cocos Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca hay un municipio cuyo nombre proviene de la suma de dos vocablos náhuatl: “Acatl” que quiere decir “caña” y Tlan que es "lugar de" o "tierra de"; por lo que significa "lugar de o tierra de las cañas".  Ésta es una de las principales regiones productoras de caña de azúcar, y hay dos periodos importantes para la actividad; la zafra que es cuando la caña esta lista para ser procesada y la reparación que es cuando se da mantenimiento al ingenio. En un barrio localizado entre los cañales se formó un grupo llamado “Los Cocos” nombre que los  integrantes eligieron por el gusto que tienen por el fruto. Ellas son: Teresa R., Marcelina, Teresa M. y Felipa dedicadas a la venta de pollo; Laura, a la venta de ropa y dulces; Reyna, a la venta de refresco y material de reciclaje y finalmente Trinidad quien vende perfumes.

    Doña Reyna es una mujer ejemplar, ha conformado junto con su esposo Enrique una gran familia de seis hijos. El hecho de ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a los suyos hizo que, desde hace treinta años, se uniera a la actividad de su esposo: la compra y venta de material de reciclaje. Es una labor complicada pues hay quien mira con desdén este negocio, sin embargo hoy en día eso no afecta a Reyna ya que es una manera muy honrada de ganarse la vida, además comenta con gusto “comprar y vender chatarra no tiene nada de malo, al contrario reducimos la contaminación”. Su jornada es de lunes a sábado cuando recorren diferentes comunidades en busca del material para comprarlo y transportarlo hasta su localidad en donde la revenden. Con las ganancias obtenidas solventan los gastos de su hogar, el estudio de sus hijos y han formado un patrimonio. 
   De igual modo, hace siete años Reyna decidió invertir en la compra de refrescos para revender, actualmente continúa con esta actividad de la cual obtiene ganancias extra. Ahora solicita un préstamo para comprar agua mineral y refrescos de distintos tamaños y sabores con motivo de la temporada de primavera y verano, época en la que la temperatura de la región aumenta aún más.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de doña Celia quien es hija de doña Reyna, ella está vestida con blusa y falda de color rosa.
texts.en:
In Oaxaca there is a municipality whose name is the combination of two Nahuatl words: “Acatl” which means “cane” and “Tlan” which is  “place of” or “land of”, so the name of the place is “land or place of the canes”. This is one of the main regions for sugar cane production, and there are two important periods of activity. The “zafra” (or cane harvest) is when the cane is ready to be processed and the “reparación” is when production facilities are maintained.

In one neighborhood among the cane fields, a group called “Los Cocos” (the Coconuts) was formed. The name was chosen by the members because of how much they like the fruit. The members are Teresa R, Marcelina, Teresa M. and Felipa, who all sell chicken; Laura who sells fruit and sweets; Reyna, who sells refreshments and recyclable materials and finally Trinidad, who sells perfumes.

Doña Reyna is an exemplary woman. Along with her husband she has formed a wonderful family of six children.  With the aim of offering a better quality of life to her own, she joined her husband in his occupation thirty years ago. This occupation is the buying and selling of recyclable materials. It is complicated work because some look down on this business, but this doesn’t ruffle Reyna, because it is a very honorable way of earning a living. Furthermore, she says enthusiastically that “there is nothing wrong with buying and selling junk, on the contrary, we reduce contamination.” Her work week runs from Monday to Saturday when they go through different communities in search of material to buy and transport to their location, where they resell it. With the earnings that they get they’ve been able to cover the household expenses and their childrens’ studies and create some assets. 
   
Also, seven years ago, Reyna decided to invest in buying refreshments for resale. She continues with this activity currently as a way to earn extra money. Now she is seeking a loan to buy mineral water and drinks of different sizes and flavors for spring and summer, when the temperature in the region rises even higher.

*The photograph was taken in doña Reyna’s daughter doña Celia’s store. She is wearing a pink blouse and skirt.

loans.use: to buy mineral water and drinks of different sizes and flavors.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for four years. Her husband is responsible for supporting the entire family. The current condition of his taxi is poor and requires more and more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient funds, her husband is unable to pay for the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Sadia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan, Sadia's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. Providing better transport services would earn him profitable income. Sadia plans to save some of the profit from her husband's business to meet her family's future needs.
Sadia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband repair his taxi

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en:
To earn a living to provide for her three children, Elvera engaged in a sari-sari store business. At the age of 39, she owned and managed her store and was earning income of PHP 1,500 a month to help her family’s daily needs.

She needs to increase her income because of the increasing expenses of her family. Recently, she decided to take a loan again to buy more grocery items for the store to sell and to be able to increase her store inventory and increase her income.

Elvera wants to expand her business in the future to sustain the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for the store to sell.

loans.name: Tuipala

texts.en:
Tuipala is 19 years old and a partnered woman with one child. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for three years.

Tuipala has requested a loan to buy fishing net, goggles, spears, and torches. She joined SPBD in April of this year to gain access to capital.

With her earnings, Tuipala will support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy goggles, fishing net, spears, torches, etc.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta de 51 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que vive junto a su compañero de vida, su hija de 10 años de edad y su hijo mayor de edad que le apoya con los gastos de su hogar, al igual que su compañero de vida. Marta poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante, ya que hace 6 años inicio su negocio de venta de tortillas, al principio le fue difícil obtener la clientela, pero actualmente gracias a su amabilidad y precios accesibles cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre solicitan sus productos. Marta siempre conto con energía eléctrica que le pasaba una vecina, pero ahora desea tener energía eléctrica propia, por lo que ha decidido instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambres eléctricos, caja térmica, toma corriente y postes para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda lo antes posible y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marta, 51 years old, is a working woman. She lives with her life partner, her 10-year-old daughter and her adult child who supports the household expenses, like her partner. Marta has slowly managed to get ahead because 6 years ago she began her business selling tortillas.  At first, it was difficult to obtain customers but now, thanks to her kindness and accessible prices, she has a lot of customers who always request her products. 

Marta always had electricity that a neighbor provided, but now wants to have her own electric power.  She has decided to install electricity in their home  for which she is requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in: electrical wires, thermal casing, sockets and poles to install electricity in their home as soon as possible and thus improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to invest in: electrical wires, thermal casing, sockets and poles to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Jonari

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Jonari works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jonari is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

Jonari has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Empresarias Group

texts.es: El grupo “MUJERES EMPRESARIAS” se encuentra conformada por mujeres trabajadoras y responsables. Elvira tiene 27 años de edad con dos hijos dependientes.  Ella implemento un pequeño taller de confección en su vivienda en el trabaja con el apoyo de su esposo. A la vez expende productos de belleza. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de telas para confeccionar buzos y short deportivo. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Elvira es la primera del lado derecho visite chompa marrón.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Empresarias” [Entrepreneurial Women] is made up of hard-working and responsible women. 

Elvira is 27 years old, and has two dependent children. She started a small clothes-making workshop in her home, where she works with the support of her husband. She also sells beauty products. She will invest her loan in the purchase of fabrics to make tracksuits and sports shorts. 

The group is grateful to the KIVA investors for the loan they have provided. In the above photo, Elvira is the first on the right, wearing a brown jumper.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 47-year-old mother of 2 children. She is engaged in keeping a vegetable garden to earn her living. She wants to give her children a better life and provide them with a comfortable home. She aims to change her family's life by increasing her income. 

Lolita needs a good harvest and plenty of vegetables to sell in the market so that her income will increase, but in order to do so, she requires financial assistance. She decided to take a loan in order to buy fertilizer for her garden.

In the future, Lolita wants to invest in other businesses to give her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her garden.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 33-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of one son, and her husband is engaged in a scrap material recycling business.

Jameela's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle, but due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to make the bulk purchase. Therefore, Jameela has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan will enable Jameela's husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can earn a good profit from his business.

Jameela is very thankful to Kiva's lenders and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase scrap material for her husband's recycled materials business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase galvanized steel sheets, poles, pins and pay for labor in order to protect a room in her home.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria de 28 años de edad habita en un municipio aledaño a la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 3 y 10 años. Allí se dedica a  una actividad comercial, mediante la cual vende productos varios mediante guías especializadas, como ropa, calzados accesorios etc. Su negocio inició impulsada por la necesidad de generar ingresos suficientes para apoyar el sustento y bienestar de su hogar;  hoy sus metas no se detienen y sueña con tener su propia vivienda y en ella un local contiguo y separado bien organizado. Su principal desafío es trabajar generar ingresos y organizar su economía; aun así trabaja con esmero para cumplir sus propósitos e incrementar su rentabilidad que se encuentra en un promedio del 14%. En la actualidad está aplicando  a un credikiva, primer finanaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, productos de belleza y alimenticios entre otras  mercancías, con el fin de impactar la decisión de compra de su clientela, incrementar sus ventas, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 28 years old and lives in a town outside of Cartagena with her spouse and her two children, ages 3 and 10. There she makes a living through a commercial enterprise that sells various products like clothes, and footwear accessories via specialty catalogs. She started her business on a necessary impulse to generate income to support the livelihood and well-being of her household. Nowadays her goals don't stop there, her dream is to have her own home and adjoining location, separate, and well organized.

Her primary challenge is working to generate revenue and organize her husbandry. This is why she is careful to meet her quotas and increase her profits which are 14% on average. She is currently applying for a Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she would use to purchase clothes, beauty products, and snacks, among some other merchandise. Her goal is to impact her customers' buying decisions, increase sales, and be a successful investment for Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, beauty products, and snacks, as well as other merchandise.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
A 32-year-old mother of four children, living in Battambang province, Mary has been a cassava farmer for more than five years. Fishing is the additional source of her family’s income.

Due to lack of funds, she is now forming a group of two to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy fishing supplies to support her business. She hopes to earn more money and improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 51-year-old mother of 5 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession, and he sells fruit such as apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is the sole earner responsible for feeding the entire family and covering the household's expenses. 

Khalida's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit to resell so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth, and earn a greater profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in the position to make the necessary purchase.

Therefore, Khalida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan in order to help her husband purchase the fruit he needs. She is very thankful to Kiva's lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for her husband's fruit retail business.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.es:
Dorcas es una mujer de 24 años de edad, es soltera tiene dos hermosos hijos de las edades entre 3 y 5 años, vive en una comunidad de Nahualá.
Dorcas con el afán de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la venta de banano desde hace cuatro años, pero para poder mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la venta de almacigo.
Gracias a Dios a Dorcas lo busca mucha gente y ha logrado prosperar por sus dos negocios, pero ella ahora quiere seguir brindando buenos servicios a los clientes ofreciéndoles una variedad de banano, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente, por tal razón ahora solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de bananos de seda, chocolate.
Dorcas tiene  las esperanzas de poder comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Dorcas is a 24-year-old woman. She is single and has two beautiful children of ages 3 and 5. She lives in a Nahualá community. In her eagerness to generate income and support her family, she has been selling bananas for four years now, but in order to improve her income, she also sells seedlings.                   

Thanks to God, Dorcas is sought after by many people and she has managed to prosper due to her two businesses. Now, she wants to keep giving good services to the customers, offering them a variety of bananas, but one of the difficulties she has is that she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she is now requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of silk bananas and chocolate.  
             
Dorcas hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy and sell silk bananas and chocolate.

loans.name: Plaza De Gallos Group

texts.es:
Plaza de Gallos es un grupo que se ubica en una comunidad mazahua muy pacífica rodeada de árboles muy frondosos y cuyos habitantes se caracterizan por su amabilidad. Debido a que no todos los caminos del lugar se encuentran en buenas condiciones, aún se puede ver a varias personas montando a caballo para llegar a los lugares más alejados. La principal actividad económica de esta región es el cultivo de maíz y la cría de borregos, entre otros animales. 
Don Andrés es uno de los miembros del grupo, es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 47 años y junto con Patricia formó una familia con seis hijos de los cuales ya solo tres dependen de la pareja.
Anteriormente, Andrés era comerciante en la ciudad de México, des afortunadamente enfermó y tuvo que regresar a su comunidad. “Realmente a mí siempre me ha gustado trabajar en el campo con los animales, si se conoce bien la actividad, podemos obtener muchos beneficios”. Fue así que hace 10 años, Andrés decidió comenzar a criar y vender borregos, pollos y pavos para obtener las ganancias necesarias para sostener a su familia. 
Además, Andrés también se dedica a la venta de madera que ya no utilizan las personas de la comunidad, por lo general la compran para cocinar alimentos ya que otorga a la comida un sabor distinto. 
Con el préstamo podrá comprar más corderos y alimento para mantenerlos en buenas condiciones ya que mientras mayor sea el peso del animal, también aumentan las ganancias de Andrés.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son Viviana y Sarai quienes invertirán en pollos; Abraham y Fidel, en borregos y Francisco, en cerdos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en los arcos del centro municipal, don Andrés viste un chaleco gris y  está sonriendo.
texts.en:
Plaza de Gallos is a group located  in a Mazahua community. It is very peaceful, surrounded by by leafy tree. Its residents are characterized by their friendliness. Because not all roads that lead there are in good condition, several people can still be seen riding horses to get to the more distant places. The main economic activity in the area is growing corn and raising sheep, among other animals.  

Andrés is one of the members of the group. He is a very hardworking man. He is 47 years old and with Patricia has a family with six children. Only three of them are dependent on the couple. 

Previously, Andrés was a merchant in the Mexico City. Unfortunately, he became ill and had to return to his community. “I've really always liked working in the fields with the animals. If you know the activity well, you can get a lot of profits”. That is why 10 years ago, Andrés decided to start to raise and sell sheep, chickens and turkeys to make the necessary earnings to support a family.  

In addition, Andrés also sells wood that some people in community don't use anymore. It's generally used to cook food, because its gives it a distinct flavor. With the loan, he will be able to buy sheep and feed to keep them in good health. The more an animal weighs, the more Andres' profits increase.  

The rest of the members of the group are Viviana and Sarai, who will invest in chicken,  Abraham and Fidel, who will invest in sheep, and Francisco, who will invest in pigs. 

*The photograph was taken by the arches of the town center. Andrés is wearing a grey vest and he is smiling.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Eldia

texts.en:
Eldia is 55 years old and married with four children. For the past eight years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Eldia works very hard to provide for her family.

Eldia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, soft-drinks, cigarettes, sugar, and  personal care products. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft-drinks, cigarettes, sugar, and personal care products

loans.name: Divilina

texts.en:
Dilivina is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Dilivina has been sustaining her business activities with her past 26 loans from NWTF.

Dilivina is requesting a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell in her food stall. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Enrique Santiago

texts.es:
Enrique es un hombre amable y perseverante que tiene 36 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de ocho hijos de las edades entre 5 y 15 años de edad, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Enrique con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos trabaja como piloto de mototaxi desde  hace cinco años, gracias a esta labor ha mantenido a su familia.
Enrique ahora se ve a la necesidad de adquirir un terreno donde pueda cultivar, pues lamentablemente el ahora aunque quisiera cultivar no tiene la posibilidad de hacerlo, Enrique a pesar de todo su esfuerzo cumplir esta meta no ha sido posible es por eso que ahora solicita un crédito para comprar media cuerda de terreno donde él pueda cultivar.
El gran sueño de Enrique es poder comprar otro mototaxi para seguir mejorado sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Enrique is a kind and persevering man. He is 36 years old, married and has a beautiful family of eight children. The family lives in the community of Sololá.

In order to obtain more income, and get his children ahead, Enrique has worked as a motorcycle taxi driver for eight years. Thanks to this work, he has supported his family.

Now Enrique sees the need to acquire some land where he can plant. Unfortunately, although he wants to plant, he doesn't have the possibility of doing it. Despite all of his efforts to achieve this goal, is hasn't been possible for Enrique. That is why now he is asking for a loan to buy a half cuerda of land where he can plant.

Enrique's big dream is to be able to buy another motorcycle taxi to keep improving his income.

loans.use: to buy a half cuerda of land to plant.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 38-year-old mother of 6 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a dried fruit and nut seller by profession. He sells dried fruit and nut mixes such as mewa, pista (pistachios), badam (almonds), etc. Her husband is the sole provider responsible for providing food for the entire family and covering the household's expenses.

Fatima's husband needs to purchase different types of dried fruits and nuts to resell so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn a greater profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not able to purchase the stock he needs.

Therefore, Fatima has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so she can help her husband purchase the above items for his business. She is very thankful to Kiva's lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruit and nuts for her husband's business.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 32 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and five children. Shabana’s husband has been running his own tailoring shop at the local market for five years and is the sole provider for the entire family. Shabana's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories such as pieces of cloth, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase these items.

Shabana is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to buy materials and accessories for her husband’s business. Her loan will help her husband to fulfill his business needs and increase his profits and income. Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy cloth, needles, and sewing machine accessories for her husband's business

loans.name: Matagofie

texts.en:
Matagofie is a 36 years old. She is separated with four children. For the past two years, Matagofie has run a small business selling pancakes in her community. She joined SPBD in April 2015 to gain access to capital.

Matagofie is requesting a loan to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, a frying pan, and other items. She hopes that the profit from her loan will support her family financially and help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, a frying pan, and other items

loans.name: Tolentina

texts.en:
Tolentina is 58 years old. She is a widow who lives in Liloy. For the past two years, Tolentina has been raising hogs.

Tolentina is requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to build a concrete pig pen. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig pen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fabrics, thread, and dressmaking accessories

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 42 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. She alone is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Shamim has also been doing her business of selling clothes for the past five years.

Shamim needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy these clothes. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs and to earn a more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance, Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her clothing business

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elina is 27 years old.

Elina has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Elina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and other seafood to sell.

Elina has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other seafood to sell

loans.name: Attia

texts.en:
Attia is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and two daughters. Her son has been running his own business of clothes selling for three years. Her son is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Her son needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means, her son is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore Attia is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her son to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her son can  increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. 

Attia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son increase his clothing business

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en: Shahlo is a 22-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children. Together with her family she lives in Tajikistan in a small region of Hamadoni.  Shahlo is a homemaker and mainly spends her time at home. She is very good at agriculture. She has 10 years of experience in it.  Shahlo wants to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting and get a good harvest. This loan will help her to offer her family a better quality of life and greater opportunity to improve their standard of living. Shahlo needs your support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Las Quebradas 2 Group

texts.es:
Don Emilio, tiene 66 años de edad, esta casado, es padre de 10 hijos, vive con su esposa y 3 de sus hijos y un nieto en una aldea de Yamaranguila, Intibucá. Toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos. El cultiva papas en forma grupal y en forma individual cultiva hortalizas como remolacha, coliflor y brócoli. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Don Emilio ha solicitado otro préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras en forma grupal, con el cual va comprar abonos,fungicidas e insecticidas, pago de preparación de tierra para siembra de papas, y brindarle asistencia técnica a los cultivos con el fin de mejorar la producción y los ingresos. Su meta es mejorar su condición de vida y continuar aumentando la producción.
El grupo se llama Las Quebradas 2, que se integra por 6 miembros, quienes han obtenido varios prestamos en la institución. Actualmente solicitan otro préstamo por 15,000 Cada uno, haciendo un total grupal de 90,000 lempiras, con el cual van a poder sembrar y darle mejor asistencia a sus cultivos. En la foto está Pascual, Mercedes, Robustiano, Calixto, Emilio y Lino a la derecha.
texts.en: Emilio is 66 years old. He is married and has 10 children. He lives with his wife, three of his children and one grandson in a village of Yamaranguila, Intibucá. He has worked his whole life farming basic grains. He cultivates potatoes as a a group, and vegetables such as beets, cauliflowers and broccoli, individually. He sells this production at the local market. Emilio has requested another loan of 15,000 Lempiras as a group, with which he will buy manure, fungicides and insecticides, and will pay for preparing the soil to grow potatoes and bring technical assistance to the crops with the purpose of improving production and earnings. His goal is to improve his life condition and to continue increasing production. The group is called Las Quebradas 2, which is formed by 6 members who have obtained many loans with the institution. Currently, they are requesting another loan for 15,000 each, making a group total of 90,000 lempiras, which will allow them to grow and give more assistance to their crops. On the photo are Pascual, Mercedes, Robustiano, Calixto, Emilio and Lino to the right.

loans.use: to buy manure, fungicides and insecticides, to pay for soil preparation for growing and helping with the cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans and onions to sell to customers

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman with six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elisa is 50 years old.

Elisa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall.

Elisa has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Libia  Del  Socorro

texts.es: Gracias por continuar apoyando la labor de Libia, mediante su anterior credikiva compró los insumos necesarios para la producción en su taller de confecciones como telas, hilos, botones y demás accesorios, los cuales mejoraron su productividad y rentabilidad; por eso envía un mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva “Gracias por su apoyo y colaboración, que Dios los bendiga”. Nuevamente está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará telas, botones e hilos, inversión que será de gran éxito, puesto que está respondiendo a la demanda de unos pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Thank you for continuing to support Libia’s work. With her previous loan, she bought the supplies necessary for production in her dressmaking workshop, such as fabric, thread, buttons, and other accessories, which improved her productivity and profits. This is why she sends a message to Kiva lenders: “Thank you for your help and collaboration, God bless you.” She is applying for another loan, with which she will buy fabric, buttons, and thread, an investment which will be very successful, as she is responding to the demand of the requests of her clients.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make uniforms.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan un padre de familia trabajador y luchador que trabaja de sol a sol para darle a su familia lo mejor él tiene 42 años de edad  y para generar sus ingresos se dedica a la venta de banano desde hace seis años, él cuenta con una hermosa familia de seis hijos de las edades entre 8 y 17 años. Esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad denominada chuisanto tomas.
Juan por ser un hombre responsable le preocupa ahora que no cuenta con mucho terreno donde poder cultivar, y mejorar sus ingresos, es por eso que él ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar una cuerda de terreno y poder cultivar en ella.
Juan sueña con poder construir una casa de block donde sus hijos puedan vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Juan is a family man, hard-working and determined, who works from sunrise to sunset to give his family the best. He is 42 years old, and to generate an income, he has worked in the sale of bananas for six years. He has a beautiful family of six children between the ages of 8 and 17. This humble family lives in a community named chuisanto tomas.
Because he is a responsible man, Juan is worried that he no longer has much land to farm in, and improve his income. This is why he has taken the decision to ask for a loan, which he will use to purchase 28 square meters of land and be able to farm in it.
Juan dreams of being able to build a brick house where his children can live better.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for farming.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
YAYA est le monsieur qui tient le mouton sur la photo.
Il rêve devenir un grand éleveur dans sa localité, cela lui permettra de beaucoup profiter. 
YAYA  est un éleveur  Malien, alphabétisé. Il est âgé  de 47  ans, marié, père  de  08 enfants qui sont  âgés  de 1 an à 16 ans  et  tous  non scolarisé. Sa femme  fait l’élevage  aussi.  
YAYA  fait l’élevage ovin depuis plus de 15 ans. 
Il  fait  recourt au RMCR  pour augmenter le nombre de ses moutons.
 Le profit qu’il  gagne lui permet de satisfaire certains besoins de ses enfants et sa femme . 
 Il s’approvisionne  dans le marché de la  localité et  revend dans le même  marché.
texts.en:
YAYA is the gentleman holding the sheep in the photo. He dreams of becoming a major livestock farmer in his town to allow for more profit. He is a Malian livestock farmer who is illiterate, 47 years old, married, and the father of eight children, aged 1 to 16, of whom none is in school. His wife is also a livestock farmer. 

YAYA has been raising sheep for over fifteen years. He has turned to RMCR to increase his number of sheep. The profit he earns will enable him to meet certain needs of his children and wife. He gets his supplies from the market in town and resells at the same market.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to sell after fattening them

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 47 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Genara requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins.

Genara has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: Omar tiene la edad  de 54 años, está divorciado. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida  y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado los préstamos con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Omar is 54 years old. He is divorced. With his loan, he plans to make the purchase of fertilizers and fungicides and pay for labor to help with the coffee, in addition to buying some seedling plants for replanting at the beginning of the rainy season. He will do this with the goal of increasing the density of plants by area, in addition to taking advantage of the good fertility of the soil, the climate, and other conditions that favor the cultivation of coffee. 

With these improvements in cultivation, he hopes to obtain some earnings and thus improve his living conditions and also invest a little more in the area that he cultivates and also accomplish some goals. 

This is the second loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any other loans previously from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies and coffee plants

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 43 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de seis hijos de las edades entre 13 y 21 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Miguel con el objetivo de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la venta de banano desde hace 10 años, gracias a esta labor ha logrado sacar adelante a la familia.
Miguel  es un padre de familia responsable que se ha puesto a ver las necesidades de su familia y una de las necesidades  más prioritarias de esta familia es la adquisición de un terreno donde puedan cultivar, pero lamentablemente él no cuenta  con el dinero necesario para poder comprar este terreno, por tal razón solicita un crédito para cubrir esta necesidad.
El gran sueño de este padre de familia es que sus hijos sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Miguel is a man of 43. He is married and has a beautiful family of six children with ages between 13 and 21. This beautiful family lives in a community of Slolá.

Miguel, with the goal of generating his income and supporting his family, has been selling bananas for 10 years. Thanks to this work, he has managed to raise his family.

Miguel is a responsible father of a family who has seen the needs of his family, and one of the highest priority needs of this family is the acquisition of a plot of land that he can cultivate. But unfortunately, he doesn't have the necessary money to be able to buy this land. For this reason, he is applying for a loan to cover this need.

The great dream of this father of a family is that his children become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy land for the next planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking oil, beans and onions to sell to her customers

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 51-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five sons and one daughter. Her children are doing their studies. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for eight years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Khalida is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. 

Khalida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BAKARY A est le monsieur qui tient le bélier sur la photo.
BAKARY A est un cultivateur malien, âgé de 47 ans, marié à une ménagère et père de 4 enfants âgés de 6 à 14 ans tous non scolarisés.
N’ayant pas été à l’école, BAKARY A exerce l’activité d’élevage ovine et bovine il y a 13 ans. Il s’approvisionne sur les marchés locaux et revend dans les mêmes marchés. BAKARY A emprunte de l’argent avec le RMCR pour  acheter beaucoup d’animaux  d’élevage. Le profit qu’il gagne lui permet de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
Il est souvent confronté au problème de mévente. Il se sent à l’aise d’exercer cette activité d’élevage car il se voit de participer au développement économique de sa communauté.
Son rêve est de devenir éleveur et exportateur des bovins et ovins dans l’avenir
texts.en:
Bakary A is the person holding a ram in the photo. Bakary A is a farmer from Mali. He is 47 years old. His wife is a homemaker. They have four children ranging from six to 14 years of age; none are in school.

Not having attended school, Bakary A has been raising sheep and cattle for 13 years. He stocks up at the local market and also resells there. He is taking out a loan from RMCR in order to increase his livestock. His revenues allow him to support his family.

He often has to face a slump in sales.Bakary A feels good about his livestock business as he sees himself participating in the economic development of his community. His goal is to raise cattle and sheep for export in the future.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Hazel works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Hazel is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. 

Hazel has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 58 years old and married with 10 children.

Eliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices and personal care products.

Eliza has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Eliza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices and personal care products

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea has always dreamed of having an extension of her sari-sari store business. She used her loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a farmer with one child. He loves raising animals, especially raising cattle and selling it. He has been engaged in this kind of business for five years already with the help of his wife who does a sari-sari store business to provide the daily needs of their family. Henry aims to increase his income and sell more cattle to his customers. He sells cattle to the market and he also has a customer who caters for a restaurant. To have good cattle and to sell good cattle can generate a greater income. He borrowed a loan to buy vitamins and food for the cattle.

In the future, Henry wants to renovate his house out of the income from his business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and food for the cattle.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 27 years old, single and has one child.

Emma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Emma has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Nekikokolima Taxi Drivers Group

texts.en: Ballack appreciates UGAFODE Microfinance who accorded him the previous loan that he managed to pay well and on time. Ballack joined Nezikokolima group became it was a developmental group in the community. As taxi drivers, some of them were driving other people's taxis since they could not afford to buy their own; they then formed a group in which they were compelled to save weekly with the vision of raising money to buy taxis for the members. They have since acquired two taxis and are continuing to save with the dream of making every group member a taxi owner. They appreciate the work that UGAFODE is doing in supporting small groups. With this loan, they will pool the money and top up their savings to buy a taxi for Ballack. They are hardworking and resilient.

loans.use: To buy a 14-seater taxi to generate income

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a mother of five children and manufactures slippers. She does this work to support her children. She asked for a loan to purchase materials for her slipper manufacturing business. Teresita is thankful for the help that the Cooperative has extended to her. She hope to expand her business in nearby towns.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her slipper manufacturing business

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Banco Mujer Tiempo De Esperanza Group

texts.es: Banco Mujer Tiempo de Esperanza es un grupo integrado por 4 socias de la comunidad de La Curia de Roxana. Todas viven en fincas que fueron otorgadas a familias por la institución del gobierno llamada actualmente INDER. Son señoras muy trabajadoras y con muchos deseos de superación. Todas buscan los mismos objetivos y debido a ésto formaron el grupo hace varios años. Tienen trayectoria con la Fundación y se caracterizan por su excelente comportamiento de pago. Se dedican a la actividad de la porcicultura. Erica es una joven con 25 años de edad, madre de dos hijos y vive en unión libre con el padre de ellos. Uno de sus hijos cursa la primaria. Inició su actividad productiva  con el fin de poder ayudar económicamente en su hogar, debido a que el salario de su compañero es bajo, ya que trabaja como peón agrícola en una bananera. Ella realiza su trabajo en la misma parcela que vive, ahí cria los cerdos y luego los vende en la comunidad sin descuidar a sus hijos. Todas buscan superarse para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas y sus familias. Las cuatro socias van a invertir en comprar cerdos y concentrado para engorde y luego venderlos, asi obtener ingresos y poder ayudar en el hogar.
texts.en:
“Banco Mujer Tiempo de Esperanza” is a group made up of four female members in the community of La Curia in Roxana. They all live on farms that were granted to families by the governmental institution currently called INDER. They are very hard-working ladies and they all want to get ahead in life. They all have the same objectives; for this reason, they formed the group several years ago. They have a history with the foundation and are known for their excellent payment record. They make a living by raising pigs. 

Erica is a 25-year-old young woman. She has two children and she is living with their father. One of her children is in primary school. She began her work with the goal of being able to help with the household expenses because her partner’s salary is low as he works as a farmhand on a banana plantation. She does her work on the same parcel of land that they live on. She raises her pigs there and then sells them to the community—all without neglecting her children. 

All of the members are looking to improve the living conditions of their families. The four members are going to invest in the purchase of pigs and feed for fattening the pigs, so they can sell them later and obtain income to help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Julio Alcides

texts.es:
Julio es un  joven de 25 años de edad, que vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua, junto a su esposa y sus hijos. Desde pequeño apoyó a su familia en las actividades de la finca, entre ellas la producción de café, la cual ahora es la principal fuente de ingresos para él y su pequeña familia.

Este joven maneja su finca bajo los criterios de certificación de comercio justo. Para este año, él se ha propuesto renovar una manzana de café, para lo cual está solicitando un financiamiento para asegurar las actividades e insumos que se requieren, y con ello incrementar los ingresos que le genera su finca.

El sueño de Julio es darle a sus hijos, mejores oportunidades para su crecimiento, por eso cada día se esfuerza y trabaja para mejorar la productividad de su finca.
texts.en:
Julio is a 25-year-old young man who lives in a rural community in the north of Nicaragua with his wife and children. He helped his family with the work on the plantation from a young age.
